It's been just a little under two months since the last Boheme Opera performance , but I still haven't quite got over what an emotional roller coaster I had that night.

BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Boston-based private equity real estate firm, Muirfield Investment Partners, is pleased to announce that blockchain specialist and CTO of IBM Blockchain, Gari Singh, has joined the firm as an advisor. Muirfield is leading the effort to reinvent and improve private equity investing through the use of blockchain technology and Mr. Singh’s technical expertise will help guide Muirfield’s efforts in both the near and long-term. As a Distinguished Engineer and the CTO of IBM Blockchain, Gari Singh has provided the guidance and leadership that has made IBM a leader in the blockchain space.

Jennifer Garner Spotted Out and About With Her Son , Samuel ! Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck have yet to have their very first official date, but that will soon happen. This time, it's Jennifer who will host the couple and their kids, including her newborn, Samuel. Samuel was born on February 6, 2013 in Los Angeles, California, USA, and is currently 7-weeks-old. The new couple and their son are now officially dating! Jennifer confirmed on Instagram on August 19 that the two were dating and shared a cute pic of them with Samuel on their anniversary.

MOUNT PLEASANT, Sanpete County — School officials are asking students who aren’t up to date on immunizations to stay home for several weeks as Sanpete County deals with a mumps outbreak. There are two confirmed cases of mumps in Sanpete County, according to North Sanpete School District Superintendent Dr. Sam Ray. One of those is a student in the school district, he said. Another potential mumps case is currently pending while health officials await test results, Ray said. Ray did not say which school the student who has mumps attends, but said North Sanpete High School is “involved” in the outbreak.

Is our efficient Tax Office killing this country? I’ve never seen a story where the Reserve Bank was urging the Government to give tax cuts. But that’s exactly what’s happening now, which partly explains why our economy is going off the boil. In fact, the implication from this historically unusual tale is that the Tax Commissioner, Chris Jordan and his team have been doing such a great job cracking down on excessive deductions claims, especially from business. Because of the productivity delivered via computer technology, the tax take for Government is surging.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel. It was the first expo that he organized with the support of the Saudi King and Crown Prince Salman bin Hamad al Saud who attended. The expo was held to showcase the best food in Saudi Arabia. “At this expo, we’re really trying to get a lot of the fresh produce from Saudi Arabia into Jeddah and other major Gulf cities. The reason for that is so that they can be available to people living in other parts of the world.

WASHINGTON, March 1 - Coming off a year of record-setting $1 billion-plus natural disasters, representatives of leading insurance companies said today that costs to taxpayers and businesses from extreme weather will continue to soar because of climate change. The insurers joined Sens. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) and Sheldon Whitehouse (D-R.I.) at a press conference to discuss the mounting financial impact of global warming. Both Vermont and Rhode Island last August felt the brunt of Tropical Storm Irene, one of the record 14 natural disasters in the United States last year that each caused more than $1 billion in damage.

Hudson Technologies Co.,* Pearl River, New York, has been awarded a maximum $148,514,169 fixed-price with economic-price-adjustment, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract for compressed gas and cylinder products. This was a competitive acquisition with two responses received. This is a five-year base contract with one five-year option period. Location of performance is New York, with a July 30, 2021, performance completion date. Using services are Army, Air Force, Navy, Marine Corps and federal civilian agencies. Type of appropriation is fiscal 2016 through fiscal 2021 defense working capital funds.

The centerpiece of the rebuild is the warehouse , which was constructed in 1943 , according to the date scrawled on it . The building was the first of its type in the country. It was constructed with two separate floors and was used as a storage facility, warehouse and office complex. After World War II, it served as office, warehouse and warehouse storage. It was abandoned when the building was purchased by a company and turned over to the owners of the warehouse. After the renovation, the building is now used as a warehouse , warehouse , and office building.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency, rather than by the current district system. More than half of voters backed the change in the island's first ever referendum, which saw a 45% turnout. Option A - one island-wide district - won with 6,017 votes, representing 52% of the final count. It means all 38 Guernsey deputies will be elected in a single vote on the same day, every four years, from June 2020. More stories from Guernsey and the referendum latest. Option A campaigner Deputy Carl Meerveld said he was "ecstatic and relieved."

Zoho offers a whopping 43 different applications in its Zoho One cloud suite , but it has more in the pipeline. It recently announced a new version of its Zoho One for Business, which is available to all customers in the US, UK, and Canada as a beta version, and it has now launched this new version globally. Zoho says it now offers "the broadest suite of software in the cloud and on-premise in the world, with more than 4,000 products in Zoho One for Business" (Zoho). The new version offers more than 100 new features.

Brands should resist the temptation to take on a hot-button issue in the Super Bowl as a way to stand out on TV, but in this case they couldn’t. This year, they’ve had the opportunity to be front and center and it worked in spades. In the first commercial of the evening, they took a stance on social injustice and gender equality in a bold and positive way. I was fortunate enough to be able to sit down in front of an audience (that’s a lot of audience members!) so that I could experience the ad.

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen, who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow, a journal of political research, literature, and art at Columbia University. She previously served as editor in chief of the Columbia Journal and blog editor at Asymptote and Words Without Borders. Had Poe lived to read Alejandra Pizarnik, she would have given him nightmares. Revered by writers such as Octavio Paz, Roberto Bolaño, and César Aira—the latter calling her “the greatest, and the last” poet—Pizarnik is one of the most important contributors to twentieth-century Argentine poetry.

The likeliest of sources stepped up for the Boston Red Sox on Sunday. David Ortiz, never one to shy away from the big moment, jacked a three-run homer off Joba Chamberlain in the ninth inning to give the Red Sox a 5-3 win over the Detroit Tigers at Comerica Park. The victory snapped Boston’s five-game losing streak and stopped the club’s streak of seven consecutive series ending in sweeps. Ortiz’s heroics obviously put the Red Sox over the top. But there was much more to Sunday’s win, so let’s go over some notes from the nationally televised affair.

With the economy beginning to stall , Ben Bernanke 's war on the nation 's savers rolls on . A year and a half after declaring the "worst depression" on record, America's central banker has not changed a single bit of the playbook. And we're only at the beginning of another round in this war on saving . Over the past few months , Ben Bernanke has delivered on the promise of a "liquidity crisis " in the markets. But now he may be on the verge of something even more ominous: He may be pushing the nation onto the edge of an actual debt-deflation cycle.

First, we looked at which major brands cost the most to maintain over the first 10 years of a car's life. We grouped all years of all models by brand to compute their average cost by brand. In order to estimate annual maintenance costs, we found the amount spent on every two oil changes (as oil changes are generally done every six months). German imports lead the list by a fair margin, which isn't too surprising. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, are among the cheapest, saving owners on at least $10,000 over ten years compared to a BMW.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at a museum in France. As reported in The Independent, the 1,000-year-old mummy was discovered in 2012 at the ancient Peruvian settlement of Pachacamac near Lima. French archaeologists, who found the mummy crouched in a fetal position, have been careful to preserve the integrity of the remains by keeping it in the same configuration as when it was discovered. The new exhibition at the Musee de Confluences in Lyon will explore various human representations of death in different ages and cultures from around the world.

Wallarm has raised $8 million in a Series A round of funding that will be used to help the company further develop and expand the capabilities of its application security platform. Wallarm is looking to gain share in the growing market for application security, with continued advancements to the company's Framework for Automatic Security Testing, or FAST, platform. On Oct. 22, Wallarm announced that it raised $8 million in a Series A round of funding, led by Toba Capital and including the participation of Y Combinator, Partech and Gagarin Capital.

The carrier operates 744 mainline planes that vary in size , carrying 50 to 366 passengers each . For a single passenger on most airlines, the experience is almost entirely predictable and boring. For a passenger with an itinerary, however, everything is new and different every time they board an A320, A321, A330, A340 or A350. The A320 is a true marvel: the biggest and most expensive wide-body plane in the world, with room for 653 passengers on a normal service, and up to 1,200 on an extra service.

Four-term Governor Terry Branstad officially begins his fifth term today . Branstad , a Republican , left office in January 2014 to become president of the National Governors Association. He was previously governor of Iowa, a Republican-dominated state, and the second-longest serving governor in the country behind Rick Perry. After his stint in Iowa, he returned to his former state and was elected governor again in 2010 as the first ever openly gay governor in the country. His first two terms as governor were marked by a battle with unions over public-sector cuts, with the unions ultimately prevailing.

The likeliest of sources stepped up for the Boston Red Sox on Sunday . David Ortiz , never one to miss a chance to do something good for an organization that has done so much good for him, got into a fistfight with a fan while trying to sell a $2.25 hot dog to the guy on the other side of the concourse at Fenway Park . The Red Sox, like the fans of the city, will be watching carefully to see if he is the one that gets thrown out by security and suspended, as the guy who started the altercation was, will be.

“The Monterey Bay has always been a great place to visit for its beautiful scenery. Now you can come for the beer!" Jeff Moses, owner of Night That Never Ends Productions, is hosting the 2011 Monterey Beer Festival, which is being billed as “the greatest assortment of beer ever assembled on the Central Coast.” On Saturday afternoon, June 11, more than 80 brewers will be pouring hundreds of the best beers from around the world. Monterey area chefs will make a wide variety of food available and live music will play throughout the day.

At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn, Jack Flynn saw a short man pin silver wings to his brother's uniform. Jack Flynn learned that this man, retired United States Army Air Corps Sgt. Alvin E. Kotler, was a friend of his brother who served with him in World War II. In addition to being close to William, the two men had another thing in common: They wanted to clear his name. At the wake for United States Army Air Corps Lt. William Flynn, Jack Flynn saw a short man pin silver wings to his brother's uniform.

Most Indians do n't ride horses or wear feathers , but in the movies , they always do . Watch this hilarious video which features an actor dressed in a traditional Indian outfit . Seth McFarlane loves Indians and this is no exception as seen in his new movie, "The Lone Ranger and Indian." "I've never been to an Indian reservation," the man who created the television series 'The Simpsons' told The New York Times. "But the Indians here are so much like my Indian friends that I can see myself living with them.

To involve private sector in healthcare, what is really required is a heavy increase in public sector investment to reach out to more people. The nation has a new health policy after 14 years. The long gap itself indicates the priority, or the lack thereof, accorded to a sector that is in need of some urgent attention and has deep linkages with the nation’s aspiration to grow faster and emerge as a strong economy in the global order. The new policy has proposed seven key shifts in organising healthcare services, among them a welcome change in primary care from selective to assured comprehensive care with linkages to referral hospitals.

We are recruiting for a Freelance Trainer Assessor to work with us at Apprentice Assessments Limited ( AAL ) . This is a great opportunity for you to get into the industry and improve your career prospects. As a part of the assessor team, you will help assess the training delivered by AAL’s training providers and report on any issues / problems found with training to our clients. This is an important role as you will be reporting directly to the senior assessors on the assessors team and this will give you a lot of independence within your role.

November 17 , 2015 12:55 a.m. Michael Hoeppner had to shed his Manhattan street manners . We realized we were standing next to a very small person who was not happy. November 16 , 2015 9:04 a.m. When I was a kid and I would visit family on the East Coast, we always took a train back to New York City, where they'd take us to Times Square. And we'd take the train down to the Empire State Building , and we'd stand there as it went round and round. It was kind of like standing on a big wheel.

John Tory has his first real competition in the mayor’s race. Jennifer Keesmaat, the city’s former chief planner, registered Friday before the 2 p.m. deadline to run for mayor. Keesmat said that she made the decision so recently that she didn’t have time to alert her parents that she was running. “It was a very impromptu decision but one that comes deeply from my heart and passion for this city,” she said, when asked if she was joining the race because of Premier Doug Ford’s announcement that he was cutting the size of council to 25 members.

Amitabh Bachchan is not just a legend for his contribution in Hindi cinema but also his inclination towards social welfare is also legendary. The legend is well documented in his autobiography but his contribution in the world of medicine and philanthropy has never been better described. During his last year of school, he received a call that his elder brother Shatrughan was critically sick and was going to die. He went to visit him, and when he arrived on the scene, he took him to the hospital where his brother was undergoing treatment. The treatment, however, didn’t work out, and his brother died.

A bride and groom in Canada spent their first night of marital bliss behind bars after their wedding party turns violent. A man was injured after his face was smashed and he suffered a concussion from a rock that ricocheted off the wall at a wedding venue in Newmarket, New Brunswick, police said. Two other men were arrested, one for assault. The incident was reported shortly after 3pm on Saturday. Witnesses said the fight began when a wedding guest tried to kick the back of the bride’s chair, leaving it in pieces.

Dundee has long been a city of rich character, great wealth and extreme poverty. If the new V&A can give it a transformational boost, it will be worth every penny. I declare an interest. I went to the embryonic Dundee University in the last year it was a college of St Andrews and, like many whose lives were touched by the city, I have retained a strong affection for place and people. Not everyone grew to love it. In these days, “clearing” sent hordes of last-minute placements to what they fondly anticipated as the cloistered life of Queen’s College, St Andrews.

The Frenchwoman who received the world 's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday, the first time that anyone has seen their new appearance after the surgery. The 25-year-old surgeon who performed the operation has been at it for almost eight years and had not revealed the new face to her family and friends until she went public with the results on Monday. Surgery went well as the patient says she now looks "better than ever," but there was a hitch: she did not know how she would look after the surgery.

Each year, the palike and state authorities ensure that Bangaloreans are forewarned before Diwali about being safe. However, just like the past years, over 60 firecracker-related casualties have already been reported in the city this year as well. Shockingly, this year kids aged between 4 and 14 have sustained eye injuries as a result of ignoring fire safety precautions. The city has been aglow since Tuesday with the festive spirit, but hospitals in city received a total of 60 casualties related to firecrackers. To add to this number however, since yesterday local clinics in several residential areas have been seeing patients coming in on an hourly basis.

At her weekly therapy sessions, Julie revealed her most uncomfortable secrets: depression, debt, childhood sexual abuse. Her psychiatrist at Massachusetts General Hospital would then type a summary into Julie’s computerized medical record. With that, more than 200 pages of sensitive notes became available to any doctor who cared for her within the sprawling Partners HealthCare system. She discovered this only when one doctor later referenced the notes. Julie, a 43-year-old lawyer, was unnerved, then angry. “The details are really nobody’s business,” she said. But Partners disagrees.

Maureen Wildes argues it is time to find out the true impact of the Vietnam War on the veterans 'in our society. They don't know what they did in the war.' For veterans and their families of the Iraq war, there is little doubt this conflict will have an impact on their lives for years. But for a majority of the population the Iraq war has been a relatively minor issue. It is a debate that has been raging for 15 years. But with the passage of time, not only are the arguments less passionate, but the stakes have been raised.

New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio isn ’ t visiting Israel until August . But that doesn ’ t mean that the city won ’ t be doing a lot of business there in the meantime. On Sunday, a day when the US and Israeli flags fly at half staff, there was an opening ceremony for the Israel-NYC Trade & Economic Growth Initiative, a new program that de Blasio announced on Monday. The idea, of course, is to create economic development opportunities for New Yorkers, Israelis and Israeli-Americans by linking the two communities’ efforts to attract business investments.

Margaret O’Brien, 69, moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971, got married, had three children and worked for the local council for more than 25 years as a dinner lady, meals on wheels driver, lollipop lady and cleaner. A spinal injury a few years ago meant she had to give up her job, leading her to apply for benefits for the first time. In 2015, she was told her disability payments had been suspended because she was an illegal immigrant. The letter informed her “of our intention to remove you from the UK to your country of nationality if you do not depart voluntarily.

England have called up Fulham's uncapped goalkeeper Marcus Bettinelli for the games against Spain and Switzerland, while midfielder Adam Lallana has withdrawn. Bettinelli, 26, was not in Fulham's squad for the first two matches of the season but has regained his place. First-choice keeper Jordan Pickford did not take part in the squad's main training session on Tuesday. Lallana has returned to Liverpool to have a groin strain assessed. The 30-year-old, who did not feature at the World Cup after an injury-disrupted season in 2017-18, joins Raheem Sterling in withdrawing from the squad.

The Duchess of Sussex 's maternity wardrobe may cost a royal sum , but yours does n't have to . Here's what to get her! The Duchess of Sussex' maternity wardrobe is, in many ways, like a child's bedroom. Here, we break down what she will be wearing for the birth of Prince Louis , which takes place in April, and then share the basics you can put together for her and your newborn, which may not come with baby furniture, but you will know what everything is.

Long flights can be rough on the body, so it’s not uncommon to see people walking around the plane to stretch their legs. However one woman took it even farther by performing a yoga flow in the middle of the aisle. Kate Kay, a yoga teacher who was traveling for training, was captured on a now viral video by another passenger, showing her performing leg stretches, camel pose and a forward fold. Dressed for the occasion in patterned yoga pants and wearing headphones, Kay seems unaffected by those around her as she goes through the moves.

The Korea Offshore and Shipbuilding Association has released numbers confirming the expectations of many analysts : the number of actively working vessels increased from 33 in January 2012 to 38 in December 2012 and the total vessel capacity is increasing by about 1.2% on a year over year basis. The Korea Offshore & Shipbuilding Association, (KOHSA) released a statement today, December 16, 2012, saying that it is aiming to achieve its target of building 50 new ships and submarines by the end of 2013 and 35 by the end of 2015, as compared with the target of 30.

Jennifer Garner Spotted Out and About With Her Son, Samuel! Jennifer Garner and Ben Affleck have yet to debut photos of their three-month-old son Samuel, but this afternoon, Jen stepped out in Pacific Palisades, Calif., with her bundle of joy… all covered up, of course! The glowing mommy took her baby boy for a check-up at a pediatrician's office and was all smiles as pushed him along in his stroller. She even bent down and cooed at Samuel, who is, no doubt, adorable just like his big sisters Violet and Seraphina.

2 Men Blamed Slaying Victim for Problems, Taped Confession Shows : Crime: Admission comes in the trial of a man charged in the death of an activist in the Estonian community. An Estonian refugee and his alleged accomplice had planned to kill themselves because they were hungry and broke after the Estonian community abandoned them, but they decided to kill a North Hollywood woman they blamed for their problems first so she could not laugh at their deaths. The admission came in a taped confession played Tuesday for a San Fernando Superior Court jury in the murder trial of Peter Sakarias, 24.

Nine of the 11 Yavapai County finalists in the Optimist International Essay Contest are back row , left to right, left, and right. (From left to right in each photo are Mariah and Emily; Mariah and Emily, Emily and Emily; Emily and Emily; Emily and Emily; and Emily, Emily and Mariah.) Mariah, from Prescott, Arizona, is in the bottom row, in the middle, in the second row, and on the right. As the final contest deadline nears for Yavapai County’s Optimist International Essay Contest , only a small handful of finalists have been selected.

President Barack Obama has postponed two stops on his four-nation Asian tour because of the government shutdown . The White House said Obama will reschedule his visits to both Singapore and Indonesia on Saturday, when he is scheduled to meet with top leaders of the region. Obama made clear in an interview with CBS on Thursday he would continue to travel on the Asian tour. But the postponement of the two stops is a disappointment for Asia watchers who were looking forward to seeing the Obama administration at the center of the world's most populous continent.

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale. The theme of the concert is the “Discovery of Jazz,” tracing its roots from the beginning of the 20th Century to the present. The jazz ensemble, led by director Christopher Dorsey, earned First Place in this year’s Essentially Ellington High School Jazz Competition and Festival in New York City, the nation’s most prestigious high school jazz competition. The band also earned First Place in Savannah, Georgia’s Swing Central competition.

OMAHA , Neb . – Nebraska men & apos ; s basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion of sexual assault after a woman told police she had consensual sex with Biggs the morning after the Huskers’ Elite Eight victory over Kentucky at the College Basketball Invitational. According to a police report, the woman woke up the morning of Oct. 26, after having consensual sexual relations with Biggs, at his apartment in Omaha. The woman told police she didn’t immediately report the incident because it happened in her bedroom.

Girls Like Biology , Boys Like Physics ? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls or boys. According to some studies, however, girls are more likely to be attracted to sciences, while boys prefer humanities. Why? It's a question worth thinking about. Here are some factors that may influence your interest in this topic:

The fact that there are lots of females working in tech and that it’s considered a “girl’s job.”

That there’s more female professors than male, which helps create a wider selection of career choices for women.

The M12 FUEL 1/4 in . Impact Wrench optimizes torque in tight spaces . This lightweight yet powerful impact wrench has a compact design for easy portability and storage . Features and Benefits:

Impact Wrenches

This impact wrench is perfect for those who work in tight spaces where space is at a premium and are looking for an impact wrench with the right weight and size . The M12 is lightweight at only 20 g but has enough power to do all the tasks you need . Tougher Tension

With this impact wrench, torque is applied at a very low level of tension.

AUGUSTA, Maine (AP) — The Maine Warden Service says a hunter's body has been found in the town of Shirley. Officials say 54-year-old Dean Poulin of Waterville was hunting near Routes 6-15 on Saturday when he was separated from the rest of his hunting party. When he failed to return at the end of the day, members of his party searched for him. Poulin's body was located in a clear-cut in the area where he had been hunting. Officials say his death is believed to be the result of a medical incident.

Mr. Hidetoshi Sakuma has been serving as President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank, Ltd. since March 1, 2009. He joined the Bank in April 1976. His previous titles include Director of Market Sales, Director of Business Planning, Director of Main Branch Sales and Managing Executive Officer in the Bank. He obtained his Bachelor's degree in Political Economy from Waseda University in March 1976. Mr. Osamu Kimura has been serving as Vice President and Representative Director in The Chiba Bank, Ltd. since June 2016. He joined the Bank in April 1981.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future. The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in the city and ensures its operations go smoothly. Plastic, cardboard, glass and other common materials are moved, pulverized or shifted for reuse in a compound on North Bentsen Road. The operation presents a profitable and a facilitation of services toward the public good. Clean streets, quality drainage systems and maintaining the mission of Keep McAllen Beautiful are among the services of working this sector, Alonzo said. Poor products harm the community, and her work turns the negatives into positives.

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara. What was initially reported as a three-car crash yesterday, police now believe were two separate crashes in almost the same spot near Apata Station Rd. A St John Ambulance spokeswoman said two people were taken from the scene to Tauranga Hospital - one in a serious condition and one in a moderate condition. Police were first called to the area about 1.10pm. "Two crashes took place within a short space of time at the same location. It appears a ute went off the road, and after that a crash occurred between a car and a truck.

In two weeks , two people have been bit by rattlesnakes . The first was on April 23 on Mount Shasta, north of Sacramento. She was bitten on the left buttock and leg by the same one. The second was bitten in the left foot by a different rattlesnake. The first victim was treated at a hospital and released. Rattlesnakes have long been recognized as some of the most dangerous snakes in California, with bites often resulting in complications and fatalities. Although both rattlesnake bites were considered serious, according to the coroner’s report released Tuesday , they were minor, with no lasting effects.

With the economy beginning to stall, Ben Bernanke's war on the nation's savers rolls on. A few of these funds even pay juicy double-digit yields — like the one my Permanent Wealth Investor subscribers have earned 20% on in two years. Dividend harvest funds: These funds buy shares in companies that are about to pay a dividend, and then sell the stock after the dividend is paid. By doing this, they can rotate through companies with different payment dates, and thereby achieve a high dividend payout. The problem is that shares generally trade lower after a dividend is paid, by the amount of the dividend.

The fourth episode of Aaron Sorkin’s The Newsroom is called “I’ll Try to Fix You.” That may as well be the title of the whole series. Like Sorkin’s The West Wing, the show wants to fix America, this time through the story of Will McAvoy (Jeff Daniels), a successful, cynical and bland cable-news anchor who decides that he, and journalism, and yea, democracy, can do better. Which means what? Will’s producer/ex-girlfriend MacKenzie McHale (Emily Mortimer) explains: “Reclaiming the fourth estate.

Seabees from Naval Mobile Construction Battalion (NMCB) 7 and members of the U.S. Army Alpha Company, 427th Brigade Support Battalion, stand in formation during a transfer ceremony at Camp Moreell, Southwest Asia, May 23. Seabees operated Camp Moreell, named for Adm. Ben Moreell, “Father of the Seabees,” for almost 10 years as the main Seabee ground base and assembly point for many Sailors who deployed across Southwest Asia before transferring responsibilities to the Army. The primary hub for Seabee deployments to and from Iraq and Afghanistan was closed during a ceremony held on Ali Al Salem Air Base, Kuwait, May 23.

It was a situation which baffled many around the world, let alone the passengers on board the British Airways plane. Yesterday a British Airways passenger jet due to fly from London to Dusseldorf landed in Edinburgh by mistake after the incorrect flight plan was given to its pilots. The BA3271 flight was operated by German firm WDL Aviation - which was responsible for the aircraft and cabin crew - on behalf of BA as part of a leasing deal. It is understood one possibility is that on its final flight on Sunday, the plane had flown to Edinburgh and back and so the same flight plan was repeated again on Monday morning.

There are plenty of products out there that make it possible to create narrated walk-throughs of content, but most of these tend to be either static PowerPoint-style slide shows or video-based walk-throughs. What if instead of static images and files, you wanted to walk people through live Web pages, or even a mix of live Web pages and static content such as images and media? That's the purpose of FlowGram's Flowgrams. Available at flowgram.com, Flowgram is a free beta Web service that lets users combine live Web pages and other content and create a shareable narrated walk-through.

Jan. 5 , 2017 , 11 a.m . Box V2 scans for weak passwords and prevents you from accidentally submitting incorrect log-in credentials to the Internet. Jan. 5 , 2017 , 4 : 30 p.m. The first update for Windows 7 and 8.1 includes the April 2016 security bulletins for these versions of Windows and other updates for other Microsoft operating systems, including Windows Server 2016. Microsoft has also made security updates for Internet Explorer, including for Internet Explorer for Windows, Windows Media Player and Windows Mail. This week's Windows 8.1 update fixes two critical vulnerabilities.

Micron Technology (MU) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts' estimates. NEW YORK (TheStreet) -- Micron Technology (MU - Get Report) stock is climbing Tuesday after the company reported third-quarter earnings and revenue above analysts' estimates. Over its May-ended quarter, the semiconductor specialist earned 79 cents a share, 9 cents higher than what analysts surveyed by Thomson Reuters expected. Revenue of $3.98 billion beat forecasts of $3.89 billion. By early afternoon, shares had popped 5% to $32.83. "We rate MICRON TECHNOLOGY INC (MU) a BUY.

There has been a wealth of recent research that has demonstrated that dementia patients greatly benefit from participating in art and creativity activities, but the specific types of activities that benefit them the most are still unclear. The study, which was presented today at the American Psychiatric Association’s annual meeting in San Francisco, was conducted with patients and caregivers from four different sites in the Netherlands. The researchers found that participants who did more art or creative activity showed improved memory and language abilities, as well as better ability to handle stress and live a life with purpose.

January 29, 2015: Follow the money. Economic activity is shrinking and shortages increasing because of the factional fighting and especially because two governments claim to rule the entire country. Then there is all the Islamic terrorist violence. While most Libyans appreciate the help from Islamic terrorist groups in overthrowing Kaddafi in 2011, since then these groups have become more of a menace than the Kaddafi era secret police ever were.

Cricket is one of the most beloved and popular sports in the world. When cricket is played in the national stadiums it brings in millions of fans to these places. For many years, the game of cricket has been attracting more people to watch the sport. The cricket lovers in different countries have been able to appreciate the quality of the cricket.

Dec 25 ( Reuters ) - The Saudi market fell on Tuesday , as plunging oil prices pressured petrochemical stocks as the kingdom faces pressure to boost its spending and diversify its energy sources. Traders said the oil rout would weigh on Saudi petrochemical firms , which could face increased competition from Chinese rivals for contracts to build new power and petrochemical plants, offsetting a weaker U.S. dollar . Saudi Aramco, the state-owned oil firm, fell 1.8 percent in the week ended Dec. 14, its biggest one-day drop since the global oil shock, according to Reuters data.

Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen , his agency said Tuesday . According to KeyEast Entertainment, a subsidiary of KeyEast Group and an affiliate of Korean Entertainment Rights, Kim and his agency were in discussion on a potential new television deal and he is "exploring new ideas." He will begin his search for a new network in the coming month, they said. Kim, whose name has been associated with hit dramas like "I Live Alone" and "I Do, I Do," made headlines in July when he said he was considering a comeback in 2017.

We had a very colourful guest in our studio today. Meet "the Union Jack man" who's earned the title of the Royal family's biggest fan. Terry Hutt from Weston-super-Mare has spent a lifetime following the Royal's around the country, even spending 10 days camped outside St Mary's hospital in London for Princess Charlotte's birth, at the age of 79. Prince Philip will not make any further official appearances in the South West after announcing his retirement. The 95 year-old will step down from service in the autumn and there are no scheduled engagements in the West Country before then.

The company said improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost contributed to increased profitability during the quarter. JK Paper on Tuesday reported a 72.26 percent jump in standalone net profit to Rs 120.26 crore for the third quarter ended December 2018 on account of improved realisation, better operating parameters and reduced finance cost. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 69.81 crore in the October-December quarter last year. Total income during the quarter under review rose 10.94 percent to Rs 883.11 crore. It stood at Rs 796.01 crore in the December quarter of 2017-18, JK Paper said in a BSE filing.

This charming 3 bedroom home is conveniently located just 1/2 mile from shopping and restaurants, across the street from hundreds of acres of DEP of protected lands, and within close proximity to the many activities that out of towners travel to experience in the Catskill Mountains. Tube the Espous, bike the rail-trail, visit the world's largest Kaleidoscope, reminisce with a stroll through Woodstock, or ski three major resorts all within a 20-30 minute drive. This cozy home with one car garage is sited on a 1.2 acre lot with areas that are ideal for a fire-pit surrounded by Adirondack style chairs.

Elvira Alonzo sees recycling as essential to the future . The McAllen public works director oversees the recycling program in El Paso County. The county also collects recyclables, including scrap metal, glass, paper products, aluminum and batteries. Alonzo said McAllen residents should start recycling as soon as possible. As a community, we need to start acting now to reduce our impact on our environment and protect what is precious to us. El Paso has the lowest recycling rate of any Texas county, according to the city. Alonzo said recycling has been a huge undertaking that will benefit both the city and our community as a whole.

Everyone knows where and what they were doing when this nightmare called 9/11 happened. Chuck was getting ready for work and I was on the computer watching FOX when those horrible images appeared. I had the TV on mute so all I saw were flames coming out of one of the Towers in NY. I turned on the sound and the words were incomprehensible. Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to launch the club’s branch in North West London and give the local community an opportunity to play baseball. Herts Baseball Club has been based at Grovehill Ballpark in Hemel Hempstead since it was founded in 1996. It has grown into one of the biggest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams playing in the various adult and youth leagues of the British Baseball Federation. In 2013 the club recognised that in order to accommodate the growing number of new players who want to play baseball, the club needed to expand.

"I've been trying to figure out where it came from. I don't even know if it came from the Internet or something like that." He added: "It's a lot of fun to be here."

(WXIA) -- New Year's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year. This year, the Governor's Office of Highway Safety is doing more to prevent alcohol-related crashes. According to a release, law enforcement will distribute 50,000 drink coasters in some of the state's busiest bar districts. The coasters will contain a QR code to guide patrons to a directory of services that will help them get home safely if they've had too much to drink. THe GOHS also offers a smartphone app that connects users to cab and tow companies. Check out the Drive Sober app.

A senior citizen, 85-year-old Baburam Patil, was turned away for the third time when he to pay his water bill at the Maharashtra Jeevan Pradhikaran (MJP) office in Sai Centre, Ambernath. Patil, a resident of the area, was told there was a shortage of manpower. He has been trying to pay his bill, unsuccessfully, for weeks now. “This office is close to my house; the other centre is far away. I have always paid my bill here. While they always create a fuss each time, they eventually take my payment.

The company said improved realisation , better operating parameters and reduced finance cost contributed to increased profitability during the quarter. Earnings from operations rose by 15.4 per cent over a year earlier to 1.7 billion euro ($2.3 billion). Excluding impairment charges, earnings were 674 million euros. Revenues fell by 2 per cent to 2.5 billion euros, while operating income rose by 2.5 per cent to 2.3 billion euros. Cash flow from operating activities rose by 6.7 per cent to 2.5 billion euros from 2.1 billion euros in 2013. The company said it had made good progress in reducing its debt load over the last few months.

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law requiring police to collect a DNA sample from anyone arrested on suspicion of a felony. The law is part of a 2004 voter initiative that gradually expanded the categories of people in the criminal justice system from whom DNA is collected with cheek swabs. The four plaintiffs are challenging a provision that went into effect in 2009 and requires the DNA sampling from all felony arrestees, regardless of whether they are ever charged or convicted of a crime.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku, Chromecast, or Fire TV are, but Nvidia’s Shield TV is still a capable streaming media player, so much so that it made its way on to our list of the best streamers you can buy. Still, if you own one, you might be getting jealous as you see support for Amazon’s Alexa voice-powered assistant popping up on other devices left and right. Fret not, however, as Nvidia has announced that its Android-powered streaming box will be getting support for Alexa control as well.

New Zealand ’ s Abortion Supervisory Committee is appealing a High Court judge ’ s decision that said there is no such thing as the right to die. The committee is asking a Supreme Court judge to review the judgement because it says it is based on flawed interpretation of a High Court ruling, which says that the concept of the “right of self-determination” does not include a right to end life itself, even when the right has been exercised. Justice Mark Bennett’s High Court ruling, which is now being challenged, says there is simply no such thing as a right to die in New Zealand.

BLAKELY, Pa. --More than 170,000 pounds of food was handed out to those in need in Lackawanna County. Newswatch 16 found cars lined up outside Peckville Assembly of God Church waiting to take advantage of the generosity. The church gave out hundreds of hams, turkeys and other meat as well as fresh produce and toiletries. "I do not know how to explain it to you but the food helps me pay medical bills because I save money here and I pay my bills, ya know?" said William Carter of Dickson City. Peckville Assembly of God Church gives out free food every Friday.

The Board of Intermediate Education Karachi (BIEK) on Thursday reported 20 cases of cheating to the board’s committee looking over the matter. According to the board, 16 students were in possession of cheating materials, whereas three candidates were found using mobile phones and another tore an examination copy. The BIEK had on Wednesday reported at least one case of impersonation, while another student was said to have made away with his answer script from the examination centre among eight other cases. In another incident a student was caught using a smartwatch to solve his paper.

Google recently launched real estate features including home services advertising and will soon unveil a mortgage comparison tool. Google investment arms back two online real estate marketplaces and one agent-matching site. The Internet giant is pioneering 3-D virtual tour and smart home technology. A top-producing real estate broker recently received an invitation to attend an exclusive workshop at the headquarters of Google. The purpose of “Google Ignite Real Estate,” an invitation-only event slated for mid-September, is to stoke interest and discussion around how to use Google tools, products and data to beef up the online real estate marketing and digital strategies of real estate brands.

Will Chelsea switch gears vs. Arsenal ? Judging by his body language , you would never think Chelsea is only interested in the Premier League . This is not just a matter of keeping up with the Premier League , but also gaining the confidence to deal with the Champions League , which will start next week when Chelsea face Arsenal . The Blues are not interested in a title challenge next year. Chelsea has only one ambition : Champions League . In the past week, the Blues have lost a Premier League match against Fulham , lost a cup tie against Barcelona , and won a Europa League game against Olympiakos.

The ride-hailer returns to Taiwan with a redesigned business model that it claims will meet local regulations this time . As it seeks to regain public trust after years of bad press, the company has promised to give riders a "high-quality ride," improve safety, and reduce environmental impact, including cutting greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 20 percent from 2015 levels. The company also promised to be "open" and "transparent," and said it will not engage in the kind of predatory behavior seen in US and some other foreign companies.

Can you put a price on faith ? That is the question churchgoers are asking as the tradition of tithing has fallen to an all time low at a time when churchgoing has reached a new record high of nearly 20 million, an analysis of government data finds. "It is a real question: can the government tax us on our faith?" asked David Moore, a former president of the National Religious Retirement Association. "We believe that government should not tax our faith. But it seems like this is what we are getting."

Malawi Parliament has started soliciting views on interest rate capping bill which an opposition legislator moved in the 193 strong House to stop commercial banks from charging high interest rates. Alekeni Menyani, the chairman of the joint Public Affairs Committee, Women Caucus and Government Assurance Committee said there was indeed need for a law to regulate bank interest rates. "But all the players should discuss this important issue with sober minds. There should not be emotions. We should all be guided by facts," said Menyani. Chairlady of Women Caucus Jessie Kabwila said the bill was very important for women.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China , with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese market last year and refusing to allow Chinese advertisers to participate in its campaigns. That's been a big loss for the company. Google is not a monopoly in China, which has the world's second-highest internet penetration rate. That said, China is the most important user of Google's services, including search, mapping, e-mail and YouTube. Some Chinese search engine users say they prefer Google to other Chinese-language rivals like Baidu.

It is easy to lose democratic mechanisms but difficult to get them back, says the incoming General Secretary of the Lutheran World Federation. Speaking at St Paul's Cathedral in London, Bishop Katharine Jefferts Schori challenged Christians to take action against the world's injustices. The Catholic Church in Scotland is being questioned over plans to charge parishioners for the cost of going to see the Pope on his visit to Glasgow. “Eleanor’s courgette has grown so much this past week, and she’s checking it all the time”.

FORT LAUDERDALE — The Dillard High School Jazz Band will hold a concert on Oct. 22 at the African-American Research Library and Learning Center in Fort Lauderdale. “It’s all about sharing the African American music with the community at large,’’ said senior Jazz Band director Scott Brown. The school’s jazz music program has been a staple since its inception at Dillard in the 1960s, as it was at the historically black colleges and universities. Dillard, which is more than 35 years old, is a public charter school in Miami Gardens, a city with the third-highest percentage of African-American residents in the country.

South Bend (IN) -- Thursday morning, the Irish took the practice field for the final time before Saturday's Blue-Gold game. One of the biggest questions the team faced entering spring ball still has yet to be answered: who will step up at linebacker? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is the closest thing the unit has to an 'absolute' at this point, but he seems ok with the uncertainty. He believes the position has made big strides over the last month and a half, but is in no rush to have everything in place with Week 1 still months away.

Mindfulness and meditation have made deep inroads into the corporate world . The benefits are proving out , notes this writer in a recent article on business for the Huffington Post . One of the primary reasons that businesses are embracing these practices is to reduce absenteeism and sick days, which is a good thing . For employees and managers, mindfulness and meditation are beneficial on many levels, including stress management, self-esteem, improved productivity, better focus and concentration , and, of course, happiness . But a growing body of academic research suggests that these practices can also improve the performance of leaders and executives .

Pine Forest 3 , Booker T. Washington 2 : Timmy Williams finished with two hits and one RBI to help lift Pine Forest 3 to a 13-3 win over Booker T. Washington in a Division III Class A quarterfinal on Thursday at Booker T. Washington’s Pine Crest field. Williams, who is 6 feet, 5 inches and 215 pounds, also was named to the All-Division III Team and was selected as the Pine Crest player of the year. He’s in the thick of a big race in the Division II Class A-II playoffs. He is 1-1 against Pine Forest this year.

LORD Of The Rings star Liv Tyler headed out with just her husband for the day. The Hollywood star could hardly hide her smile as she watched the horse race on day two of Cheltenham Festival, on March 15. Dressed in all black, the mum of three smiled brightly as she peered through her binoculars to peek at the race. The brunette beauty wore a black silk dress that fell to just above her ankles, with a butterfly patterned cuff and belt around her waist. She added a wide-rimmed black hat, and clutched a small black handbag with a floral design for Ladies Day at the festival.

From M1917 to M1A2 , American tanks have dominated the battlefield . The U.S. Army and Marine Corps are on high alert following an unprecedented spate of Islamic State group attacks across the world, and they say they are preparing for a fight they’ll be ready for when the fighting starts. This week’s M1A2 variant of the tank, built by Northrop Grumman , is equipped with the latest version of the company’s APS-129 155mm chain gun. It’s also fitted with an upgraded electronic warfare suite and other improvements. The gun can fire 155mm rounds, a significant upgrade from M1917's 120mm M2A2 gun.

Girls Like Biology, Boys Like Physics? We all have our stereotypes about which subjects appeal more to girls or boys. Well, in perusing a new report on the Advanced Placement program, I was intrigued to discover some hard data to help shed light on the matter. In addition to reporting participation on AP exams by racial and ethnic groups, the College Board's eighth annual "AP Report to the Nation" includes the gender breakdown for all subjects tested. The data are for public school test-takers from the class of 2011. Some of what I learned may not surprise readers.

As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof Project , the Standardisation Directorate in the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority ( MCCAA ) has produced a standardisation report on the Energy Performance Contract ( EPC ).The report examines the key issues related to the implementation and usage of EPCs, and aims to support stakeholders in developing the necessary legislation and practices to improve energy efficiency in the buildings sector in Malta. EPCs can play a crucial role in the efficient management and operation of a building. Achieving the desired energy savings in buildings can improve the environmental sustainability of the buildings and the associated energy costs.

It 's Tax Day : Remember the Krewe of Procrastinators on Loyola Avenue ? Every once in a while , the Krewe gets together on a Sunday, with an open mike session for everyone to show up to sing their favorite song or play their favorite instrument and talk about their favorite thing in the world -- procrastinating! What 's a procrastinator ? It 's someone who procrastinates. There are two kinds: The first is someone who procrastinates until the last possible minute in order to spend the day doing something else that they can do, like cleaning out their closets or writing a report for school.

Why we love it : Few things are as stylish as a goodnight ’ s sleep . After all , after a long day spent working , you want to drift off into a peaceful state of relaxation and drift off for hours and hours before finally settling down to sleep . Well , a good night s sleep has so many health benefits that it’ s often used as a preventative against insomnia . There are also many studies showing that after a good night s sleep, your body heals itself faster and you sleep longer , so you are well on your way to building a healthier and stronger body .

Vodafone has announced changes to its roaming data charges . The new changes will benefit those who useless than 5MB of data every month . This means that you would only need to pay £2 a month if you travel between the UK and Ireland on a mobile phone contract that has included a £50 unlimited data plan for six months or longer. You would not be charged a penny for the extra 5MB that you are entitled to. This means that in order to keep the £2 a month unlimited data deal you will be required to use less than half your data allowance.

BASEL, Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases the H1N1 flu becoming resistant to Tamiflu, which it calls a very low percentage. A good sign is that the people who had the resistant strain have not passed the disease on to other people, said David Reddy, leader of Roche's Tamiflu pandemic task force. And the resistant variety has been like the widespread version of the virus in that it typically produces only mild symptoms. The 13 cases were scattered around the world in Europe, the United States and Asia, said Reddy.

Sign on to RootsAction’s petition to the nation’s mayors and police chiefs affirming your support for the right to unfettered peaceful protest. Occupy Wall Street demonstrators won a major victory on Friday when Mayor Bloomberg and Brookfield Properties, the owners of New York City’s Zuccotti Park, backed down on their demand that the activists temporarily vacate the park for a cleaning and subsequently abide by new rules banning sleeping bags, much gear and even lying down on the premises. Demonstrators in numerous other cities weren’t nearly as fortunate.

The Weeknd will team up with Daft Punk for a performance at the Grammy Awards . LOS ANGELES ( AP ) — Pop superstar Taylor Swift will perform at this year's Grammy Awards . "We're really honored by this nomination," said Swift, who is nominated for her album 1989. "It means a lot. We're really happy. We think we're gonna do OK, but we've had our ups and downs over the years. We've always been really happy with each other, and hopefully this is another step to making it even better."

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website . The letter was signed by the former president and contained praise for Butler’s work on behalf of LGBT people, as well as an apology for the country’s actions against the LGBT community in recent years, including the repeal of the ‘Defense of Marriage Act.’

However, it has also drawn criticism from LGBT activists, who have expressed concerns over its potentially harmful impact on the LGBT community. They say that although the Obama letter was a good gesture, it should not have been made available in a public way.

About 300 villagers from Kandal province locked in land disputes with private companies delivered petitions to embassies in Phnom Penh yesterday, before protesting in front of the provincial hall and calling for Prime Minister Hun Sen to help them. Villagers told the Post they wanted an end to land disputes caused by companies that had “seized their land”, adding that they would “rather die” than go home without a result. They said authorities had ignored their pleas for help while the companies had used the court system to have villagers who complained about the acquisitions arrested.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow . One needs to look only at the considerable increase in the number of companies registered in Russia . As of 2015 , it was recorded that there are more than 2,100 IT-based companies operating in Russia . All this indicates that it will be a market where there will be continued growth and innovation in the IT sphere . In order to attract and retain talented IT experts, in particular IT professionals from IT companies , it is vital that they have the freedom to work according to their personal and professional wishes and needs , as long as the conditions of their employment are satisfactory .

A report is expected to be released Tuesday detailing how an unknown cyber hacker broke into South Carolina 's computers in late May and altered or deleted records for nearly 3,400 voters in the state. The hacking is believed to be the first time in recent history that electronic voting machines have been breached by a foreign hacker. "This has never happened to me before and it’s certainly never happened to my family before, so that’s quite a thing to take on," said a woman named Susan who lives in a rural community about 20 miles north of Myrtle Beach.

The New York Knicks approach the quarter-mark of the schedule with a middling 9-9 record as they aim to end their season with a positive record. It’s hard to tell just how this team got to this place, because the roster has changed drastically in just six games. With this new look, however, we’re beginning to get a clearer picture of who are the Knicks and how they’ll get to a postseason berth. Let’s start out with the players who have stood out for the Knicks in their last two games. A couple of things stand out.

The General Accounting Office reported last month that the Small Business Administration needs to improve its planning for a new database system. SBA had planned to bring the Electronic Loan Input Processing System (ELIPS) which is used to track government-backed small-business loans online last week but GAO said the agency has not shown the project is a good investment. SBA said it did not have time to complete the analysis required by the Clinger-Cohen Act because Congress demanded the system be in place by June 30. The U.S. Army Materiel Command has published a guide for improving teamwork between agencies and contractors.

BATON ROUGE, LA (WAFB) - Golfers in Baton Rouge could have fewer places to tee off after the findings of a study aimed at improving public courses was unveiled and recommended reducing the number of courses from seven to five. On a chilly winter Tuesday evening, with the sun setting fast, John Stewart almost had the City Park Golf Course to himself. Walking to the green, Stewart said he golfs at City Park five or six times a year. "You can come out and walk around for, depending on your age, six to 10 bucks," Stewart said.

The Board of Intermediate Education Karachi ( BIEK ) on Thursday reported 20 cases of cheating to the board ’s anti-corruption bureau ( ACB ) for investigation in two schools in the Sindh capital. The board ’s anti-corruption wing said it found evidence of “some teachers’ indulging in illegal activities in the schools and some teachers cheating students” among others. A special committee will submit a report to the ACB. A board official, who did not wish to be identified, said a total of 20 cases had been registered so far against teachers of both the schools.

Tech execs discuss the impact automation technologies are having on their organisations . For many organisations and their workers , machine learning has the potential to deliver significant efficiencies in the future. And yet , only a few organisations are using it to their full advantage. This session will explore the use of machine learning technology in organisations across a range of disciplines and examine how they’re using it to drive productivity and business growth. It will also explore how technology is enabling organisations to use data insights to transform how they’re working, and make the case for its use in an ever-changing and uncertain world.

FULHAM have raided Southampton for left-back Matt Targett , Norwich City are set to seal a deal with Aberdeen for Aberdeen left back Robert Snodgrass , and West Brom are ready to sign a striker with a £15m release clause, as they hunt a replacement for Mark Hughes. Targett - who joined Southampton in 2008 - has scored five times in his last five appearances for the Saints and is ready to force his way into their plans, after signing a three-year deal with the club earlier this week. Targett will cost the club around £12m and he is set to arrive on a season-long loan.

What Would You Give Up at Work for the Ability to Choose a Mobile Device? Sybase, a database firm now owned by SAP, surveyed 500 employees at companies in the U.S. and UK with revenues of $100M or more. Among the questions asked was: Which of the Following, if any, Would You Be Willing to Give Up if You Were Able to Use the Type of Mobile Device You Want for Work for the Rest of Your Career? Please Choose all that Apply. Not all of those surveyed responded to this question.

Edgar Wright has never made a bad movie. He’s never even made less than a very good movie, and so it makes sense that thus far in his career, Wright has shied away from straight-up sequels. However, that could possibly change with Baby Driver. When Shaun of the Dead was a massive hit, instead of capitalizing on that with a zombie follow-up, Wright, Simon Pegg, and Nick Frost instead made a thematically connected trio of films—the Cornetto Trilogy—with the also excellent Hot Fuzz and The World’s End.

On Thursday, LightSquared submitted final arguments for its $7 billion dollar proposal to launch an LTE network. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) has plenty of July 4th reading to do: a thousand-page recommendation from LightSquared and members of the GPS industry, on whether or not America will be getting a new wholesale 4G LTE provider as early as next year. On Thursday, LightSquared and the FCC-mandated Technical Working Group (TWG), which is made up of representatives from both GPS-dependant industries and LightSquared, submitted final arguments for and against LightSquared's $7 billion dollar proposal.

While giant and spectacular circus shows now roam the Earth , it ’ s good to be reminded how they started, and in some cases, to consider how we’ve changed. In the 19th century the first public circuses, in which performers performed for paying customers, were already in their infancy. The first such circus, in 1810, was the Prussian circus, in Prussia, whose performance was attended by many notable individuals, including Napoleon. In 1817 the Parisian circus, the Jardin du Palais-Royal, was the first to open the world ’ s eyes to the spectacle of an animal-drawn parade.

The Planning Commission approved a sidewalk extension along a portion of the Laguna Canyon 's frontage road despite opposition from residents who said it would be a 'disaster' for the area. (Courtesy of Laguna Beach Planning Department)

A proposed extension of a city sidewalk along Laguna Canyon Blvd. in Laguna Beach will be included in the city's 2018-2025 Comprehensive Plan. The city Council on Tuesday unanimously approved a recommendation of the planning commission to move the project forward. However, the council will still need to consider the recommendation and finalize the extension by a vote in November.

Narendra Modi’s Election Challenge: Create Jobs. Lots of Them. The Indian government’s failure to create millions of new jobs for its young population may be its undoing in elections. Aashique Ahmed Iqbal had no reason to think he wouldn’t find a job. Although from a modest background, he’d studied at one of India’s top schools, attended one of its best universities, and completed a doctorate in history at Oxford University after being awarded a highly competitive scholarship. When he returned to India, in 2017, he was optimistic that he could find work as an academic.

In a rare instance, Dhoni, who was not even meant to be on the field of play, lost his cool and rushed out of the dug-out to challenge umpire Ulhas Gandhe after he flip-flopped on a no ball during the IPL match against Rajasthan Royals on Thursday night. "He was certainly fired up the way the decision was handled and why it was overturned. It was a lack of clarity, obviously from him and he wanted to get it clarified at a key moment," Fleming said in the post-match press conference.

Suzuki unearthed improper tests on 6,401 units out of 12,819 since 2012 . In a major blow to the Japanese carmaker, Suzuki said the tests did not conform to its quality assurance policies. "The company will work to address any remaining issues identified in the testing. We will do this as a priority in cooperation with our suppliers and our quality control team." The recall, which affects mainly passenger cars, is one of the most widespread recalls of cars in Japan this year, and will affect about 6.5 percent of the vehicles on Japan's road.

Hearst Magazines will be busy in 2018 , finalizing the acquisition of Rodale , snapping up some magazines in the last year , as well as planning for the first three years in a row not to publish at least 50 titles , a record not achieved in the past 15 years. Hearst has not yet begun to fill the positions that Rodale will vacate, and will likely announce the start of the year with a major announcement of its plans for 2018 in February . While Rodale and Hearst Magazines appear to be on the same path , the differences that make each company different make it more interesting .

Vodafone Hutchison Australia ( VHA ) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G services, despite a flurry of positive statements from Australia’s main mobile phone network operators, while the Coalition government has announced the roll-out of next-gen services. Mr Berroeta was speaking to the Australian Financial Review (AFR) on Saturday, after speaking earlier to the Australian Industry Group. “I think a lot of people don’t realise how important 5G is going to be,” he said. “I think it’s been a great opportunity for VHA, a great opportunity for Telstra.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products. A promotion that went awry last month has led BlackBerry to cut ties with T-Mobile after numerous years of working together. BlackBerry on Wednesday announced that it will not renew T-Mobile's license to sell its products when it expires April 25. T-Mobile offended the Canadian phone maker in February when it messaged its BlackBerry users with an offer to switch to the iPhone 5s for $0 down. The Seattle carrier tried to make amends with a second promotion, offering BlackBerry users $200 in credit when they traded in their device for any new T-Mobile phone.

Doug Newcomb 2015 Lincoln MKC If you want a sleek-looking , lower-priced luxury crossover that 's an alternative to the Honda Accord and the Nissan Juke, you've got one of the best vehicles for the money. And the 2015 Lincoln MKC starts at just $29,995 for the base 2LT trim, and $39,695 for the 3LT, which is good for an EPA estimate of 34/43 mpg highway and 37/45 combined mpg. Like any new vehicle, it's going to have an occasional glitch or two, but otherwise this is the most reliable and versatile Lincoln to date.

Long flights can be rough on the body , so it ’ s not uncommon to see people walking around or sitting on flights for hours. It ’ s a natural response, right? Well, it could be that the person sitting on the flight is actually suffering from some kind of orthopedic problems or injury that the flight has been exacerbating, but that is not always the case. While it can be easy to understand why a person would want to get off a flight , what is not as well known is why people may get on a flight to begin with in the first place.

The images we have published out of Yemen may be as unsettling as anything we have used before . Here are just three recent cases that have captured our attention. On July 9, an Al Qaeda commander named Ahmed al-Muhajer was killed by an explosion in Sana'a , Yemen. The U.S. intelligence agencies had identified him as having been part of a "core" of the al-Qaeda leadership in Yemen, responsible for organizing the attacks on 9/11, among others. He was reportedly one of seven members of his unit who blew up the U.S. embassy there the following month, killing two Americans.

Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies will move to BU's Engineering and Science building. Two companies plan to create 39 jobs and invest $540,000 over the next five years while residing in tax-free zones at Binghamton University, Gov. Andrew Cuomo's office announced Monday. Baceapp Corp. and LightSpin Technologies Inc., which will move to the Engineering and Science Building at BU, were two of the 17 companies unveiled Monday as the newest participants in Start-Up NY, a program that offers no taxes for 10 years in locations near or on college campuses.

find ... Ron Brown of AAG Archaeology with the netty door. Below, the Westoe Netty painting. A toilet door recovered from a historic South Tyneside building now takes pride of place at one of the North East’s most popular visitor attractions. During a survey of a Regency townhouse in Beach Road, South Shields, staff at North-East company AAG Archaeology found what is possibbly the only lavatory door to make it into a museum collection. It was eagle-eyed archaeologist Ron Brown who spotted what is thought to be the best-surviving example of a classic North-East netty door sticking out of the rubble of a demolished toilet.

Getty Images photographer John Moore will receive the inaugural Impact Award from the Lucie Awards program Sunday at Carnegie Hall, which celebrates the art of photography. (Published Wednesday, May 9, 2017)

Photographer John Moore has won the inaugural Lucie Awards for his photo essay about the American Civil Liberties Union. He was also recognized as a photographer who changed the way the world looks at photography. Moore, a staff photographer at Getty Images, has been taking photos of America for 40 years. In that time he has captured hundreds of human stories.

WASHINGTON ( Alliance News ) - Gold prices held steady on Thursday after the Fed 's latest report on the state of the U.S. economic recovery held off any major shifts in the markets. The Fed said that the U.S. economy was growing at its fastest pace in nine years, and that the increase in the jobless rate was likely to be the most pronounced since the Great Depression of the 1930. In addition, the central bank held its policy of keeping the funds rate at the 0-to-zero range in the long term at 1.5%. Gold prices are expected to edge higher in the weeks to come.

It is easy to lose democratic mechanisms but difficult to get them back , says the incoming General Secretary of PSE . The current General Secretary of Popular Socialists, Dr. Manuela Sá de Miranda, is leaving the PSE to start a new challenge. Dr. Mariela Casal, the PSE’s General Secretary since 2013, will be the new candidate in the party primaries. Dr. Sá’s candidature opens a period of great expectations. The new leader will face the challenge of building a new party which has been in decline for years and which will take up this challenge with open eyes and ready hands.

After The Floods, Colorado Hospital Braces For Winter : Shots - Health News A hospital in Estes Park, Colo., escaped the flood damage that affected much of the area this month. But the small hospital in the mountains now relies on a single road to evacuate critical patients. A bad snowstorm could stop traffic and ground helicopters, leaving the hospital isolated. As snow begins falling in Colorado's Rocky Mountain National Park, the town at its doorstep, finds itself newly isolated. The only year-round road into or out of Estes Park, Colo., now is the Peak to Peak Highway.

A meeting on the future of Kirkcaldy town centre should include discussions on disabled access , campaigners have insisted . There are fears a proposed new road in Kirkcaldy could make it difficult for access by wheelchair users and campaigners have said the town centre must be an example of how to plan for disability access. In a letter to Scottish Borders Council last week, members of the disabled community urged them to "ensure that the new proposed road is a step in a positive direction for all communities in Kirkcaldy". They also asked for a detailed assessment of the potential effects the road could have on disabled people in Kirkcaldy.

As Conservative Party leader William Hague made his way through the flock of the faithful at a lunchtime rally Tuesday and an emcee introduced "the next prime minister of Britain," even many of his supporters let out an involuntary guffaw. The conservative Times of London newspaper had just thrown its support to the Labor Party for the first time ever, endorsing Prime Minister Tony Blair for a second term. The nation's leading betting house, Ladbrokes, had already closed its book on Thursday's election and said it had begun paying out on a Labor victory.

Aston Villa fans voted on the number they wanted for the final day of voting for the number to be worn on the shirt, in what can be seen as the biggest single day of Aston Villa fans voting in a Premier League campaign.

Rawalpindi : The secondary students of Sadeeqa ’ s Learning System ( SLS ) Montessori & High School celebrated Autism Awareness Month, a program designed to spread awareness about autism and its causes among the youth. Magic — that’s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy’s Hurricanes Championship win in Levin. In only the academy’s second year, the Trish Hina-coached Lytton under-15 girls beat Wanganui 66-0, Feilding 42-0 and Kapiti 49-0 on Day 1. On Day 2, they beat Wairarapa-Bush Combined 61-0 and Mana College 73-5 before hammering Feilding 63-10 in the final. The Lytton team are a tight unit and conceded only three tries in six games. “The girls have worked really hard to get to where they are now,” said Hina, a former Black Fern.

German business sentiment dropped sharply in October to its lowest in more than 2-1/2 years, the sixth consecutive fall dispelling any lingering doubt that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of some 7,000 firms, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro hit a one-week low against the dollar and European shares turned negative following Ifo's release.

WASHINGTON — South Florida has long been a laboratory for some of the nation ’ s roughest politics , with politicians, activists, celebrities and even members of the military turning out for protests here. Now, for some, it appears, that test may have been passed. South Florida may now be the epicenter of America’s anti-Semitic movement. In an era of heightened sensitivity about hate crimes , this is an alarming development. In the week since the shooting of four Jewish teenagers by an anti-Semitic man in Kansas, more anti-Semitism has occurred in Broward County than has happened in the nation’s two biggest cities.

(Host) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars last year in gifts from drug companies. (Dillon) Last year, physicians and other health care providers in Vermont got about $3.1 million dollars in gifts from pharmaceutical companies. Vermont is one of a few states that require the drug companies to disclose these kinds of marketing expenses. The payments include consulting fees, travel, gifts and money for lectures.

Shares of AOL Inc. shot up 19 % in premarket trade Tuesday , after the Internet content company agreed to be purchased by Verizon Communications Inc. The deal, which still requires the approval of shareholders, is valued at around $4.8 billion in cash plus about 1.6 billion in Verizon stock. Verizon has been in talks to acquire AOL for weeks. Verizon shares rose $1.15 to close at $47.99 on the Nasdaq exchange and were up 6.5 percent in midday trade Tuesday. They're up about 9.4 percent over the past 12 months.

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year , Summit County ’ s real estate market took a huge hit in September, when the average price per square foot for all properties dropped 7.0 percent, according to the Summit County Association of Realtors. The median price of all homes sold that month was $225,200, down 10.4 percent from September 2017 and 9.7 percent from September 2016, which marks the third straight monthly price decline in the $225,200 price range. Summit County Realtors said it expects the average home-price decline to last through December 2018, with prices falling to $215,000 in December 2018.
