Battfleck is officially no more ! Ben Affleck is officially out as Bruce Wayne in The Batman . And he has been replaced by Ben Affleck , who has been cast in his own take on the Dark Knight. But who the heck is Ben Affleck? And when will he have the chance to shine with the Dark Knight? We’ve seen the man of the hour. Affleck has been cast to star as Batman in Ben Affleck‘s (Zachary Quinto) solo film, The Batman. The news was revealed via a Twitter message from director Matt Reeves .

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski will be crucial in the team's bid to secure a first-ever Champions League triumph. With the international break just three days away, Wenger believes that the trio of key absentees are likely to feature on Wednesday night. However, he warned that the absence of full-backs Jonny Evans and Carl Jenkinson, who are now both out of the running to make the squad for the trip to Ukraine, could pose a problem during the first leg at Arsenal.

“ Interaction of Color , ” the landmark 1963 book by Josef Albers — the German-born artist and educator who would win the Nobel Prize in 1967 for his color theory of form — is not only a watershed in human perception but also a cornerstone of visual thinking and creativity. Albers’s groundbreaking theory of color, first published in a small book from 1949, “Color and Human Perception ,” and later in his seminal 1963 book, “The Color of Form ,” is the foundation on which every discipline in the arts and humanities is built.

Haidilao went public in September , and it 's been a lucrative time for China 's largest hotpot chain . The company has generated $6.3 billion in revenue through August , up 27% from the previous year , the fastest growth of any chain in the U.S. In April , Haidilao launched a new menu featuring five hotpot options priced at between $14 and $18, a move that generated a strong response from the chain's guests. More than 90% of Haidilao guests ordered at least one item that month , compared to only 65% in February , according to company data .

After tracking mostly on pace through the first two months of the year, Summit County’s real estate sales hit a downturn in March, leading to a noticeable dip in the county’s first-quarter figures, according to Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide variety of statistics associated with the local real estate market, and Summit saw a roughly 12 percent decline in both its number of real estate transactions and their combined value for the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company’s most recent market report.

The sixth race of the Charlevoix Yacht Club's summer series was sailed on Aug. 8 in light and variable winds. Twenty-two boats finished the race, which consisted of a shortened course of six windward-leeward legs. Affinity was the fastest boat overall, and only 26 seconds corrected time separated the first three boats of the Spinnaker A fleet this week. Two more races and one more drop will determine the summer series totals. Race results provided by Mike Miller and Keith Attee, committee chairs. Jib and Main fleet: 1 - Sonnett (Lepmann); 2 - Exitus (Pung).

PARIS ( Reuters ) - Longchamp , one of France ’ s leading handbag makers , plans to increase its workforce by 6 percent this year, it said on Friday, as it seeks to win back market share in a market that has largely turned elsewhere in Europe. Longchamp has been the biggest seller of leather bags in Europe for more than 100 years after making its own bags in its first shop in 1857, and now employs 8,000 people in France and around 600,000 people globally, making it the fourth most valuable brand in its category.

Dundee United are to begin talks in the next few days in an attempt to prevent Scotland striker Steven Thompson leaving the club for nothing in the summer. New Tannadice owner Eddie Thompson is angry that recently sacked manager Alex Smith and the previous board had not already moved to secure the 23-year-old on a new deal. Striker Thompson is out of contract next summer. By then, he will have turned 24 and be able to leave for another club without United being due any compensation. He can begin talking to potential new clubs in January.

Patrick Warburton , the actor who portrayed David Puddy on `` Seinfeld , '' was in attendance at Wednesday night's Golden Globes ceremony. Warburton posted a photo of the award on Instagram along with the following message: '' To all those who are celebrating in this room tonight - I am not. I just lost a great man who loved and believed in me from the day he met me. Thank you to the incredible people who supported me along the way.'' Warburton was one of the presenters last night at the show, along with fellow TV and film stars including Michael J.

She posted about Bozman in the “Out and About in Troy, Illinois” Facebook group to see if anyone had connections to get him inside. After that, it took off. Troy residents brought him food, water, blankets, warm clothes and boots throughout the day, and were able to raise enough money to buy him a bus ticket to New York, where he had a friend he could stay with. Warm at last, he boarded the bus Wednesday night with a backpack full of supplies and a pocketful of cash from helpful Troy residents.

Recently, my elderly mother visited her bank located in Eastland shopping center in West Covina. On leaving, she was approached by a woman holding an infant asking for food money for her baby, claiming she had recently arrived from Italy and had no money or means of support. As is so common with elderly folks I have known, she didn’t hesitate to give the woman five dollars. Being the soft heart she is, my mom quizzed her for all the sad details. The woman thanked her and moved on to others in the parking lot.

LOS ANGELES ( AP ) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his left foot, an injury that has hampered him during the Kings' recent two-game winning streak. The injury was first reported by The San Francisco Chronicle. Kopitar hasn't missed a game since Dec. 29, when he played through a pulled groin muscle and missed three games. Kopitar was scheduled to undergo the same operation on Monday at a U.S. medical facility. The Kings are 5-2 since Nov. 23. Their only losses since then were to the Phoenix Coyotes, who they beat 4-2 on Tuesday night.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach ( R-IA ) went down to defeat in the massacre of 2006 . I 'm no political genius but I have to say it 's hard to see how Leach is going to win his re- election this year . I think he will face the wrath of voters in IA and other Midwestern States in his next election . Why ? He is in a position to be a representative of the middle class which is the key to victory in mid west politics . As an example I can give you this little thing I noticed during his congressional term that is not mentioned in the mainstream press .

Californians, of all people, should recognize what it means to drive people off their land. In the 1850s and 1860s, the state funded yearly expeditions that emptied entire areas of their Native American presence. But this is not only a historical phenomenon: In the West Bank, Israeli settlers and the Israeli government have attempted for decades to eradicate the small Palestinian village of Susiya. The village has existed near Hebron since at least the 19th century. In the 1980s, it was declared an archaeological site to enable settlers to move in and replace the former inhabitants.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea might not "be around much longer," Twitter was forced to explain why the President was not banned from the service. In a six-part tweet from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes "newsworthiness" and "public interest" into account when determining whether a user has violated its rules. Those considerations have long been used internally when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel on Wednesday and admitted that his family operation "got big quite a while before we stopped acting like we were small." "What I mean by that is we were big before we started adopting sophisticated procedures to be sure we met all of the government requirements," the egg producer, Austin J. DeCoster, said in testimony before a House Energy and Commerce subcommittee. He is the founder of an egg empire that has been linked over three decades to multiple deadly outbreaks of salmonella poisoning in many states.

How the internet has caught up with the ways of the world. The early web: UNIX command was beautiful if you knew what to do. This month, the World Wide Web turned 20, and its birthday was celebrated the world over. It was a pleasant change since the medium, once a new frontier of hope, has been regarded with suspicion ever since the Cambridge Analytica scandal broke. We had spent years outraging over the possibility that our choice of washing machines and underwear was being conditioned by smart web advertising, and, in 2018, we learned that even voter choice was open to manipulation.

President Jacob Zuma believes that the public protector ’ s report on state capture was a political tool meant to weaken the president and derail his plans to reform the ANC. Speaking to reporters at his Johannesburg office last week, Mr Zuma told the press that it was unfair that the state capture report should be used against his political party in its election bid. “The report has been used against us in our election campaign, so let’s make sure the ANC is seen as the party who can deliver for all South Africans and not just one section of the public.

Blue Turtle Technologies, South Africa's leading enterprise technology management company, has entered into an alliance with ThreatMetrix, a LexisNexis Risk Solutions company, as reseller of its leading fraud prevention solutions. Through the agreement, the company will now be able to deliver effortless authentication through digital user identification to customers in the Africa region. Blue Turtle will integrate the ThreatMetrix software into its fintech solutions portfolio, where it aims to assist clients in unlocking the power of fraud prevention. With ThreatMetrix ID, an advanced digital identity technology, customers can better button down their security no matter the industry.

The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record . NL Partners of Portland , Maine , provided creative services for the Maine State Lottery. Fuseideas was in charge of print and broadcast media, while NL Partners was in charge of on- and off-air promotion. Fuseideas has a long history of winning and serving clients. In 1998, it won an $8.2 million contract to develop the marketing and advertising strategy for Walt Disney Co. Fuseideas developed the strategy, integrated Disney's creative vision, and managed all aspects of media development, including writing and editing for television, print and digital.

[prMac.com] San Rafael, California - Audio technology company, Soundness is pleased to announce availability of SoundSoap+, based on the award-winning SoundSoap audio noise reduction software for Mac and Windows. SoundSoap is consumer-friendly software that solves audio noise problems like unwanted hiss and background noises, clicks, pops, crackles, electrical hum, rumble, clipping, and low volume in media files. SoundSoap+ includes all the features of SoundSoap, and provides several powerful additional controls for pinpoint accuracy in audio restoration work. SoundSoap is so easy to use that even average consumers can use it to fix audio noise problems, without requiring any audio expertise.

In two weeks, two people have been bit by rattlesnakes. The first was on April 23 on Mount Tamalpais. A 79-year-old man was bit twice by a rattlesnake and had to be airlifted to the hospital. And then on Friday, a teenage girl was reportedly bitten by a baby rattlesnake in a Clayton neighborhood, near Mount Diablo State Park. This week, The East Bay Regional Park District put out an advisory on rattlesnakes seen on the park trails now that the weather is warm. Jeff McKenzie was out on the greenbelt near Mt.

Donald Trump 's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter 's rules prohibiting abusive behavior on the platform. The Trump administration has sought to clarify the rules, which it has long said are designed to prevent the spread of "misinformation and other harmful content" and are necessary to protect public safety. A Twitter spokesperson told CNNMoney earlier this month that the Trump Administration has "consulted broadly with experts and others" before making its changes to the company's rules, but declined to provide more details on that conversation or on the rules themselves.

Israeli PM says he will deliver major policy speech for achieving peace with Palestinians . The prime minister has so far said he will not speak to the United Nations. He said his government is not willing to make peace with the Palestinians until they meet Israel's long-standing demands. "But if it doesn't happen, we will sit at the table with the U.N., and it will be for the future of the peace process, which I hope will begin immediately, in the hope that we can come to an agreement," he said.

L.A. cats are cooler. Nite Jewel + Dâm-Funk = Nite Funk in the citay. There's been movement from the highly anticipated Nite Jewel and Dâm-Funk collaboration, Nite Funk. The two first came together for XLR8R magazine's blog, to record a "Tune in an Afternoon," which wound up being called "Am I Gonna Make It." In January, Stones Throw Records CEO Peanut Butter Wolf confirmed that more would come from the freshly dubbed Nite Funk via his label. It seems that day is fast approaching, and as an EP.

MELBOURNE , Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4 , 4-6 , 7-6(2) in her quest for her ninth Australian Open title. Hampton, ranked number one in the world, played an impressive match in which she broke Azarenka in the first game. "It was a very solid match. You know, it's very difficult to play the way they're playing. They are very consistent, they are very hard to beat," said Hampton. "I like to have a good first serve when I'm at the top of the match.

QUETTA - At least eleven people including two women and two children died and 18 others sustained injuries in a stampede on Tuesday during a religious ceremony at a temple in western Pakistan, police say. Police recovered the body of a three-year-old child and the remains of a five-month-old child in a car, while the rest of the 11 dead were women and children. The incident happened at around 8:30am (local time) as an estimated 2,500 people attended a religious program in the village of Mureedha in the Sargodha district, about 400km southwest of Islamabad.

Nobody asked me , but … if you pay dues to a neo-Nazi organization , subscribe to racist publications , or vote for someone who supports white supremacists , there are a number of ways in which you will support racist policies , whether you like it or not. The fact that some people find it politically expedient to support racist causes in order to protect their own skin color does not negate the fact that in America, racism is still a reality and that people will, and do support racist policies even if they say they are not.

Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs. Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze, tasked with European integration, described in an interview the importance of the country’s Association Agreement with the EU. EURACTIV Spain reports. The Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement entered into force on 1 September 1 – an important step for bilateral relations. For the past three months, Ukrainians have been able to travel to the EU without a visa. Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze explained what this agreement entails for her country, what her government has done until now and what Ukraine can offer to the EU.

Ballinhassig 4-17 Castlelyons 1-12 : A polished second-half performance powered Ballinhassig to a comprehensive win over Castlelyons in the Cork Intermediate Football Championship. The home side made six changes for the game, which they won 1-13 to 1-10, while Ballinhassig had a number of changes to their starting line-up as they sought to end the campaign on a positive note after a long period of poor form. The first half ended in bitter disappointment for Castlelyons. Their first score was made on just two minutes, but the following two were all scored within a minute of each other and then Castlelyons went a goal down within four minutes.

Good afternoon and welcome to our live coverage of an `` incident '' in Bourke Street in Melbourne 's CBD. A man in his thirties has been charged after allegedly punching a young woman in the face. Victoria police said a woman was walking to her car around 11:30pm last night, when she was confronted by a man she knew. The alleged attacker then punched the woman twice in the face. A police spokesman said the man punched the woman so hard that police were not sure whether she had been hit by the suspect first.

Suzuki unearthed improper tests on 6,401 units out of 12,819 since 2012. In a major blow to the Japanese carmaker, Suzuki Motor announced that the company used improper fuel economy and emissions tests on its vehicles in Japan. According to Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport of Japan, Suzuki, along with Mazda and Toyota have accepted to having cheated on the emissions tests and submitted a report of samples of manufactured vehicles selected during the quality assurance process. Moreover, the samples were found to have been tested under incorrect driving conditions. However, the company is not considering product recall at this moment.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it ’ s not coming from Islamic State fighters in Iraq and Syria. Residents of Pata, in the Sulu archipelago, on Monday night told The Associated Press that their town has been on edge since May. The Philippine Army, which has been assisting with their defense, said in a press release Monday that a suicide bomber on May 22 killed 13 soldiers and two civilians. The bomber detonated an explosive belt filled with nails and nails-like metal balls wrapped in nylon rope, said Brig.

To involve private sector in healthcare , what is really required is a heavy increase in public sector investment to achieve a higher rate of investment

With the introduction of universal health insurance system and a focus on quality of care , India has been moving towards higher standard healthcare . However , if we go by statistics , we have to admit that there is a major issue with the implementation of new healthcare laws and policies . In our recent blog , we discussed how universal health system is not an easy task due to many issues , some of which include a large number of unqualified and untrained people working as health workers .

DENVER ( AP ) — The nonpartisan administrator of Colorado ’ s state Senate has warned staff , aides and the public that the chamber has become a cesspool of in-fighting and that Democrats and Republicans will find it ’ t easy to govern as a united team . Senate Democratic Leader John Morse, who has been elected to his third term as the chamber ’ s chief deputy leader, says Democrats are determined to make the chamber a more effective instrument of change in the state . ”

The Senate is at a political crossroad , and Democrats are going to be able to do it .

A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to an alleged scam in the Public Works Department (PWD). Additional Sessions Judge Kamini Lau granted relief to Bansal, a nephew of Kejriwal, on a personal bond of Rs two lakh with one surety of like amount, advocate B S Joon, appearing for the accused, said.

Butler hit the headlines last week after posting a signed letter from Barack Obama on her website. The letter described Butler as 'bright, intelligent and determined'. She later admitted her staff came up with the words and Obama just signed it. Before entering the Commons, Butler worked as an officer for the GMB union. She replaced Paul Boateng as MP for Brent South in 2005, becoming the third black female MP. She was promoted to her present job in September 2008. Butler is the daughter of immigrants from Jamaica. She was brought up in London where her parents own a small West Indian and European bakery.

The voter scam has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's chief election officer is warning residents of a potential scam to get sensitive information from would-be voters following similar concerns in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases to send the voter an absentee ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents can't register to vote or request an absentee ballot by phone.

Teams of programmers and engineers at Google have created a custom Android app, different versions of which have been named “Maotai” and “Longfei.” The app has already been demonstrated to the Chinese government; the finalized version could be launched in the next six to nine months, pending approval from Chinese officials." Google has a long history of transferring technology to their Chinese authoritarian partners. The Intercept account continues. The obvious dreaded concern is that some deleterious version of Dragonfly will be imposed upon domestic users of Google and Android.

There has been a wealth of recent research that has demonstrated that dementia patients greatly benefit from participating in art therapy. While many might think that eating right and exercise are the keys to aging well, the Journal of International Psychogeriatrics has found that certain personality traits can make a huge impact on your life as you age, too. We all have busy lives, but if you’ve recently moved your loved one into an assisted living home, or memory care cottage, it is even more important to stay connected to them. Nutrition is important in everyone’s life, but especially in seniors.

A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light . The technique could revolutionise treatment for some of the most deadly diseases in the world. . In the future, when you get cancer you’re likely to go for chemotherapy, radiation or a combination of both, which has a life expectancy of a couple of years before it kills you. But there is a way to shorten this process and save lives. . The treatment could revolutionise cancer treatment in the next 20 to 30 years.

PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week , Preble County Sheriff Tom Baca is calling for an increased effort from all concerned citizens. The sheriff has asked all area law enforcement to look into the cases and help determine what happened. If there is a problem, the citizens should contact the sheriff’s office at 523-1420 to report the matter and provide details, he said. If anyone has additional information or information about these cases, the sheriff and his office can be contacted at 523-1416.

My daughter, a resident advisor at her college, recently groaned while mentioning that she’d likely get additional foreign exchange students to supervise this fall. When I asked why that’s a bad thing, she said the foreign exchange kids tend to presume Americans are stupid unless proven otherwise. They assume Americans aren’t as well-traveled, or as fluent in foreign languages or as knowledgeable about world cultures. I said what any Good American would: Why don’t they stay home, then? Oh, she replied, they don’t think our colleges are stupid.

Google has long had a testy relationship with China, with the search giant largely pulling out of the Chinese market after alleging that state-backed hackers had targeted the company's systems and employees. Chairman Eric Schmidt's forthcoming book, "The New Digital Age," will not smooth things over, judging by a description of the work by the Wall Street Journal, which has reviewed galleys of the unreleased title. "... in this all-Internet world, China, the book says again and again, is a dangerous and menacing superpower," Tom Gara writes.

To a watching world , the sight of Britain on fire this week has surely been shocking . The looting, burning of businesses, cars, homes, schools and churches across the UK has caused the UK’s Foreign Secretary Boris Johnson to call it “an absolute outrage” and a “disaster”. He added “It’s absolutely unprecedented.”

The UK is facing the largest economic and social shock since the beginning of the Industrial Revolution. In fact, this is not just any kind of economic shock , this is a disaster of epic proportions.

By detaining Haniyeh, Israel sent a message that Palestinian cash smuggling is coming to an end. It is an open secret that Hamas has been smuggling millions of dollars into Gaza through the Rafah crossing ever since the international community cut financial aid to the Palestinian Authority following Hamas's rise to power earlier this year. Yet Prime Minister Ehud Olmert's decision on Thursday to close the Rafah crossing to keep PA Prime Minister Ismail Haniyeh from bringing $35 million into Gaza was the first time Israel has actively intervened to stop the money flow.

(Left to right) Sam and Teska Frisby, Marsha Thompson and Boheme Opera NJ Maestro Joseph Pucciatti. If Marsha Thompson sings in the shower then Teska and Sam Frisby receive a special concert each time she turns on the hot water. Thompson, a three-week house guest with the Frisbys, prepares for her starring role in three performances of Aida at The College of New Jersey’s Kendall Main Stage Theater. On Friday, April 5 at 8 p.m. and Sunday, April 7 at 3 p.m. Boheme Opera NJ celebrates a 30th Anniversary with a production of Giuseppe Verdi’s Aida.

Olentangy quarterback Deeb Haber ( 4 ) looks for running room during the first half of last Saturday ’ s Ohio Valley Conference Football game. Haber, a senior, is ranked No. 2 in the nation in total offense with 4,846 yards, while throwing for 472 yards with four touchdowns. He also is tied for the most rushing touchdowns with 13. In the end, the Owls ran out the final 13 seconds of the game with an interception and an onside kick return, giving the Wildcats a 26-13 victory. Haber was also named co-Offensive Player of the week for his efforts.

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire . Tony Barbara , 50, who was previously known as Tony Martin , has been jailed for 18 months for five offences including keeping dogs for fighting, public order offences and animal cruelty . The court was told that Barbara had kept seven dogs for up to 20 years and that two of the pups were still with him when he went to prison . On Sunday, June 11, 2019, at about 2pm, officers responded to a report of a man threatening a woman in a residential neighborhood.

Craig Watson (top) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on a North Shields store. Two men have been jailed for an armed robbery at a North Shields store. Lee James Stephenson and Craig Robert William Watson were sentenced at Newcastle Crown Court for a string of offences. Stephenson, 39, of Loxley Close, New York, was sentenced to 12 years after a trial for the robbery, possession of heroin, common assault, joint offences of theft from a vehicle, joint attempted robbery, and joint burglary.

This is general clerical and secretarial work performed in aschool . An employee in this classperforms routine to varied office duties as directed by his supervisor , who is the director of the school . Other duties may include secretarial work or clerical work , and may include such duties as receiving, transmitting, receiving, compiling, transmitting, distributing, and similar work . All clerical or secretarial duties performed under general supervision, by the employee , are considered to be "school work" for the purposes of the workmen s compensation law and are subject to the limitations and restrictions of that law .

THE pound has surged against the euro and dollar as Theresa May announced plans to launch a snap election later this year. Prime Minister May said the snap election "will be on a knife edge". Her comments came after her party lost a vote of no confidence by her MPs. The prime minister has been in talks with European leaders over Brexit and the election plans, which would see a referendum on whether to leave the EU on the doorstep of voters. But she will struggle to secure the 50 votes needed to pass the motion - meaning another general election would be called at a date yet to be decided.

Washington D.C., Jul 31, 2018 / 03:01 pm ().- The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority was within its rights to ban the Archdiocese of Washington’s religious-themed advertisements, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit ruled Tuesday. In November 2015, WMATA issued 14 new guidelines for acceptable advertisements on its busses and trains. Guideline 12 expressly prohibited “advertisements that promote or oppose any religion, religious practice, or belief.” These new guidelines came out after someone attempted to purchase an advertisement featuring an image of Muhammad.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to melt in the fierce heat of Volgograd when they take on Nigeria in only their second ever World Cup match on Friday after impressively holding twice champions Argentina to a draw at the weekend. World Cup debutantes Iceland are dreaming of the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the most outstanding stories of international football in recent years. In their way stand not only Nigeria, who are desperate for a win after losing their opening game 2-0 to Croatia, but also the challenge of searing temperatures in the southern Russian city.

THE first acknowledgement of Brent Moloney's redemption for an after-match drinking binge came midway through the season when he was quietly reinstated to the club's leadership group. The second, much more public and significant than the first, came last night when he won Melbourne's best and fairest award. Moloney, 27, claimed the Keith ''Bluey'' Truscott Trophy ahead of key defenders Jared Rivers and James Frawley at a function at Crown Palladium. Two of Moloney's midfield teammates, Nathan Jones and Jack Trengove, were fourth and fifth respectively.

For small businesses that sell on credit , accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet. A customer who is creditworthy but has not established an account in the new credit system might find that they owe money on it and need to pay that off. Or, they may not be willing to pay it off immediately because it would make the payment on their credit line too high. In some cases, customers may not pay off the full balance because they get a little more than the agreed-upon amount of debt or because they are late to repay it, or both.

Hudson Technologies Co. , * Pearl River , New York , has been awarded a maximum $ 148,514,169 fixed-price with milestone payments of $ 20,813,500 and no-show rate of 4.25% for the sale and disposition of its business assets and the integration of its assets and employees into its newly formed corporate entity (“New Hudson”) which is now a wholly owned subsidiary. The total amount payable to Hudson Technologies is comprised of a term loan (with a 3.75% loan rate, $ 125,000) and a $ 50,000 grant of a senior subordinated note.

Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to launch the club ’ s branch in a new stadium in Sheffield City Centre. In a bid to raise the profile of rugby league in an area where rugby union and other forms of sport have traditionally been more successful, Herts were given the money in recognition of their achievements during their successful season last year when they finished runners up in the Championship. The money will be used to run the Sheffield branch which is being established in the Sheffield City Arena as part of a partnership with Sport England and Sheffield City Council.

U.S. trade policy has become the top concern among chief financial officers, according to a CNBC quarterly survey. Roughly two-thirds of North American and Asia-Pacific CFOs say U.S. trade policy will have a negative impact on their company over the next six months. Seven of the 16 biggest declines in the Dow Jones Industrial Average this year have been sparked by trade concerns. U.S. Secretary of the Treasury Steve Mnuchin hit Capitol Hill on Thursday to face a grilling on trade, tariffs and NAFTA from the House Financial Services Committee. Mnuchin attempted to quell growing uncertainty within Congress as President Trump ratchets up a trade war with China.

GENEVA – The Head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict , Justice Richard Goldstone , today described the latest report by the UN Fact Finding Mission as “a very clear and damning indictment“ of Israel and Hamas’ conduct in the conflict, saying it revealed a “flagrant disregard for international law.”

His statement on the mission report follows Goldstone’s comments at a news conference here today, which were aimed at making it more clear that he believes there is a “clear and compelling case to be made” in support of possible war crimes charges against both Israel and Hamas.

Russian President Vladimir Putin called Turkey’s downing of a Russian fighter jet today (24 November) a stab in the back administered by “the accomplices of terrorists,” saying the incident would have serious consequences. Speaking in the Russian Black Sea resort of Sochi on Tuesday before a meeting with Jordan’s King Abdullah, Putin said the downed plane had been attacked inside Syria when it was 1 kilometre from the Turkish border and had come down 4 kilometres inside Syria. That contradicted Turkey’s assertion that the aircraft had been warned multiple times that it was straying into Turkish airspace before it was shot down.

GREENSBORO , N.C. -- Officials with the Piedmont Triad International Airport announced Thursday that Allegiant Air will begin a new service this summer linking the airport with Nashville. Allegiant, the nation's first low-cost airline, said it will add about 100 daily flights to Nashville-licensed Nashville International Airport beginning June 6. The flights will begin with its inaugural nonstop flight, which begins at 8 a.m., and will serve the airport with the option of connecting with flights elsewhere. "Allegiant is thrilled to open its doors as an Allegiant Express to the Nashville airport community," said Richard Arnold, vice president, marketing and sales for Allegiant.

A family dog has been shot dead after police chased down two teens accused of stealing a car on the city's north-west outskirts on Monday night. Police responded to a report of theft of a car about 10.20pm in Woodvale on Monday after the dog was found dead with multiple injuries. The two teenagers had been caught trying to break into the vehicle, police confirmed in a statement. A spokesman for police confirmed to the Herald Sun that two male suspects and a dog were shot and killed before officers broke into the garage where the gun was found.

The tide is turning at Frankston, with the Dolphins scoring successive victories for the first time in almost six years with a 13-point win over Collingwood at Victoria Park on Saturday. Coach Simon Goosey had a five-year plan to transform the competition's whipping boys into finals contenders and the results are evident. Frankston knocked off last year's grand finalist Port Melbourne last week and held off a fast-finishing Pies outfit on Saturday. The key, said Goosey, has been getting players drafted into the AFL system. Michael Hibberd, Dylan Van Unen and Mark Baguley are at Essendon while Marcus Marigliani was on the Bombers' list in 2011.

It might not be the household name that devices like the Roku , Chromecast , or Fire TV are , but in the streaming world, Apple’s (NASDAQ: AAPL) TVOS is a big player. Apple has had its own TVOS for years and it has added features over the years, such as AirPlay, iTunes Radio, a built-in TV guide, and remote control functionality for AirPlay. But the feature that really stands out to me are the free movies that can be found on the service. When I first came across Apple TV, my wife and I were trying to find something to watch together.

The Grant bar and grill is a lively place with local musicians playing Thursday , Friday and Saturday nights and live local music every Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday from 7-9 pm. There is parking on the street and free street parking in front. There is a large stage in the center of the bar, where local bands perform. The bar and grille is a great place for breakfast and lunch, but the best thing about the place is that it features an excellent beer selection. The staff is friendly and attentive. There is a huge patio in the back overlooking the river.

John Tory has his first real competition in the mayor ’ s race . Jennifer Keesmaat , the city ’ s new assistant chief, is now the incumbent . And a Tory aide said Monday that he will have a difficult time against Keesmaat . “There’s going to be a lot of competition for the job, ” said Tory’s spokesman, Jason Miller . “But I can tell you that we’re putting a lot of time into campaigning this campaign. ” Tories have been trying to raise money for a mayoral campaign for the past two years.

NEW DELHI : A day after declaring its candidate for the seventh Lok Sabha seat , the Aam Aadmi Party has finally found a candidate. The announcement by Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday that he’ll be contesting the bypoll to the Lok Sabha election from South Delhi on April 9 is expected to see the AAP make a clean sweep of the poll for the first time. In fact, its chances of winning is high even before the election day, as a number of seats in Delhi go to elections every year.

KARACHI: Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah on Tuesday extended Pakistan Rangers, Sindh’s special powers, which were due to expire on Jan 10, for another 90 days. Mr Shah approved a summary to extend the special powers from Jan 11 to April 10, 2018 in view of Rangers’ achievements in targeted operations against terrorists, targeted killers and extortionists. In addition to this, the chief minister granted time scale and service structure to lower grade employees of the irrigation department. The employees had been appointed on non-promotional posts and the decision will benefit 28,971 of them.

A palm tree is illuminated with lights for the Christmas season in Charleston , S.C . Spend a coastal Christmas in the heart of the South. View of the James Island , S.C. , in the evening. You can clearly see the water of the James River , which is right next to us. Christmas in the Historic District . There is so much to do and see during Christmas that you would never have enough time. One of them is going on an adventure to Charleston . This town is very special in terms of its history, architecture, and also its culture.

COUNTY and district councillor for Axminster, Cllr Ian Hall, has spoken out on his support for the recently agreed Axminster masterplan. Cllr Hall says he “makes no apology” for speaking out on what he believes to be a “once in a lifetime opportunity” for the town. His latest comments follow a decision by East Devon District Council’s strategic planning committee to support the masterplan, which sets out how the town should be developed. Cllr Hall said: “The world around us is changing and we need to evolve as well if we are to avoid our town stagnating or dying.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders . The move is performed by leaning your body forward to press a bench bar to your chest, with the bar held in a vertical position, while you simultaneously press a dumbbell or weight plates up overhead to press the bar to your shoulders and then down to your chest. The bench press is a great strength-training move to improve your chest and shoulders. It will develop your upper-body muscles and strength of your arms. It helps build your upper-body and legs.

Mickey Boodaei has been a leading entrepreneur in the security space for years . He co-founded Imperva , which went on to become the leader in offering security solutions and is today a global leader in cybersecurity, with over 20,000 customers spread over 190 countries. He has served as a mentor for several of the world's top young security professionals. His vision has been to transform the cybersecurity space by bringing the industry closer to its end users. His approach was to design the products and services to simplify the user experience, to increase security, and to make sure that users have the tools they need to succeed.

Royals Hang On For 3-2 Win To Take Lead In World Series : The Two-Way Following two high-scoring games in Kansas City, Game 3 of the World Series turned into a bit more of a pitchers' duel as the Royals prevailed in San Francisco. Royals first baseman Eric Hosmer celebrates after Giants Hunter Pence grounded out to end Game 3 of the World Series on Friday. Game 3 of the World Series turned into a pitchers'-duel-by-committee on Friday, as eight relievers struck out nine in 7 1/3 innings of shutout baseball for the Giants and Royals.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer ’ s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. A synthetic hormone may be able to help patients suffering from a debilitating disease known as Alzheimer ’ s, according to a new report published in the journal Molecular Therapy. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, more than 5.4 million people, or about 15 percent of the population, age 65 and older have Alzheimer’s. Alzheimer’s is a progressive, neurodegenerative disease that is thought to lead to a progressive decline in cognitive function.

The lead seal is the first found bearing the image of St. Sabas , local big shot 1,500 years ago. The second seal is the lead seal of St. Peter, local parish priest with the image of St. George and St. Andrew, on the other hand, which is 1,000 years old. For a long time the mystery remained: What was the image on each seal? And why is it there? It's hard to find answers. For instance, the answer to the last question: why the images on the lead seals?

Paytm Money recently added a few features into its iOS app to make it easy for consumers to invest their cash and earn it back in real cash. A few days back, the company also launched an app on Android, making it simpler to get your money out of Paytm and into an app, which is what you are here for. All you need to invest with Paytm is to follow a few simple steps into its app, then tap on the ‘add money button’ to initiate a Paytm transaction with the amount you specified. You’ll then get paid instantly in your Paytm wallet.

Haidilao went public in September, and it's been a lucrative time for China's largest hotpot chain. The fortunes of Haidilao founders are among one of the world's fastest-growing. CHINA'S insatiable demand for spicy hotpot is placing the founders of a restaurant chain atop one of the world's fastest-growing fortunes, allowing them to outpace many of the wealthiest families globally. As of Monday, Zhang Yong, chairman of Haidilao International Holding Ltd, and his wife Shu Ping, had grown US$6 billion richer in 2019, a 79 per cent jump in just over three months.

On Saturday, August 8th, Ukraine’s Interfax News Service announced that the Security Bureau of Ukraine had just issued, on Friday, a list of 14 ‘artists’ (mainly Russian actors) who ‘pose a threat to Ukraine’s national security.’ The Ukrainian State Film Agency is, under Ukrainian law, now prohibited from authorizing or allowing distribution of their films or other works. These artists are thus officially banned. The list also includes French actor Gerard Depardieu, and even Russian economist Mikhail Khazin. Khazin claims that the gold price has been manipulated downward, and that gold is therefore way undervalued.

Less than two years ago , I was seated at a South Atlantic League baseball game ( low A ball) and saw the New York Mets and the Miami Marlins play a game. In the first inning, Mets pitcher Jeremy Hefner walked on three pitches to give the Mets the lead. A couple of innings into the game, he gave the Mets the lead. Hefner walked the next three batters. Then he gave up three consecutive singles to load the bases. He had no runs to show, so the Mets went to their bullpen and threw out the last three batters for a 3-0 Mets win.

When the theme of the convention seems to have been, “Drill, baby, drill,” which is an energy policy in exactly the same way that, “Tax, baby, tax” is a fiscal policy (i.e., it isn’t), slogans are obviously all that the party has left. Even if you think that increasing oil exploration and supply through more offshore drilling makes sense, you cannot really take these people seriously. Unfortunately, yes you can. This, by the way, was the moment when I completely gave up on the convention.

The incline bench press is a strength-training move to build your chest and fronts of the shoulders. The move is performed in a face-up position on a workout bench set at an angle. You then grasp dumbbells or a barbell in an overhand position, and extend and bend your elbows to elevate the weight over your chest. Incline chest press machines that simulate the movement in a fixed plane are another way to perform the move. The incline press is one of several exercises that help create symmetry and strength in the muscles of the upper body.

UNITED NATIONS, July 6, updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire on July 8, the day before South Sudan declares independence, as of June 6 at the UN in New York the Security Council resolution to create a new force in South Sudan has not yet been passed. At a meeting of Deputy Permanent Representatives on July 5, one member voiced opposition to forming the new Mission until after South Sudan formally declares independence, and found some suppporters. They pointed at a paragraph in the draft resolution which welcomes the creation of South Sudan.

A CONSERVATIVE candidate standing in the local election has been suspended from the party after failing to declare a pending marriage on the declaration of interests. Brent Davies is standing as a candidate in Easton and is a former Easton councillor. On Monday (October 14), he told the EDP that he was not currently married and that his partner was living in London with his two sons, aged three and six. However, according to the Hampshire Chronicle, he has not disclosed the fact of his relationship on his declaration of interests.

WASHINGTON ( CN ) – Republicans heaped ridicule on Transportation Secretary Ray LaHood at a Wednesday hearing after LaHood suggested that the Department of Transportation ( Department ) “go big” with the new federal passenger rail service between Washington and New York City, saying “we have to have something.”

LaHood, who is overseeing the project, said he did not want to overcommit the $1.8 billion in federal funds available for the line but added that he did not want to “go back and start the project from scratch.” He also said there was no way he could justify doing the project with less than $4 billion.

Professionals gearing up for Olathe ’ s public firework display on Tuesday are taking extensive safety precautions and following many rules, including wearing helmets. The city’s hazardous materials program, the National Fire Protection Association’s Fire Safety Foundation, and other safety organizations are helping local residents prepare. Firefighters are being trained on how to work with and around the fireworks. Residents are being asked to help identify and safely dispose of fireworks that are not in compliance with the rules and regulations of the event. Fireworks can pose serious health risk to children and to adults who ingest the chemicals used to create them.

Hull - Where the US goes the UK often follows . This is especially true of negatives . If the United States does not take action against China it could very easily become like Russia where the UK is effectively a vassal of Moscow . We have to look after our own interests here . In the past when the UK went into war the Americans followed suit . When the UK is in a negative situation with regards to the US it would be wise for the United Kingdom to keep its head in the sand and not to interfere with the internal affairs of America .

Vodafone Hutchison Australia (VHA) chief Iñaki Berroeta has sought to temper expectations about the imminent rise of 5G networks in Australia, saying although his company is forging ahead, he doesn’t anticipate consumer devices to be in market until at least the end of 2019. Berroeta declined to talk about any spectrum ambitions for Australian 5G, instead stressing that the new “ecosystem” for the mobile technology need to be put into place first before carriers started pushing product. He said he expected “most of the market” would be launching 5G either side of a one or two month window period when it arrived.

My daughter , a resident advisor at her college , recently groaned while mentioning that she ’ d likely get the same degree in a few years from her current program , which is not accredited . This is not to disparage the institution. It is a fine school with a fine faculty, a fine alumni network, and many bright and promising students . In fact, I would bet that most students who receive degrees from this institution will go on and graduate from the same institution or institutions , and be the best educated and most well prepared individuals in their respective fields .

Will UBS Tap Bob McCann Or Sallie Krawcheck For Top Wealth Management Job ? Former Merill Lynch brokerage head Bob McCann has been appointed to head the new division of UBS. His hiring is a clear signal to hedge fund clients that he will push hard to increase UBS’s profits, which will then lead to the firm’s top management being tapped to head UBS’s most lucrative business – the world’s largest asset manager. In a press conference today McCann said he is not planning to change the way UBS conducts its business.

The Hashemite Library remained a beacon of knowledge and a destination for readers and intellectuals until 2000 , when the Al-Quds University (Qalb), which was established by the PLO in 1971 , took over its responsibilities. Qalb then became the only library for all Palestinian scholars and activists, who used it as a space to debate and share information, a place for the exchange of ideas and a meeting point to discuss issues of importance to the Palestinian people. In the early 1990s, the University of Haifa decided to relocate its Hashemite library to its new campus.

Indeed, by Sunday, temperatures are expected to be back in the 50s, and then possibly into the upper 70s by Jan. 10. But first, the National Weather Service expects mostly sunny skies and a high of 59 degrees on Tuesday. The front will make its way into Fort Worth mid-day, but likely won’t be felt until the overnight hours, making for a chilly Wednesday wake-up with the temperature hovering just above freezing. Wednesday’s high is forecast for 46 degrees with partly cloudy skies, followed by a low of 28.

The University of Sri Jayewardenepura celebrated 60 years of excellence in higher education on 18th February 2019, reaching a significant landmark in its historical journey. The Diamonds Jubilee will be celebrated with the participation of President Maithreepala Sirisena, Chancellor, Most Venerable Dr. Ittapana Dhammalankara, Vice Chancellor of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura Senior Prof. Sampath Amaratunge and other dignitaries at the Bandaranaike Memorial International Conference Hall (BMICH) on 2nd April 2019. The rich and vibrant history of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura - initially as the Vidyodaya Pirivena - dates back to 1873.

PREBLE COUNTY — With two serious crashes involving young people occurring in Preble County over the past week, Preble County Sheriff Mike Simpson discussed summer driving practices as younger, less experienced drivers become more active during the summer. According to Simpson, during the summer roadways often become more active and younger drivers tend to be on the road more because they are no longer in school. “With kids out of school or kids back from college, there a lot more of younger drivers on the roadways going back and forth from events or work now that they aren’t in schools for 6-7 hours a day,” Simpson said.

Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen, his agency said Tuesday. According to KeyEast Entertainment, Kim has recently been offered a leading role in upcoming drama series “When Time Stopped,” a 12-part fantasy-romance. He would play a time traveler living a lonely life. Kim has not yet decided whether to take the offer, KeyEast said. His latest screen work was drama series “Inspiring Generation” in 2014. A former member of idol group SS501, Kim released a single in November and held fan events and concerts. He also recently renewed his contract with the agency.

BOSTON -- ( BUSINESS WIRE ) -- Boston-based private equity real estate firm , Muirfield Investment Partners , is pleased to announce the appointment of Mr. Andrew L. Miller as its chief operating officer (COO). The company also announced today that the board of directors has approved its acquisition of Boston-based office space investment firm , BancBoston Financial, Inc. , which holds the rights to acquire the building that was previously known as Boston's Financial District, located at 880 Washington Street, in the Financial District, Boston, MA. The transaction was approved by the board of directors of BancBoston at its meeting on March 7, 2013.

To a watching world, the sight of Britain on fire this week has surely been shocking. The looting and torching has revealed an inner-city London, Birmingham and Manchester seldom glimpsed in the England usually offered for export via soft-focus period dramas, Hugh Grant movies or stories on Will and Kate. If the revelation has puzzled outsiders, it has confused Britons no less. The mood here is a mixture of rage, fear and bafflement. Not that we’re not used to riots: We are. England caught fire during that other royal-wedding year, 1981.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative. Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it will soon offer a 401(k) platform for employers. In other words, your retirement fund may one day be run by code. The wealth management startup has made a name for itself in the past few years for its so-called robo-adviser services. Investors hoping to do more with their money, but who might not be able to afford the hefty fees that come with financial advice from a human, have turned to companies like Betterment, Wealthfront, and FutureAdvisor for help.

Without much fuss or fanfare, but, happily, with plenty of shoppers, Salisbury quietly reopened its central shopping centre on Saturday, almost three months after it became the site of an international incident. The Maltings, which connects the coach park to the city centre, has been off-limits to the public and shielded by safety cordons and tents since the former spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia were found slumped on one of its park benches after being poisoned. Market traders were moved behind the shopping precinct by Wiltshire county council while the decontamination operation was under way.

Demonstrations erupt in Yemen , Tunisia , Egypt , Gaza , over film made in US which insults Prophet Muhammed and calls for "rebellion." Mohammed, a prominent Shia leader in Yemen, has called for protests against The Passion of Christ, which is scheduled to have its world premiere at the Los Angeles International Film Festival next week. In a video posted on Twitter , he said the film's portrayal of Christ as a violent criminal was "not acceptable for Islam" and urged people to "rise to the defense of our prophet."

Narendra Modi ’ s Election Challenge : Create Jobs . Lots of Them . The Indian government ’ s failure to generate jobs is a cause for much of the disillusionment and political apathy that now threatens the BJP and Modi in particular. That ’ s why he is calling for an election challenge. It ’ s not just an election challenge but also a job creation opportunity. What Modi ’ s challenge will look like is anyone ’ s guess. Modi has never run a campaign like this before, but he ’ s the best strategist in politics.

The daughter of a leading Kannada tabloid editor , who was arrested for allegedly hiring a contract killer to eliminate her mother and sister , has alleged in a police complaint that the killing was orchestrated to avenge her father’s ‘crimes’ against him . The complaint was filed by her mother-in-law, who says that her family is now in ‘great danger’ because of her arrest , which was followed by the killing of her father . “My family and I are under great danger because of my arrest,” she says in the complaint .

Moshiach ( also known as messiah ) is the long awaited Jewish leader who will usher in an era of universal peace and justice. Moshiach or the Messiah would be the long awaited Jewish leader who will usher in an age of justice and peace that will transform the world. Moshiach is an acronym for Moshiach (Mishna), the Hebrew acronym for The Messiah. (Mishna = the word from the Torah that prophesied that the Messiah would come. It is also the name given by Jewish tradition for the one who would come).

The location of the potential Maroon Creek Reservoir, which would be located just below the confluence of East and West Maroon creeks, in view of the Maroon Bells, and partially in the Maroon Bells-Snowmass Wilderness. The city has now reached agreement with seven of ten parties to move the water rights to locations between Aspen and Woody Creek. American Rivers and Colorado Trout Unlimited are the latest of 10 opposing parties to sign agreements with the city of Aspen stating that the city will move its conditional water storage rights out of the upper Castle and Maroon creek valleys to five other locations.

The sad demise of late veteran actor Kader Khan has left a void in the Hindi film industry that can never be filled. But don’t blame him. Kader’s passing was the most shocking news of all time. But he passed away peacefully on January 10, a year after being diagnosed with terminal brain cancer. In the past few weeks, many of his contemporaries, from Ajay Devgn to Anil Kapoor, have started paying tribute to him, expressing shock at his untimely demise, and wishing him well.

If the U.S. presidential election were resolved on social media, Barack Obama would be the clear winner this year over Republican challenger Mitt Romney. The Obama campaign has embraced social media, with the president holding a huge lead in Facebook and Twitter followers, and the affiliated Democratic National Committee is using private social networking tools to communicate with some campaign operatives. There's also evidence that the Obama campaign has tapped into social media analytics to gauge voter sentiment and track the popularity of the campaign's messages. Neither campaign, contacted to discuss their social media strategies, returned messages.

Casey Brumbeloe, a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School, has been selected to serve on the Alabama State Department of Education Superintendent Student Advisory Council. Casey is one of 16 secondary school students selected from 80 applications. Judges of the student applications included representatives from the ALSDE, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership and the 2015-2016 Alabama Teacher of the Year. Students were selected based on their level of leadership in their schools and letters of recommendation. Council members will meet two times throughout the school year with State Superintendent Dr. Tommy Bice.

I want to answer viewer questions again this week , because we 're really beginning to have a vibrant , passionate audience who are willing to talk about the show they love and share their love of the show . We have some really fun interviews coming out, which I will post soon, but we have some special guests on the show , so we thought it would be really cool to bring some of these great folks back on to speak a little about some of their personal experiences on the set and how they feel about all the changes we 've made and how that affects them in their life .

"Fox & Friends" convenes all-male panel to judge whether women are "covering up their lady-parts"
On "Fox & Friends" Tuesday morning, a panel of men was convened to determine the "proper etiquette for wearing leggings," and they did so in the classiest way possible -- by parading young women in leggings before them so that they might critique their appearance. The panel was responding to a video that went viral yesterday in which a woman, as Steve Doocy kept repeating, claimed that leggings "ain't pants."

The fourth episode of Aaron Sorkin ’ s The Newsroom is called “ I ’ ll Try to Fix You. ” In it, a journalist attempts to repair a relationship with a woman after she leaves him after he tells her that she doesn’t know what love is. I can’t really explain the plot in much detail; it’s more of an extended scene than a full episode. But I can explain why I find it to be an excellent piece of television. The Newsroom is based on a concept that I first encountered in The West Wing.

A man was booked for allegedly flashing a 45-year-old woman while she was out on a morning walk in Sector 14 of Chandni Chowk on Thursday afternoon. A police complaint lodged at the Sector 14 police station had claimed the man, whose face is covered, asked the woman if she would ‘have it in her’ if the woman would flash him. “I was out in sector 14 around 8.30 am and this man asked the woman if she would have it in her,” a woman who was with the complainant in the police station.

Montana , Exxon-Mobil At Odds Over Oil Spill Montana and oil giant Exxon-Mobil are at odds over an oil spill from an offshore drilling platform owned by the Texas-based company in the Gulf of Mexico, which could have the potential to become the largest ever oil spill in US history. Exxon is trying to convince the U.S. government to take its case to the International Court of Justice. Exxon-Mobil was the first company to sign a $20.4bn deal to take part in the oil industry's largest ever oil spill clean-up after the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill in 2010.

The infamous Kiran Dhawan murder case is all set to take centre stage once again with the police trying to identify those who were at large at the time of the murder. A CCTV footage from a shop has been released by the police in which four men were seen talking and having a discussion in the CCTV footage, in which one of the men, identified as Akshay Kumar, a man who was wanted in another case, is seen talking to two of the men who have been arrested, identified as Gautam Singh and Vinod Kishan.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook 's full-screen mobile ads , but Wendy 's social marketers already seem to know they need to keep their Facebook ads simple. The sandwich-shop chain and others are already adding "Like" and "Share" buttons to their ads , hoping to bring more people closer to the brand with a simple click of a button. See also:

But Wendy's doesn't want to be the latest brand to put those simple buttons in place. It doesn't want to be the most annoying.

Brands are just starting to play with Facebook's full-screen mobile ads, but Wendy's social marketers already seem to be having lots of fun with the new format. The fast-food chain is running a campaign that uses a combination of photos, videos and GIFs to show how each layer of its hamburgers are made—like wavering pieces of cheese and a grilled beef patty. "The Wendy's quality story carries a lot of equity with our fans and we wanted to invite them into that story, literally layer by layer," said Mike Bueno, director, digital marketing at Wendy's.

GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Officials with the Piedmont Triad International Airport announced Thursday that Allegiant Air will begin a new, nonstop low-fare flight service from PTI to Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. The service will begin June 6 with twice-weekly flights from PTI on Thursdays and Sundays. “We’re pleased to announce yet another affordable and convenient way for our Piedmont Triad customers to get away,” said Allegiant president Andrew Levy. The flight time is estimated to be about two hours. Allegiant is offering a special introductory, one-way fare of $64.99.

Oden Technologies, a fledgling startup that’s setting out to make factories smarter via big data and its industrial internet of things (IIoT) platform, has raised $10 million in a series A round of funding led by Atomico, with participation from EQT Ventures, Inbox Capital, and a number of other seed investors. Founded out of London in 2014, Oden Technologies provides the hardware and software that lets manufacturers access analytics to track faults and establish patterns that may impact performance. It’s ultimately all about improving efficiency and cutting down on production waste.

Anyone who ’ s ever been frustrated at the task of shooting video in low light should be poised to become a video editor in just a moment. The best video editors today can handle low light conditions and capture high-quality video footage, even when filming at very low shutter speeds, like when recording video from an action camera or smartphone. Low light shooting is usually a challenge for film and still image editors, who have to shoot and process the video footage in a dark room, which makes it difficult to see what you’re filming.

BASEL , Switzerland – Swiss pharmaceutical giant Roche Holding AG said Monday that it has had reports of 13 cases of the highly contagious bird flu infection H7N7 reported by the Food and Agriculture Organization between March and July. The reports involve five people from France, two from the United States, two each from the Netherlands, China and Germany. None of the cases have been fatal, the company noted. Roche’s Swiss operations include laboratories and testing facilities, it said, and it was not yet clear what kind of bird flu had infected the patients.

TOKYO ( AFP ) - Nearly half of Tokyo 's residents could not name a single Paralympian and international sporting event that they had witnessed, a survey on Friday showed. The Japan Times/Ipsos Public Opinion Survey found that 45.7 percent of respondents could not name the Winter Paralympic Games that will take place from Friday to next April in Sochi. The Winter Olympics are in nearby Vancouver in 2010, with Paralympics to be held across Europe later in the year. The poll also found that 43.8 percent could not name when they last saw an Asian Games or Asian Boxing and Wrestling Championships.

Bhubaneswar : Shashi Bhushan Behera , Minister Finance & Excise has hoped , IOCL to participate in the Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) in a big way in next year. The Minister said that he would work closely with IOCL for the SPV. “The government will also work closely with IOCL for the SPV. As IOCL is a world leading company , we will do everything in our capacity to help IOCL in their endeavor to grow in the international market.”, Shashi Bhushan told PTI on the occasion of World ILC, organised in Kolkata on October 14.

If you 've come to this page , you 've probably decided that it 's time to make physical activity a permanent part of your life. If you 've already started a regular program, this article is for you - it 's about why making exercise a habit is so hard. Why Physical Activity Is Hard to Stick with

When it comes to physical activity , the most difficult part of the process isn't actually making the time to go for a run. The truth is, it takes a lot of willpower to stop yourself from being a couch potato for a week or two and instead get active.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach (R-IA) went down to defeat in the massacre of 2006. I'm no apologist for "moderate Republicans" but it is worth saying that Leach was, in my estimation, fairly clearly the best House Republican. Nevertheless, one can only be thrilled with his defeat. That it happened just goes to show how fundamentally rotten the whole GOP scene had become. Leach was, in many ways, a person possessed of genuinely decent instincts and some fundamentally sound ideas about how the United States should conduct itself in the world. Nevertheless, in practice he was useless.

A local state representative is calling for fundamental reform of the state ’ s standardized testing system after the “inadequate performance” of one school district — one in which the majority of children are black and Hispanic, and where the district scored in the bottom five percent on standardized tests in 2017. A state lawmaker is calling for a moratorium on school choice in Massachusetts, an idea the governor says he'll support. A state lawmaker is looking to eliminate a key funding source for the state's public universities, but that idea has a big opponent in the administration.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform. Battles, a safety, was brought in as a free agent to provide depth in the defensive secondary. Battles, who played his college ball at Vanderbilt, was one of the few undrafted rookie free agents to earn an opening day roster spot for the Steelers in 2000. He spent two seasons with Pittsburgh and one with Jacksonville, playing in 45 games, starting 17, and intercepting three passes. But, Battles lost his love for the game last year and quit just two weeks into training camp with the Buffalo Bills.

Man robs jewellery on crutches! A man with a bandaged leg and using crutches fled a British hospital after allegedly steeling three gold rings from a jewellery shop there, police said. Police said the theft occurred Wednesday when the man asked to see the rings before grabbing them and running onto the grounds of Cardiff's University of Wales Hospital. The man described as heavyset and in his 30s or 40s took a nine carat white gold diamond ring, an 18 carat white gold ring and a 19 carat white gold ring with diamond studs.

Why’s an incendiary Dutch journalist on the payroll of the ex-Alaska governor’s political action committee? A Mother Jones investigation. In recent months, Sarah Palin’s political action committee, SarahPAC, has paid thousands of dollars to a mysterious company that’s gone to significant lengths to mask its ownership. Addresses linked to the firm lead to mail drops. It has no website. No phone number. Not even the California lawyer who incorporated the company knew who was behind it. But a Mother Jones investigation has found that this firm is run by an unlikely foreign political operative.

ISLAMABAD: The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) is facing a serious financial crisis since its slain founding leader Baitullah Mehsud combined several scattered groups from all over the tribal belt to form the most feared terror network of homegrown militants back in 2007. “The Taliban have seriously run out of funds…they have hardly any money anymore,” at least three associates of the group said amid a surprising halt in their activities – suicide bombings and terror attacks across Pakistan and in parts of Afghanistan – in recent months.

Moving into modern times , mobile game tool developer Corona Labs has acquired mobile cloud services startup Game Minion . SHENANDOAH -- A church in Schuylkill County is preparing to honor the late Fr . Walter Ciszek , S.J . with a special Mass on Friday, May 19, at 10 a.m. at St. Mary's Church. Walter Ciszek will be celebrated in his native Czechoslovakia on Saturday, May 20, at 7 p.m. at Immaculate Heart of Mary Church in West Schuylkill. Fr. Walter Ciszek died May 8 from injuries he sustained in a motor vehicle accident. The Mass is being conducted in Latin.

WASHINGTON - RFK Stadium, the once and future home of major league baseball in the nation's capital, doesn't yet look like a field of dreams. It's configured for soccer, not baseball. The field must be replaced, and the dugouts, locker rooms and press box need upgrades. On a rainy day last week, a quarter of the field was mud and tire tracks. It looked like Vince Lombardi should be coaching football here - which he once did for the Washington Redskins. But that was in 1969.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to end malnutrition and to increase productive work days for children. Brazil’s success in improving nutrition and reducing its child mortality rate is largely attributable to the successful application of evidence-based and cost-effective actions. This includes the implementation of the World Food Programme’s Food Security Strategy in 2011–2015, the expansion and strengthening of rural and primary health-care services, which has led to the reduction of stunting in schoolchildren and the reduction in the number of child deaths from malnutrition.

Hetton-born Northern Powergrid boss remembers dad as he gets OBE The Queen ’ s New Year ’ s Honours list has revealed the life story of the man behind the Northern Powergrid – a family man who never wanted to be famous but found his destiny in the North West. OMAHA, Neb. – Nebraska men's basketball player Deverell Biggs has been cited on suspicion of driving under the influence and leaving the scene of an accident in Omaha last weekend. According to a police report, Biggs backed his Chevrolet Suburban into a Bellevue man's vehicle about 1:35 a.m. Sunday. Biggs spoke briefly to the other driver and drove off. Police stopped Biggs several miles away. His blood-alcohol content measured .134, over the legal limit of .08. The 20-year-old Biggs also was cited for minor in possession and unsafe backing.

TOKYO (AFP) - Nearly half of Tokyo's residents could not name a single Paralympian and international sporting officials are worried about the city's readiness to accommodate athletes. As the 2020 Games approaches, the Japanese capital has work to do. "If the Paralympics is not a success, the Tokyo Games are not a success," Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike told Agence France-Presse in a recent interview. So with an eye to filling stadiums, Tokyo has embarked on an overhaul of its infrastructure, making its subway system disabled-friendly and reaching out to hotels to check on their ease of access for wheelchair users.

Richard Randolph Lamb, a resident of Dunsmuir, passed away on September 17, 2009 at Mercy Medical Center in Mount Shasta. Richard was born in Fairview, Montana. He moved to Siskiyou County from Oregon in 1919. Richard was a veteran of the US Navy serving in the Pacific Fleet during World War II. He worked as a railroad engineer for Southern Pacific Railroad for 34 years. Richard was a member of the Veterans of Foreign Wars of Dunsmuir. His hobbies included bowling, cars, music, traveling and love for his family.

She could tell us about the early days when entire families slept on their fishing boats. We’d hear tales about the break of morning on the river, when husbands took those same boats and joined the fishing fleet going out to sea while families stayed behind with wives working hard in the fish house, processing fish.

Expect sunshine today as high pressure builds in this weekend . After a cold start , temperatures will warm to mid-80s and stay there into Monday . High winds will begin on Friday with a 30-50 mph gusts . High pressure will remain with us through Sunday , but it will be much less stable than the cold front we’re already dealing with this weekend . It will make for cooler temperatures , but that will be more a temporary respite . The wind will be a factor in the forecast through Sunday , especially on Saturday when the highest winds will be in the mid to upper 20s and 30-40 mph .

Margaret O ’ Brien , 69 , moved from Canada to Wolverhampton in 1971 , got married , had three children and raised them in the city . She died of lung cancer in February 2014 , leaving her husband, two sons and two grandchildren . Margaret O'Brien was born in Ontario on September 8, 1928 , and grew up in the city . When she was 15 she moved to Canada from Ireland to work for her brother in the family printing business and stayed until she married . She had two children while living with her husband and three while married .

There ’ s a Speed Graphic camera , once standard equipment in newsrooms across the country . You may have had one in college, or even in your high school years . But these days, its use is much less common. Even as the camera has fallen out of favor in schools, it has become a staple in newsrooms across the country. In fact, there ’ s a very good reason for it. As the use of digital technology becomes more common, and the cost of storage drops , news organizations have found they have a better return on investment in digital video cameras.

Israeli soldiers shot and wounded one Palestinian teenager as he was taking refuge in an ambulance from a roadblock on Thursday, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. It was the fourth Palestinian to be shot or wounded in a matter of two months. An Israeli soldier was killed on July 31 by a Palestinian sniper as he approached a border post.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $7.5 million worth of the digital currency Bitcoin. The device is now buried somewhere in a vast landfill site near the home of owner James Howells -- who only realized his mistake when it was too late. "It is soul destroying to be honest,” Howells told NBC News on Thursday. "I haven’t had much sleep over the past few days. Every second of the day I am thinking about what could have been."
