NEW DELHI : A day after India and the US signed an agreement to reduce oil imports, the global oil demand has gone up for the first time since 2010. As per data from National Petroleum Council (India) , the country's oil import in 2017-18 stood at 3.3 million tonnes against 3.2 million tonnes for the previous year. The country's oil import in 2016-17 had been at 2.3 million tonnes. The new agreement will cut oil imports to 2.1 million tonnes in 2018-19 and 2.3 million tonnes in 2019-20.

Twitter used to be a cool place to share your succinct thoughts . Now al-Shabab , the vicious Somali allies of al-Qaida in East Africa , has taken over . In one day , Twitter became the most dangerous place for African journalists to express themselves . Al-Shabab is a Somali group with close ties to al-Qaida . It is now the de facto government of Somalia . The group has declared an "Islamic State" . It controls territory throughout Somalia and is in a state of war with African Union (AU) forces. The government of Somalia, the African Union Mission to Somalia and African Union forces are all fighting the group.

WASHINGTON -- An Iowa egg producer at the center of a nationwide outbreak of salmonella apologized to a Congressional panel Wednesday for how the outbreak may have been handled in his state, which was among the most heavily hit. He said he was not aware that some eggs were sent to restaurants and other facilities before the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended that he do so. "We have made mistakes in this case, as in other food safety cases," Iowa Department of Public Health spokesman Dan Vergano said in an e-mail.

High above Midtown Manhattan, the front-runner in the Republican race for the presidency and the leading woman in prime-time news met to settle a score. Donald Trump and Megyn Kelly, who have spent the better part of the election cycle publicly feuding, privately fuming, or ignoring one another, met at Trump Tower on Monday, seemingly ending the silence between them. “Yes, the doormen appeared a bit stunned when I walked in,” Kelly said on her Fox News show Wednesday night.

Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze is Ukraine 's deputy Prime Minister in charge of European affairs . Ukrainian Deputy Prime Minister Ivanna Klympush-Tsynadze has said her government is ready to assist in Ukraine's European integration in all possible ways and is ready to help, even in areas where the EU had no influence. Ivan Denisovich Tymoshenko said that the EU's decision to lift economic sanctions against Russia for its annexation of the Crimea region had caused Ukraine a loss of faith in Europe, and said he was confident that he could convince the government in Kiev of this. He added that he had spoken about this with President Poroshenko.

KARACHI : Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah on Tuesday extended Pakistan Rangers , Sindh ’ s special powers , which he took on a two-month visit to Karachi last week, to the entire country. He was addressing a gathering in the Rangers ’ headquarters here.

Former Chicago police officer Jason Van Dyke was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in the killing of 17-year-old Laquan McDonald, more than four years after the shooting. Jason Van Dyke, the former Chicago cop whose fatal 2014 shooting of black teenager Laquan McDonald reignited the fervent nationwide conversation about police shootings, was sentenced Friday to six years and nine months in prison. The veteran police officer was convicted in October of second-degree murder and 16 counts of aggravated battery with a firearm for the shooting in October 2014. The shooting and video of it prompted protests throughout Chicago and calls for Van Dyke to face serious prison time.

Featured as one of America’s 10 Best Towns for Families by Family Circle Magazine, Allen offers a family-friendly community with exceptional schools, excellent city services and facilities, and a nationally recognized parks and recreation system. Within the city boundaries of approximately 27 square miles, you’ll find nearly 50 miles of nature trails, seven recreational facilities and over 30 parks and greenbelts. ( Host ) Two groups involved with mental health care want to know which Vermont doctors got thousands of dollars in taxpayer money from the state Department of Health and Welfare for mental health training, according to an investigative report. The state Health and Welfare Department gave grants of up to $20,000 each to 16 medical professionals in 2002 and 2003. Six of those doctors were working for a company that was paid by the state to offer training on mental health. In Vermont, health care providers may not accept money from an entity if they are involved with any form of the business of medicine.

If you've come to this page, you've probably decided that it's time to make physical activity a regular part of your life  or you want to get more ideas to boost your regular physical activity program. The Heart and Stroke Foundation recommends that adults get 30 to 60 minutes of physical activity, most days of the week. Children should be active 60 to 90 minutes a day, most days of the week. Try to fit physical activity throughout your day  walking to work, taking a physical activity break at lunch time, going for an after-dinner stroll.

Arsene Wenger believes the return to fitness of England forward Theo Walcott and imminent recovery of Germany international Lukas Podolski means Arsenal are not under extra pressure to buy another striker in January. The Gunners resume domestic action on Saturday looking to respond from the 1-0 defeat at Manchester United with victory over third-placed Southampton to stay top of the Barclays Premier League. Walcott is set to face his old club following some two months sidelined by an abdominal problem which needed surgery. Podolski, meanwhile, is on course to be available again by the end of December after being out since August 27 with a hamstring injury.

Manatees are large , gray aquatic mammals . They have fat bodies — I believe that “ husky ” is actually the proper term to describe a manta ray . They’ve been around since the Miocene and are now considered to be the oldest vertebrate order on Earth . That makes them one of the earliest species to have appeared on Earth . This means they’ve survived all sorts of extreme conditions and natural disasters and have lived out the course of evolutionary time without the benefit of modern medicine . They live in the open ocean and are a major part of the food chain.

In Lean Times, Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie don't usually top the list of America's favorite sweets. But in Depression-era America, these and other desperation pies that survive today showed off home cooks' ingenuity. Some desperation pies, like green tomato pie, still enjoy niche popularity today. Imagine yourself as a resourceful farmer during the Great Depression. You'd like to make a dessert for your family, but traditional pie ingredients, like cherries or pecans, are too expensive or not available.

DENVER (AP) — The nonpartisan administrator of Colorado’s state Senate has warned staff, aides and interns that policy forbids them from speaking to journalists about workplace issues — including sexual harassment. KUNC-FM reported Tuesday that Senate Secretary Effie Ameen sent two emails reminding workers that giving interviews to reporters is a violation of chamber policy. Ameen sent the emails in February and March as the Senate’s GOP leadership was insisting that sexual misconduct and workplace harassment complaints against lawmakers either be handled confidentially — per the Legislature’s workplace harassment policy — or by prosecutors.

Want to end the war on whistleblowers ? Revise the Espionage Act . Over the past 100 years , the Espionage Act has expanded to the point that it has been used more times than all other laws combined. Today, the U.S. Supreme Court will hear arguments in the case brought by the Justice Department against the WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange over the Espionage Act. Assange is being prosecuted for the unauthorized disclosure of government secrets, which is a felony. I’m writing this because I believe it’s time for an overhaul of the Espionage Act as part of a larger reform of the U.S. government.

It's been more than a decade since Eminem's one and only starring role in 8 Mile, and you would be fair to assume his acting career had begun and ended right there. Now the project has been picked up by the Weinstein Company, and though Eminem isn't technically out of the running, he may be on the verge of being replaced by some of the biggest starts out there.

ABC TV political discussion program Insiders is coming to Byron Bay. Host Barrie Cassidy will guide a visiting panel that will include journalists David Marr, Alice Workman and Peter van Onselen, to discuss the big political developments of 2018. David Marr is regarded as one of Australia's most influential commentators, writing on subjects ranging from politics and censorship to the media and the arts. He has been a journalist since 1973 and is the recipient of four Walkley awards for journalism. Alice Workman is the political reporter for BuzzFeed News, based in the press gallery at Parliament House.

Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2, 1857. According to a statement in the Stark County (Mississippi) District Attorney's Office, they pleaded guilty in Stark County Circuit Court on Tuesday to the first-degree murder of a trader named Thomas L. Walker, who had been shot in the back and killed outside his home in the Mississippi Delta, in what was one of the last known cases of revenge killing against Choctaw citizens who had crossed the border to live on land that belonged to whites.

The ruling AAP had earlier on March 2, announced the names of its candidates for the six Lok Sabha seats.

In the last decade, the band known as Pixies has become the most widely streamed band in the world, ranking behind only the Beatles and Bob Dylan. DENVER -- During the summer of 2002 , Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to decide what to do with the state-owned land that surrounded it. By July 10th, state officials had determined the best response to the Hayman Fire was to let the Colorado National Monument become part of a larger national park. At that time, then-state Senator Peter Groff (who later became a Republican governor) said there would be public meetings to learn the details of what was to be changed. And the state would then decide what needed to be done with what was to be destroyed in the process.

Ely, in northeastern Minnesota, is the gateway to the sprawling Superior National Forest and its 1 million-acre Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, a popular recreation area. Ely is also the home of the North American Bear Center and the International Wolf Center. Whether campers are looking for a true wilderness experience or a somewhat less primitive encounter with nature, the Ely area has campgrounds to suit just about every taste. Just south of the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Bear Head Lake State Park (dnr.state.mn.us/state_parks/bear_head_lake/camping.html) is home to a wide array of wildlife, including bald eagles, black bear, moose and wolves.

Twitter used to be a cool place to share your succinct thoughts. Now al-Shabab, the vicious Somali allies of al-Qaida, is using it as a propaganda venue. al-Shabab began tweeting in English on Wednesday using the handle @HSMPress. The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI), Nagpur, and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to look into a proposal by Agra Nagar Nigam to set up a waste-to-energy plant. Agra falls under the Taj Trapezium Zone, an area of about 10,400 sq km spread over the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and the Bharatpur district of Rajasthan. Agra Nagar Nigam, an urban local body, sought permission of the top court to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state. Repeat drunk driving offenders could soon face harsher penalties for their actions. New Jersey law now limits punishment for affected offenders to a traffic offense. Bail typically is set at $2,500. The traffic offense designation allows drivers charged with drunken driving to continue to drive while awaiting their court date. Awaiting consideration on the Assembly floor is a bill to end that practice. Instead, A3057 would boost punishment for a person convicted of driving under the influence two times or more within 60 days to a fourth-degree crime.

Russian President Vladimir Putin called Turkey ’ s downing of a Russian fighter jet today ( 24 November ) a ‘ ’ grave mistake ’ ’ ‘ ‘ ‘ and he described Turkey ‘s response as ‘ ‘’ aggressive and disproportionate,’ ’’ his spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters during a briefing on Thursday evening. The Internet has changed beyond anything could have foreseen just five years ago. It is no longer a browsing medium: it is full of Web 2.0 applications, real time communications challenges and a whole range of threats that are designed to piggy back on this new usage. As a result, Web security has changed immeasurably - it's no longer enough to block, stop or inhibit IP sessions. Web filtering cannot hope to meet the security challenge. This Webinar will explain how Internet usage has changed and how your perception of IT may not match what your users are actually doing, resulting in your security controls being by-passed.

U.S. trade policy has become the top concern among chief financial officers , according to a CNBC quarterly survey . The CFOs polled by CNBC are looking at what their companies are doing to address the U.S. trade policy, which has been the subject of strong political disagreement for the last several months. In addition to the trade dispute, the stock market has recently experienced a major sell-off. The survey found that more than one-third of the responding companies are "very concerned" about "trade policy developments," up from 31 percent last quarter.

LORD Of The Rings star Liv Tyler headed out with just her husband for the day . A father who broke his back trying to stop thieves from stealing his car has stunned doctors by walking down the middle aisle as he recovers. John McDonough, 57, was sitting in a wheelchair as he received an MRI scan on Tuesday, having walked across the ward from his room to the X-ray department, before walking back again to sit in a chair and wait to hear what the doctor will say. A doctor asked: "Have you got anything to say about what you have just been through?" Then the father asked the doctor what would happen to his daughter.

Washington D.C. , Jul 31 , 2018 / 03:01 pm ( ) .- The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority was the only entity authorized by the D.C. Metropolitan Area Transit Policy Act of 1982 to be the entity responsible for operating and maintaining the Metrorail system in D.C. For more than a quarter century, WMATA had been responsible for the operation of all Metrorail system segments and stations. It was only in recent months that WMATA has undertaken a comprehensive review of its operations, to ensure that WMATA is prepared to operate effectively and efficiently for the next 25 years into the future.

“Interaction of Color,” the landmark 1963 book by Josef Albers — the German-born artist and educator who taught at the Bauhaus, Black Mountain College and Yale University over the course of his storied career — isn’t just for aspiring artists. Its mesmerizing illustrations are a revelation for anyone interested in color theory and human perception. On Thursday, to mark the book’s 50th anniversary, Yale University Press, the publisher of the original edition, will offer a fresh way to engage with Albers’s lessons by releasing the “Interaction of Color” App for the iPad.

The Maine State Lottery tapped Fuseideas as its advertising agency of record. NL Partners of Portland, Maine, previously handled the account. Work will be handled out of the Fuseideas' Portland office and include broadcast, print, out-of-home, point-of-purchase, digital and social media programs for the lottery. The agency will also handle media buying and planning duties. New work debuts in the spring. The Maine State Lottery spent $655,000 on measured media in 2013 and $565,000 in 2014, according to Kantar Media. The Variable was named agency of record for Soffe, an athletic apparel brand, following a competitive pitch.

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames, police have said. Divers on the riverbank spotted a body after spotting a man matching his description near the site of a reported murder. They alerted Thames Valley police at 4.25pm yesterday and officers confirmed the body was that of a young boy in his teens or 20s. The body is in the Thames and is now in a police mortuary for an examination to establish whether the man was the boy’s father or uncle, according to the Metropolitan police’s Assistant Chief Constable Mark Hamilton.

A woman was threatened when she was approached by a stranger in a street in Lindfield yesterday afternoon . Police are trying to determine who made the threats and why. Police do not believe that the incident was random and that the person was targeting her for a reason. That person should not be able to walk the streets freely. The attack was witnessed by two other people in the area who have been in touch with the woman.

BlackBerry has decided not to renew T-Mobile 's license to sell its products . A promotion that went awry last month resulted in the demise of T-Mobile 's plans to sell the BlackBerry phone. That was a good move, as it kept the phone out of the public eye and away from hackers. Part two of Naomi Klein's report on the events that triggered a momentous new kind of politics in Argentina. Up until quite recently, Argentina pursued a policy of official amnesia when it came to the crimes of the Dirty War. Sure, the human rights non-governmental organisations still issued numerous scathing reports, the Mothers of the Plaza de Mayo still marched and the children of disappeared parents still showed up, from time to time, outside the homes of ex-military figures to throw red paint. But before the Argentinazo, most middle-class Argentinians regarded such actions as macabre rituals from a bygone era.

UNITED NATIONS , August 26 -- Amid an increasing drumbeat of media coverage predicting US missile strikes on Syria , the Syrian regime of Bashar Assad is making good on a threat given to the United States last September by the Russian leader, Vladimir Putin. According to an August 25 report on the Russian state-run news agency, RIA, the regime had already prepared to retaliate for US air attacks on Syria when the Pentagon announced that it was launching strikes against Syria in retaliation to a chemical attack on Aug. 21 that the United States, Britain and France blamed on the Assad regime.

TICKETS for Manchester United 's pre-season friendly against Barcelona are on sale for almost £1,000 each . When the ticket was bought, Manchester United were in their first season back in the top flight since 1996.

Jeremy Tucker is leaving the top marketing position at Nissan North American to “pursue other opportunities,” according to the automaker. However, it is time to start offering a more complete service that provides more data on a home that buyers can use to make comparisons to other homes.

The vote-rigging scheme known as "voter fraud" may be much more pervasive than previously thought. A new study indicates that millions of "exact matches" have been found on the voting rolls in five states. On Monday, a report issued by the U.S. Justice Department's Civil Rights Division revealed new findings about voter rolls in five states. In all five states, researchers found instances where voters registered multiple times with the same name.

JERUSALEM ( JTA ) — Israel ’ s military used unnecessary force against protesters in Lebanon who tried to breach the heavily guarded border with Gaza in a bid to break the Israeli blockade, a Palestinian human rights group said Tuesday. In a report issued on Monday, Palestinian Media Watch said that after a demonstration on the Lebanese border late Monday, soldiers fired live rounds and rubber bullets, causing the death of two protestors and injuring two. They said that in a similar demonstration on the border on Friday, dozens of Palestinians tried to enter Israel by breaking through the border wall.

Craig Watson ( top ) and Lee Stephenson have been jailed for 21 years combined after an armed robbery on a tram on the M25 in west London. But, after the judge said he had "no doubt he [Mr Watson] will commit further serious offences", he was jailed for only 10 years and six months after pleading guilty. The pair, both 22, were stopped by three youths armed with a machete while on their mobile phones on a tram on the morning of June 14 last year. They were each jailed for 21 years, to be served concurrently with a five-year term.

Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a grocery shop while infected. The alert is the fourth of its kind in recent weeks. The most recent infected person visited a number of public spaces between Sunday January 27 and Wednesday January 30. 30 January: on train from Aubin Grove to Perth between 10:25 - 11:15am, and from Canning Bridge to Mandurah between 2:20-3:15pm. On bus 100 between Canning Bridge and Cannington between 10:50-11:40am, and bus 101 from Curtin University to Canning Bridge between 2-2:50pm.

Surplex is an online auctioneer and marketplace that specialises in the sale of used metalworking and woodworking machinery. The company’s new mobile app is making it easier than ever for businesses to buy and sell industrial equipment — allowing bids to be made on the move. Surplex has been hosting machinery sales and auctions for more than 15 years now. After strong and steady growth throughout Europe, the Surplex website now has more than 150,000 visitors every month, from 150 countries. The online services offered by this growing company now include various payment facilities, transport cost calculators and a comprehensive online search facility.

Dundee United are to begin talks in the next few days in an attempt to prevent Scotland striker Steven Thompson from leaving. Thompson, who signed for the club for an undisclosed fee in January, scored on his full debut in the 4-0 win against St Mirren last weekend. The Scotland under-20 international has scored five goals this season as United have won their opening nine matches. In a statement, United said: "Steven has informed the board that he would like to begin negotiations to discuss the possibility of playing elsewhere. We would like to place the onus on him to make himself available for any reasonable bid.

Two people have been injured in a crash on State Highway 2 near Whakamaramara . What was initially reported as a single-vehicle crash at 3.35pm on Tuesday was actually two vehicles travelling at the same speed in the same location and one of the cars ran a red light, striking a second car. The driver of one car stopped at the scene and has been treated for shock. Two other occupants of the other car were not seriously injured. The investigation into the cause of the accident will take place. Travelling to and from work is the biggest cause of injury and death on Queensland's roads, according to a new report.

A budget crisis facing the Palestinian government is deepening in the wake of last week's election victory by the Islamic resistance group, Hamas. On Thursday the Palestinian Authority (PA) announced it was delaying payment of January salaries to 137,000 government staff by at least two weeks because of post-election budget problems. The PA needs $116 million to cover the monthly payroll. But after Hamas' election victory last week, Israel said it was suspending its monthly tax transfers to the PA, worth about $45 million, pending further review.

A new poll reveals that more Americans would choose the Internet as their only news source than TV, radio and newspapers combined, and Internet reports are considered much more reliable that other media. It also shows only 1 in 200 people surveyed believes newspapers will be a dominant source of information in 2014. The survey discovered 56 percent of adults nationwide would pick the Internet if they were allowed just one source for their news, while television, newspapers and radio earned the support of 41 percent – together. Among Republicans, 56 percent would choose the Internet for their news, while among Democrats that figure was 50 percent.

A search for ‘ toxic mold ’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘ studies , ’ but the problem may be larger than anyone thinks. The truth is that mold exposure is the #1 killer of babies born at home , yet there is no national standard for safe mold testing. The lack of testing makes it hard to know who is at risk, and how to reduce exposure. The CDC’s current advice is to look for ‘ warning signs that may indicate the presence of mold ’ on your baby’s skin,’ but this may be a dangerous approach.

THOMAS Duffy is a sculptor who is preparing a commemorative bronze to celebrate the life of a father he never knew. Thomas is the son of Tommy Duffy, who was killed in December, 1972, when a car bomb exploded in Dublin’s Sackville Place. He was born just a few months after those terrible events and has only known his father through hearing stories from family members who knew his father. He has now been commissioned by Dublin City Council and CIE, to prepare a bronze sculpture to be set in the pavement at Sackville Place commemorating the victims of the 72 and 73 bombings.

OTTAWA , March 20 ( Reuters ) - In a fresh blow to the embattled government of Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper, the justice department said the government will not accept the advice of the RCMP to prosecute its top officials. In a statement on its website, the department said the RCMP has been investigating allegations of money laundering against Harper and his staff. The statement added that Harper and his chief of staff, Nigel Wright, have denied any wrongdoing. The department also said it will not recommend that the matter be investigated further by the RCMP or the Canada Border Services Agency.

Professionals gearing up for Olathe’s public firework display on Tuesday are taking extensive safety precautions and following many regulations that many families forget about in backyard displays. Fireworks caused about 11,100 injuries nationwide in 2016, with children younger than 15 accounting for 31 percent of those injuries, according to the U.S Consumer Product Safety Commission. In 2015, the office of the Kansas State Fire Marshall counted 137 firework-related injuries. The year before, nearly 40 percent of firework injuries harmed children 12 or younger. Municipality policies vary in Kansas and Missouri.

Anyone who’s ever been frustrated at the task of shooting video in low light should be poised to freak out over Canon’s weird and amazing new camera. It’s a video camera that shoots full HD color footage in almost complete darkness. The ‘multi-purpose’ camera, dubbed only MH20F-SH, has a full-frame sensor with 2.26 megapixels. The reason for the meager resolution is because each pixel is very large—19 microns to be exact. That’s 7.5x larger than, say, the pixels found on a flagship DSLR like the Canon 1Dx.

Sarah Haire heard rumblings about a storm approaching the coastline , but she expected it all to blow over . It didn't though . It became a cyclone . Ms Haire and two other people were caught in its path. They were washed away and drowned . The incident took place in Port Douglas on Australia's south coast, where Ms Haire was walking along a beach at about 4pm last Thursday when she saw a "really big cyclone" approaching. "I looked up and I thought this is a really big cyclone coming," she said. "It was about this long.

The 27th annual Southwest Iowa Hot Air Balloon Days is underway this weekend in Creston. Balloon committee spokesman Bill Fastenow says the winds are the determining factor of whether or not the balloons will fly and, of course, their destination. Fastenow says this (Saturday) afternoon at 4:30, there’s a balloonists’ meeting, followed by a “night glow” at the Creston Airport south of town, which he says is a pretty sight to see. Creston Chamber of Commerce executive director Ellen Gerharz says at least 57 balloonists have signed up to take part in this weekend’s events.

The tide is turning at Frankston , with the Dolphins scoring successive victories for the first time in almost six years this weekend. In the first period, it looked like the Dolphins were heading for a familiar end-to-end battle against the Brisbane Broncos, but a strong comeback from their opponents saw the home team come out ahead in a game that saw the Broncos come back with a late try and a late field goal. With a scoreline of 18-4, it was the Dolphins who controlled the game for the first quarter of the match as they put pressure on their opponents and held a 13-3 lead after the first quarter.

Demonstrations erupt in Yemen, Tunisia, Egypt, Gaza, over film made in US which insults Prophet Muhammed. A film released on Youtube that is considered blasphemous has sparked violent protests and attacks on US diplomatic missions in several countries. Here a Palestinian man burns the US flag during demonstrations in Gaza City on September 12. Protesters angered by an anti-Islam film storm the US Embassy in Yemen(***)s capital. A Libyan man holds a placard in English during a demonstration against the attack on the US consulate that killed four Americans, including the ambassador, in Benghazi, Libya.

The US is pursuing a plan to push Palestinians into northern Sinai and transfer part of the West Bank to Israel. As President Donald Trump continues to bluster and tweet his way through a chaotic presidency, the Middle East is simmering dangerously close to a boiling point. Wars in Yemen and Syria are still burning hard, the feud between Qatar and the so-called Quartet of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), Egypt and Bahrain trundles on with no apparent end in sight, Iran continues to flex its military muscles, and both Iraq and Egypt struggle to contain terrorist attacks.

A man has been jailed for keeping dogs for fighting at his home in Ayrshire. Tony Barbara, 50, was found guilty of having two pit bull terrier-type dogs for fighting despite being subject to a 10-year ban from keeping the animals. Kilmarnock Sheriff Court heard animal welfare officers and police searched Barbara's home in High Street, Newmilns, East Ayrshire, on November 12 2014 after being given a tip-off. The officers found two dogs with puncture wounds and scars. The animals, named Kira and Jackie, had been kept in crates in the kitchen and the bedroom.

Ray Trew has stepped down as chairman of Notts County and has announced that the League Two club is for sale. Trew became owner and chairman in 2010 but said he made the decision after his family were subjected to "foul and mindless abuse" in recent days. Notts, who appointed Jamie Fullarton as manager in January, are 16th in League Two having been relegated last season. BBC Radio Nottingham reports local businessman Alan Hardy is in talks to buy the club. "It is with very mixed emotions that I announce the end of my tenure," Trew wrote in an open letter to fans.

Volunteer divers have recovered the body of a teenager who went missing when he went swimming in the River Thames after police halted their underwater searches due to poor visibility. Ellis Downes jumped into the water to cool off with friends on Saturday evening, but got into difficulty as he tried to swim back to the riverbank and disappeared from view. The 16-year-old's family were highly critical of Thames Valley Police after the force said it was awaiting specialist teams to continue the underwater searches. Ellis' mother Emma thanked the volunteers, saying: "If it wasn't for you our little boy would still be in that river now."

Education Week special reports present a unique advertising opportunity as we can customize a number of different campaigns around a theme. This is an opportunity to take full advantage of the media we have available to us to get our content in front of our audience. For example, we can create a campaign around a recent issue or news story that we think will resonate with our readers, and make it a priority to be the first to know about that story. The more information we put out about a story, the better our chances are of getting our message in front of our audience.

In the lead up to the Super Bowl last week , NFL Hall of Famer Ladainian Tomlinson gave his projection on the New England Patriots team and he was not shy about how he thought things were going for them. Tomlinson said they’re going to lose by three touchdowns and he gave his reasoning why. “I like Tom Brady a lot,” he told the New York Daily News after his prediction. Tomlinson said he saw a lot of evidence that “it will be close and it will be hard to come back, but if the team has the right mindset, they’ll be OK”.

As a veteran of the movement to combat climate change , I have been conditioned to expect disappointment . So far, we’ve seen disappointing news about global carbon emissions, disappointing news about coal , disappointment about renewables and disappointments at the international level. Still, this disappointment is not about global warming; it is about climate politics . It is not about policy . The policy debate is a sideshow, while the real problem is politics and politics is a sideshow. And it’s not a sideshow that will be resolved by climate change policy either, so the disappointment is not about the policy debate.

The foremost name among all such group is that of Bajrang Dal whose activist burnt alive , an Australian missionary priest Father John O'Sullivan who was killed by Hindu extremists on the intervening night of April 6 and 7, 2009 in Pulwama in Kashmir. The Bajrang Dal (BD) chief, Dilip Singh Bajwa, was among the terrorists who attacked Father John with his own hand during the attacks on Indian security forces. The attacks were carried out in two phases, first targeting security forces in the valley, and later, the missionary Father John.

When George Orwell wrote â€œ1984â€ he included a vision of the future in which people would converse in a language called. Orwell described Newspeak as “the only language in the world whose vocabulary gets smaller every year”. Orwellâ€™s idea with Newspeak was to have a world where all shades of meaning were removed from language, which reinforced the total dominance of the State. Calling something one thing when itâ€™s the exact opposite also might be an example of Orwellian Newspeak, like calling a bill full of spending on liberal social programs an economic stimulus plan.

The data center market in Russia continues to grow. One needs to look only at the considerable increase in commissioned facilities to find evidence of this. Consumers are no longer impressed by data centers spanning several thousand square meters, containing 1000 or more racks—these have become de rigeur. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, for the last two years the Russian data-center market is ahead of India, China and Brazil in terms of total investment. Similarly, based on recent construction data from the same period, Russia places second only to Brazil from BRICS nations in terms of total area.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin Murphy as permanent head of the Community Correction Department. There was no change in his existing pay of $123,380. Murphy was put in charge after Gov. Asa Hutchinson fired Sheila Sharp for raising questions about the sufficiency of agency parole and probation officer staffing. Murphy brings a checkered resume to the job. At one time he had a deal being paid by a nonprofit that worked in behalf of agency employees and also drew Correction Department retirement.

JERUSALEM (JTA) — Israel’s military used unnecessary force against protesters in Lebanon who tried to breach the border during demonstrations on Nakba Day, a United Nations report said. The report, given to members of the U.N. Security Council and obtained by the Israeli daily newspaper Haaretz, was prepared by U.N. special coordinator for Lebanon, Michael Williams. Israel’s Foreign Ministry has severed contact with Williams until further notice over the report, according to the newspaper. Seven Lebanese protesters died during the May 14 demonstrations marking the day that Israel became an independent state.

Parts of Prince William Forrest Park in Virginia will re-open Monday after a March windstorm closed the park to visitors for weeks. A National Park Service news release says areas that are clear of fallen and hazardous trees will open Monday. Visitors can enter the park from Park Entrance Road off of Joplin Road beginning at 9 am. Piedmont Forest Trail, Laurel Trail Loop, Birch Bluff Trail, and Crossings Trail will be open to the public. The Pine Grove Picnic Area and Telegraph Picnic Area will also open Monday. High winds that blew through Prince William Forest Park last week knocked down a number of trees.

WINTER HAVEN - The city of Winter Haven is offering boxing fitness classes that give everyone who participates a challenging workout. If you're not a boxer, but want to join the fun or just want to join the boxing classes, call (407) 862-2921 to get started. This class meets on the first Thursday of the month, from 7 to 9 p.m. in the Winter Haven Public Library's Community Room. Classes are offered in a variety of formats, from fitness classes in the gym and boxing fitness classes outside the gym, to special events with the Winter Haven Boxing club.

WASHINGTON - RFK Stadium , the once and future home of major league baseball in the nation 's capital , underwent a $35 million renovation in 2012 and will play host to the Washington Nationals on opening day of baseball season. But in a meeting with fans last night at RFK Stadium , Nationals front-office personnel admitted that the ballpark is a "tarnished jewel" that needs significant changes before it is worthy of a ballpark game . In the meeting, the Nationals said the most critical issue they need to solve before baseball season can begin will be to "get the grass out."

This past June , the Tacoma Rainiers brought reindeer mascot Rhubarb and local icon “ Epic Sax Gorilla ” up to the Pacific Northwest for a game. Both mascots had been with the team since its inaugural 1995-96 season as Rhubarb and Gorilla, but since their debut, Rhubarb has played his role as the team mascot for four decades, while Gorilla has also been a player and coach for the team for the past two decades. Rhubarb first came to Tacoma for the inaugural game in June 1995, when then-newly-signed Rainier head coach Jim Boutin brought him aboard as the only new player for the team.

MBOMBELA - National Assembly speaker Baleka Mbete on Saturday appealed to parents in general to be "polite" so that their children can open up and express their feelings to them. Mbete was addressing about 3 000 mourners at KaNyamazane Stadium at Mbombela in Mpumalanga during the funeral service of Nokhwezi Mthembu, the daughter of African National Congress chief whip Jackson Mthembu. “There is this feeling among our children that we, as parents, want to determine who they should be,” said Mbete. Nokhwezi committed suicide by hanging herself from curtain rails in her room at their Pelican Park parliamentary village home in Cape Town on March 20.

Authorizes Director of the Oregon Department of Aviation to request Department of Transportation to provide certain central business services for airport. Provides procedures to be followed in the event that an emergency occurs which requires the services of the Department of Transportation for the safe and efficient completion of an airport construction project. Provides that, upon a determination of a public necessity and in the event of a failure to provide the services to the project in an expeditious and efficient manner, the Department of Transportation may require payment from the contractor in an amount determined to be necessary to reimburse the Department for services rendered.

The extraordinary mummified remains of a 50-year-old woman discovered in a fetal position is set to go on display at the New Orleans Public Library on July 25. It is the first time this type of cadaver from the 19th century has been made available to the public. This mummified human skull, known as the Mummy Skull, has fascinated scientists and historians for several years. Originally discovered in the early 19th century in Egypt by a French doctor, it had been held in storage for more than 150 years before being found and studied by a German team of anthropologists.

This clears the way for debt agencies to charge higher fees on overdue loans . According to a Tuesday analysis by The Associated Press , state and federal debt-collection agencies have been raising their fees over the past year, a trend that will only increase as the number of people in default grows. In fact, the AP found that the four largest collection agencies charge more on their most common type of debts: delinquent credit card accounts, student loans, car loans and medical bills. The agencies will be able to collect more money from more people.

New Zealand’s Abortion Supervisory Committee is appealing a High Court judge’s decision that said there is reason to doubt the legality of many abortions in the country. A registered practitioner may legally perform an abortion in New Zealand only if acting under a certificate approved by two consultants, who are appointed by the Abortion Supervisory Committee. The appeal also argues that the Court made a legal error in concluding that the committee can form its own opinion about the lawfulness of consultants’ decisions to grant or to refuse approval for an abortion.

Johnny Depp has broken his silence about his controversial casting in Fantastic Beasts : The Crimes of Grindelwald . Depp recently talked to The Hollywood Reporter about director David Yates 's vision, the casting process and what fans can expect from the Warner Bros. film , which hits theaters on June 18, 2018. I was excited about this film, it's one of my favorite pictures. I feel that David Yates has really taken his vision and really made this thing. I've had so much fun. It's been a joy. I felt like I was in a fun picture that had the opportunity to do something with it.

NASA will plunge a small robot into a volcano in Hawaii in order to map data and geographical features of this unique and potentially hazardous volcano. Scientists hope to find clues about the volcano's future so they can better plan their research and conservation efforts, and to better inform decisions that affect our daily lives and safety. They also hope that the data collected by the robot will improve their understanding of this volcano, so that they will be able to predict when the volcano will erupt and what effects it will have on the region.

Featured as one of America ’ s 10 Best Towns for Families by Family Circle Magazine , Allen offers a wide range of activities that are fun and educational for families. The town is situated on the banks of the Missouri River at its confluence with the Mississippi River and is known by locals as the Gateway to the West because it is near the intersection of Interstate 35, U. S. Highway 54, and U. S. Highway 63. The largest of the Ozarks, Allen has been named one of the best places to raise a family in America by The National Geographic Society.

The drama started when Jenelle Evans and her mother Barbara were hanging out. While the two have had a tumultuous relationship in the past, they have apparently been working on their relationship and are getting along better. As the two were spending time together they started chatting on Instagram Live. Barbara allegedly made a shocking comment about “killing” Kail. However, she insisted it was a joke and Jenelle said the same thing. Still, Kail wasn’t laughing! Like Kailyn, Barbara is a mother of three. Because of that, Kailyn says she is “disgusted” by the comment made by Barbara.

When I went to meet Bono at the bar of his hotel , I saw Richard Gere seated at a table next to him with three other men and a young woman. I went up to him and said hello to Bono who was wearing dark glasses, a dark suit and bow tie. Richard asked me who I was and why I was in town. I answered “I just got off the plane to New York and am in town on some business and have to get back to Paris”. Bono laughed “Richard you are American.

It's customary to leave a tip when eating out, but one particular gratuity added to an order for a milkshake and fries at a New Jersey diner is angering parents. "My daughter was coming to me, telling me that every time she and her friends went to the diner, they're being charged the gratuity," said Melissa Desch. "And when I asked her why, she said, 'Because they're children.'" Desch said her daughter Isabella and other students at the Colfax Schuyler Middle School frequently go to the Wayne Hills Diner, just across the Hamburg Turnpike from the school.

Avid has ‘ redesigned and reimagined ’ Media Composer , relaunching it to appeal to future generations of editors . It looks and feels more modern than ever before . With the ability to connect up to 50 video, audio, image, and text files , you’ll never struggle with organizing your projects again. Here’s what’s new in this version. New

New in this version, the Media Composer app now supports the following:

Import and organize videos, audio, images, and text into a single project .

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to register to vote early for Tuesday’s midterm congressional elections. Some waited in the cold for as long as two hours. It’s just another example of what some are calling “the polar vortex,” the cold air and low air pressure that’s causing the polar vortex phenomenon this week. There’s no consensus as to what’s triggering the polar vortex phenomenon, but what seems to have been the most significant contributor is what’s happening in the Atlantic Ocean off of New England.

THE Australian men's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification stage semi-final, going down 10-9, and will now playoff for seventh position on Sunday. As they have shown many times throughout this Olympic campaign, Australia is just a goal or two away from beating the very best teams in the world on a regular basis. They seriously challenged pre-tournament favourites Serbia in their semi-final before giving up a three goal lead late in the game and today led with just under five minutes left on the clock.

As a veteran of the movement to combat climate change, I have been conditioned to expect disappointment. So when, as administration coordinator for Fossil Free Stanford, I was called into the office of the senior assistant to the Stanford University president in early May, I approached the meeting with apprehension. There were good reasons for my concern. That very morning, Harvard had arrested a student demanding an open dialogue on fossil fuel divestment. Last fall, Brown University flatly refused student calls to sever ties with thirteen of the dirtiest coal companies. Efforts to implement climate policies at a national and international level had fared no better.

Leon Conaway, 56, who was owner and operator of Twisted Roots, entered a plea agreement that recommending a sentence of three years' probation. A Carlsbad smoke shop owner pleaded guilty to drug paraphernalia charges in federal court in Las Cruces last week. Leon Conaway, 56, owner and operator of Twisted Roots in Carlsbad, entered a plea agreement which recommended a sentence of three years probation. According to a news release from the U.S. Department of Justice, Conaway was arrested in January 2018 on an indictment charging him with two counts of selling and offering for sale drug paraphernalia.

Japanese manufacturer Mitsubishi will make its first major move into the full-sized MPV market this summer with a stylish and distinctive new people-carrier called the Grandis. Although it's not due to arrive here until July, the British importer has shown its hand on prices at a very early stage. Full specifications and prices have been announced more than three months ahead of launch in the clear hope that anyone considering a rival MPV such as the Peugeot 807, Chrysler Voyager or Ford Galaxy will wait to see what the Grandis has to offer.

The spat between the Intelligence agencies of the US and its democratically elected President Donald Trump is not only bizarre but also for that reason, an extraordinary case study for evaluating the mandate that should determine the relationship between the National Intelligence and the Political Executive in a democratic dispensation. Ideally speaking, the national security set up anchored on Intelligence, exercises the sovereign function of detecting and tracking any threat to national security –external or internal –with the aim of neutralising it in time. At the same time, however, it does this on the authority of the elected Political Executive that is the ultimate repository of all sovereignty in a democracy.

Members of Lubbock 's Muslim community reacted with surprise and dismay at the news of the Feb. 23 arrest of a high school student accused of killing 19-year-old Tashia King and injuring seven others on her way home from a nightclub. King died from multiple stab wounds after a fight with her boyfriend on Feb. 17 in the early morning hours at a strip mall in Lubbock where she worked at the time. Police said the boyfriend of King had been charged with capital murder but that a warrant for the arrest of the defendant was expected.

What Would You Give Up at Work for the Ability to Choose a Mobile Device ? Sybase , a database company, has been developing and marketing the SQL Mobile Database (SQLite) product since 2007. This database-on-a-chip provides the database that can be run in the device, such as phones and PDAs. This database is supported by many mobile OS. Today we will see how to write an application to choose between the devices that support SQLite. To develop an application you would need a development database and you would need to connect it to the device that would run the program.

LONDON -- An IT worker threw out a computer hard drive without realizing it contained $ 7.5 million worth of personal data, it has been revealed. A man who works for IT company Accenture told the BBC that he discovered a cache of documents, which he had taken with him on holiday, were stored on the drive and not encrypted. He returned to his apartment to find that the files had vanished in an instant. Accenture confirmed this to the BBC, adding: "The company takes seriously its duty to safeguard the data of its staff, and this is a matter that is now being dealt with internally."

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years . Despite intense scientific inquiry , there is still uncertainty over the timing and causes of evolution . This article originally appeared on Quora on March 17, 2020. If you’ve been paying attention to recent developments in evolutionary biology, you might wonder why there’s such a large gap between the evidence and the explanations of evolution. The scientific consensus is that we have evolved from simpler ancestors—but the origins of this transition are still largely a matter of debate.

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown ’ s relationship . In an unusual move, the network announced in a memo posted to its Twitter account on Tuesday that it has signed a film deal. A source familiar with the project, who did not want to be identified, confirmed the news but declined to provide any details. The film is likely to revolve around the story of Houston ’s tumultuous marriage to the late Bobby Brown , who died in 2008 after a long battle with drug addiction.

I strongly encourage the Mayor and Council to move forward to preserve South Central Corridor. It is the only decision that will preserve the will of the voters, not jeopardize the funding grant from the Federal Transportation Authority, and reinforce the value of light rail in Phoenix. Our leaders must stay the course and continue support for this important project. It is the only prudent course of action. Arizona already licenses the full complement of health professions needed to offer patients an integrative approach to address chronic pain. It is time for health professions to work together for the best interests of our patients.

BLOOMINGTON – The U.S. Attorney’s office has charged two local men with conspiring to distribute crack cocaine in the Bloomington area, and a former McLean County assistant state’s attorney is leading the government’s case against the pair. Raymone Stephens,30, and 23-year old Khalil Hood, 23, were two of the four men arrested early Friday morning when authorities raided two apartments on East Empire and another on Fairmont Drive. Stephens and Hood are charged with conspiracy to manufacture and distribute more than 28 grams of crack cocaine, which carry penalties of five to 40 years in prison if they’re found guilty.

Fiji Council of Social Services ( FCOSS ) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by District Councils and by the National Council of Social Services through the Fiji CSO National Committee. This is to ensure the effectiveness of CSO for the purpose of improving social services as well as for the people of Fiji. This is to ensure accountability, transparency, accountability of CSO for beneficiaries and beneficiaries of the CSO and CSO for beneficiaries. Fiji CSO National Committee
The FCS National Committee is chaired by the Hon. Dr. James Iborra. Dr Iborra was appointed to the Committee on 8th January 2017.

Property search reveals nothing about community expertise or stellar service . Mobile is now the preferred mode of interaction with our communities as a result of the iPhone and its ability to bring a new level of personalization. I don't see how this is anything but a good thing. But it makes people who don't live in the same community, but who have an interest in what's going on in the area, more likely to check in on the community page to see who's in town or where to go. This has already happened.

The response to the bombs by the crowd at the finish line was, I think, exemplary. Sure, many people fled from the explosions, and reasonably so. But a remarkable number ran, as they say, to the sound of the guns, even though when two bombs go off, one might well expect more. Many of these were professionals. The finish line of a marathon is a fortuitous spot to bomb, in that doctors, policemen, ambulances and so on are stationed there. Some soldiers happened to be on hand. But others were not professionals.

Keen to kickstart pension reforms , the finance ministry has asked the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority ( PFRDA ) to set up a panel to explore the possibility of setting up a new state-run pension fund to replace India’s Public Provident Fund (PPF) — a move that will likely trigger a big fight within the ruling Congress party. The government will set up a five-member panel to look into the proposal, a top finance ministry official said on condition of anonymity last week. The panel, which will be headed by finance secretary Anushka Sharma, could submit its report to the prime minister in about three weeks.

The life of the mind puzzles poets and neuroscientists who go about mapping it and labeling it , and , finally, naming it. There are many definitions for mind, many definitions of “human being,” and many of the definitions of “person” that we have come to accept. But they are, ultimately, definitions. They mean the same thing. What is mind and what is person depends on what you’re asking the question and how you define it. All definitions in any given language have the same limits.

May 20 (UPI) -- One man was killed and another was hospitalized after they were attacked by a mountain lion while biking in Washington on Saturday, authorities said. The 31-year-old man who was injured was upgraded from serious to satisfactory condition and was awake and alert, Harborview Medical Center spokeswoman Susan Gregg told KOMO News. The other man, 32, was found dead at the scene. King County Sheriff's Office said the two men were riding mountain bikes in the Cascades near North Bend, east of Seattle, when they encountered the mountain lion.

Art Vs. Science took to the stage at Club NME at Camden 's KOKO on Friday ( May 7 ) in a performance that included the use of a mock-up of a 'mole', which was made with the help of the Science of Us department of the Royal College of Arts in the UK. 'I hope it gives people an insight into the different sides of science and the different things that go into the creation, testing and use of technologies, the different ways we have to get to know our environment, and how we can use those different approaches to understand things in an efficient way.

( Newser ) – After a car fatally hit a 70-year-old pedestrian , the driver 's insurance company sought payment from a woman he claims was not in the vehicle when he hit her. The woman in question says she was never in the vehicle at the time the driver hit her. The victim's son is suing the driver for pain and suffering. He says he now believes the driver, who was later convicted, is innocent. "I just want my mother, my father, my brother and my friend to get the proper medical attention," the victim's son says.

Britain's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his first event after injury. Brownlee's 2017 season ended in August when he had hip surgery. His time of 3 hours 35 minutes 32 seconds was more than six minutes ahead of second-placed Swiss Sven Riederer. The Dubai event is the first of a triple crown series, with Brownlee on course for a $1m (£703,000) bonus if he claims all three. An Ironman 70.3, or half Ironman, combines a 1.2-mile swim, a 56-mile bike ride, and a 13.1-mile run.

A new logo to help identify how the community feels about the Seminole County school system soon will be developed. The logo will be similar to a school's crest, and the school's name will be used in the logo and on the official school seal to identify the community where students are educated. The logo development will begin with input from parents and students at the upcoming Seminole County School Board's meeting. The new logo for the Seminole County School Board will be developed with input from the community, Seminole County School Board Chairwoman Jo Ann Kennedy says.

A facility manager wears many hats . It isn ’ t uncommon for a facility manager to lead a meeting, to participate in training sessions or be involved in any of a wide variety of different projects and activities that will help the facility achieve its organizational objectives. This is true, of course, in the corporate environment and it is just as true when managing a public facility as it is when a private facility. If you are interested in this career, then you will need to become proficient in all of the many different areas that are related to facility management.

The weight-loss company has seen a 66 per cent drop in share prices since the firm's November 2015 high after the former TV host announced she would become the face of the firm. As Oprah Winfrey and her fellow board members hunt for the next CEO of Weight Watchers International (WTW), analysts who follow the company have put forward some suggestions about the top priorities for a successful turnaround. Neither Chambers nor the firm elaborated on the reason for the sudden corporate exit. Shares of Weight Watchers fell more than 7 percent in after-hours trading yesterday following the announcement. The stock has since retreated.

Health authorities have issued another measles warning after a person travelled on public transport and visited two universities and a childcare centre, where children were put in direct contact with an infected person who had recently returned from the Netherlands. Health officials are continuing to monitor the situation and have urged travellers returning from the Netherlands and other destinations where the illness was confirmed to avoid contact with any people who have been diagnosed with the virus. They have also said that anyone who has had contact with an infected person can get a measles vaccination free of charge from their doctor or local government health services.

Multiple bills at the New Jersey statehouse are of interest to truckers and others using roadways throughout the state . In the wake of New Jersey's largest school shooting, legislators are working to pass new gun restrictions and other gun-related bills that could result in a delay of the implementation of new security measures for schools. The new proposals would require background checks of all people seeking to buy guns at gun shows, sales at licensed gun dealers and at the state’s online firearms auction site (NRA). The current law doesn’t require this at all.

Upbeat on their maiden housing project in Cavite , property developer Century Properties Group Inc. ( CPG ) and Mitsubishi Motors Inc. ( MUFG ), the second largest automaker in the country , signed an MoU last week in Makati to explore and implement a project of up to 10,000 units. But the project, which is expected to start in 2014, will not just be for residential but for commercial as well. As such, all of its development will be under commercial license and all of its projects will be subject to the Philippine Industrial Development Authority’s (PIDA’s) regulatory process for projects exceeding P6 million.

Companies looking to offer retirement plans will soon have a new alternative . Automated investment adviser Betterment said today that it plans to launch a new product, called the Retirement Income Trust , that will allow users to invest in low-volatility investments like bonds, stocks and real estate, without having to personally manage the investments . The idea is to give the power to people who are comfortable with their own investments. Betterment, based in California, started out in the financial world in 2006 by allowing users to trade stocks and exchange those trades on a stock market.

Rock your worries away from this covered rocking chair porch, while enjoy all the sights and sounds of nature! Features include: Open kitchen with granite counter tops, tile floors, new oven range & dining area. Curl up with a good book by the wood burning fireplace in living room with new laminate wood flooring. Spacious master suite on main with laundry chute. Lower Level offers: family room, laundry room with storage & utility sink. A second master suite perfect for guest quarters. Double garage w/ new door & room for storage.

Getty Images photographer John Moore will receive the inaugural Impact Award from the Lucie Awards program Sunday at Carnegie Hall in New York City. The awards honor great achievements in photography. Moore will join eight other honorees who will be recognized for their work at the gala ceremony. It's not the first award for the photojournalist who grew up in Irving and graduated from the University of Texas at Austin. He won the 2005 Pulitzer Prize for breaking news photography in 2005, two awards from the Overseas Press Club and Photographer of the Year from Pictures of the Year International, among other honors.

I strongly encourage the Mayor and Council to move forward to preserve South Central Corridor . It is the only transportation corridor that will benefit the majority of South Austin. We will not have the funds to develop any other alternatives if we don't move forward. I hope the Council takes the time to study how we could fund the South Central Corridor project. The City Council, the Mayor and the Council should come together and work to develop an economic incentive that will create jobs and increase the quality of life in South Central.

Manatees are large, gray aquatic mammals. They have fat bodies — I believe that “husky” is how clothing companies would attempt to get manatees to buy big jeans — that taper to a flat, paddle-shaped tail. Average adult manatees are about 10 feet long and weigh 800 to 1,200 pounds. Manatees are among God’s ugliest creatures in the ocean, and there are a lot of strange-looking seagoing creatures. Those are facts — well, the ugly observation is an opinion, but it’s obvious enough to be fact — that I learned from the Save the Manatee Club website.

Manfred Weber ( 41 ) is the newly elected chairman of the European People ’ s Party ( EPP ) in the European People ’ s Party European Parliament Group . He is the former German finance minister who became the German finance and budget minister in 1998, after the election of the EPP in the European Union . He was re-elected to parliament in 2004 and 2008 as a member of the Green Party . During his tenure as German finance minister, he implemented the Maastricht Treaty . The new treaty created a new type of European federal government in the European Union (EU).

HARRISBURG , Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General 's Office announced it is releasing more than $ 55 million in additional tax revenues over the next two years for the State. The funds were made available to the State Treasurer based on estimates of the State's expected tax collections from 2010 through 2012. The Auditor General will release each year's additional tax revenue over the next two years beginning in 2013. In total, $ 55.2 million has been made available to the State Treasurer. This is a 2.4 percent increase (from $ 53.7 million) in tax revenues to date for the fiscal year ending April 30, 2013.

PARIS (Reuters) - Longchamp, one of France’s leading handbag makers, plans to increase its presence in China, its chief executive said, in sharp contrast to retrenchment by rivals and despite the economic slowdown and changing consumer culture there. Many leading luxury brands such as Kering’s (PRTP.PA) Gucci and LVMH’s (LVMH.PA) Louis Vuitton have put the brakes on further store openings in China as part of campaigns to preserve their exclusive image. “We are far from having fully tapped China,” Jean Cassegrain, chief executive of the privately-owned group, told Reuters in an interview.

On Saturday , August 8th , Ukraine ’ s Interfax News Service announced that the Security Bureau of Ukraine had arrested three members of the right-wing ultranationalist paramilitary group Right Sector. According to Interfax, the Right Sector – which is affiliated with the far-right Svoboda Party (Freedom and Dignity) and was formed by nationalist political prisoners – has been engaged in violent attacks against the Ukrainian government and has carried out a number of terrorist acts in the center of Kiev. Interfax noted that the three were detained on August 6th as they were leaving a training session of a Ukrainian paramilitary force in Lviv.

BLAKELY , Pa. -- More than 170,000 pounds of food was handed out to those in need in Lackawanna County over the weekend during a food giveaway organized by the Salvation Army’s Good Food Program and the Community Food Bank. The food giveaway is an initiative of Good Food Program to help alleviate food insecurity in the community and raise money during this time of food insecurity. According to Community Food Bank, an estimated 40,000 people are living in food insecurity in Lackawanna County. This means that most of them have limited, or no, access to food.

WASHINGTON (Alliance News) - Gold prices held steady on Thursday after the Fed's latest report on the economy said businesses across the US have become less optimistic in recent months. Spot gold edged up 0.2% to USD1,294.11 per ounce, while US gold futures were virtually unchanged at USD1,293.75 per ounce. As economic headwinds mount, the Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady at least until June. The dollar took a breather today after recent gains, while the British pound steadied after British Prime Minister Theresa May won a confidence vote in the parliament and urged lawmakers to break the impasse on a Brexit divorce agreement.

Former Rep. Stephanie Herseth Sandlin ( D-S.D . ) is eager to start her K Street practice and has not ruled out seeking the Senate seat being vacated by outgoing GOP Sen. Tim Johnson. She joins a field of Democrats who are vying to replace Republican Sen. Charles E. Schumer of New York, who decided not to seek re-election. Johnson is leaving office because he said he does not believe his seat can win in the fall. “I wouldn’t be surprised if I were elected to the Senate in 2014,” Herseth Sandlin told The Huffington Post.

Montana, Exxon-Mobil At Odds Over Oil Spill Montana and oil giant Exxon-Mobil are at odds over an oil spill in the state's Yellowstone River. Exxon-Mobil says it's doing all it can to clean up the spill and has promised to see the cleanup through. That's not enough for Montana's state officials — particularly its governor. They say that the company hasn't been forthright on the extent of the spill and that they're not doing enough. Michele Norris speaks with Montana Gov. Brian Schweitzer about those accusations — and the steps the state is taking to rectify them.

"Of all the German surface warships, the British feared Bismarck the most. Her size, speed, and firepower made her a definite threat to Allied shipping in the Atlantic, and it was imperative that she be neutralized." In July 2001, the wreck of the Hood was found 9,334 feet below the surface of the Denmark Straight. She lies in three sections with the bow on its side, the mid section upside down, and the stern speared into the seabed. In 2013, the wreck was more fully explored with a remote-control vehicle.

Nobody can predict with accuracy when stock markets will end their record-setting bull run . But the best way for investors to prepare for the worst-case outcome is by buying stocks on the dip. That means buying stocks when they are cheap or even free. It also means avoiding stocks you don’t know enough about. But don’t do any of this blindly—it’s important that you know what you are getting yourself into. After all, we don’t know what the worst-case outcome will be like when there are no stocks in sight, and we might not even know when it will happen.

Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday.Fiji Council of Social Services(FCOSS) district representatives endorsed the Fiji CSO Code of Accountability for implementation by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday. FCOSS executive director, Vani Catanasiga says close to 50 representatives from Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa, Rakiraki district councils of social services (DCOSS) endorsed the Code of Accountability after a two day meeting in Lautoka.

Millennials are not a homogenous group of individuals, so a one-size-fits-all marcomms approach won't work. Millennials want healthy food and are willing to spend more on it. Oh wait, no – Millennials are in debt and want healthy food at affordable prices. They are also self-entitled. But they’re creative and tech-savvy, so that’s a good thing. And don’t try traditional advertising with them, stick to social media. If all of this sounds familiar, that’s because it’s a small glimpse of the countless contradicting reports on Millennials.

LOS ANGELES – A bid to grant subpoena power to the watchdog commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department has raised serious constitutional questions. The request was submitted by the Commission on Jail Standards on Thursday and has been under consideration for several months. The proposal’s approval is necessary to give the commission subpoena power to the Sheriff’s department and its jails, where the Sheriff is chief executive officer, but the Sheriff’s chief spokesman, Steve Whitmore, said Friday that there was no indication the proposal had been rejected.

Some apps set out to change the world, others are hell-bent on bringing beauty to your pocket gadgets. Beautiful Clock Widgets falls into the latter category. This little Android app does exactly what it says on the label, featuring a collection of clock widgets with the choice of additional data, such as the local weather and battery information. Some are cool, others are funky…and a handful are downright quirky. It’s worth noting here that some are only available through the Pro Version, which costs $1.26, or your local currency equivalent.
