A popular Belgium waffles franchise has opened in Dubai with the help of the government ’ s agency to support local entrepreneurs. The government has allocated a $15-million annual funding to Belgium Waffles for three years. In a press statement, the Belgium Waffles said that Dubai has been chosen as the first location for the opening of the franchise. “We believe this will help the brand grow and expand in Dubai, which is one of the most attractive cities to invest in,” they said. Dubai is the third city in the Middle East in which the Belgian waffles franchise is operating.

CNET 's reporters are covering the launch of the much-hyped iPhone 4 . Stay tuned for updates from New York City during Apple's product event next Tuesday, Oct. 9, 2009. (Photo: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg). By David Pogue, Contributing Editor

NEW YORK (CNBC.com) -- Apple's new iPhones will be the subject of much speculation as the company rolls them out to customers during Tuesday's live presentation. As with any major product launch, Apple is being careful to keep the focus on Apple products. This time, however, the spotlight is on new phones that don't feature cameras or touchscreens.

Leon Conaway , 56 , who was owner and operator of Twisted Roots , entered a plea agreement that recommending a prison term of between 14 and 17 years. On Oct. 29, 2015, he pleaded guilty to criminal possession of a firearm in the presence of a person in a penal institution, which carries a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison. Conaway also pleaded guilty to three other criminal counts, including first-degree criminal sale of a controlled substance, and one count of third-degree controlled substance offense, according to a press release by District Attorney Joseph E. Brown Jr., which was filed in the case.

Israeli PM says he will deliver major policy speech for achieving peace with Palestinians. The prime minister has so far refused to agree to White House demands to halt all settlement expansion, without exception. While Netanyahu has declared his commitment to peace before, he has avoided directly addressing how he plans to reach any agreement while remaining unwilling to give up control of most of the West Bank and East Jerusalem. "I aspire to a stable peace based on the solid foundations of the security of the state of Israel and its citizens," he said at the cabinet meeting.

They look a bit frightful , but vultures are nature 's greatest cleanup crew . They 're amazing creatures with one of the most complex social structures in the animal world , and it makes sense that they 're the only ones who can tell you what to do about all the stuff they've found during their foraging expeditions. A Vulture , also called falcon, falconer, and falconer , is an arthropod native to Europe , Africa , Asia , Australia , and North America. It is the largest and most numerous species of bird. An African Vulture (Avialae africanus ) is an African raptor.

Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2. Two members of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians have pleaded guilty to a murder committed early on November 2. According to U.S. Attorney Mike Hurst and FBI Special Agent in Charge Christopher Freeze, Jerome Steve, 33, and Keenan Martin, 26, both of Philadelphia entered their pleas Tuesday before U.S. District Judge Daniel P. Jordan III. The murder took place in the Tucker community of the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians near Philadelphia.

It was a Saturday morning . August . I remember it vividly . I was online , sat up in bed with my book open to a story, when my phone started ringing . I answered it , I didn’t recognise the number on the screen – it didn’t sound right. I couldn’t quite put my finger on it , the sound, but I couldn’t quite place it . I was on the other end of a call from my ex. He was calling to let me know that he was coming to stay that night.

Guess what ? The NBA really is a showbiz affair . Only super-producer David Stern isn ’ t pulling all strings . The league can ’ t afford that . It turns out Stern is the only man in the league who is in charge, not the other way around . The commissioner doesn ’ t even make a decision that he personally knows is right , or not . What he can do, and does, is put a group of men on the board and then make up his mind . He is the boss .

It 's enough to give you a headache . Mastering the ins and outs of Obamacare open enrollment can be a real pain. In fact, for the past two years, my family has had to endure it. It began when I joined the Affordable Care Act as a student in 2013. "We had no idea what was coming," I wrote in a blog post announcing my enrollment in the ACA. "I'd heard about a program called Obamacare for a couple years, but it never sunk in that I would have to be on it.

The TTP is appare­ntly not able to fund its operat­ions for the want of money . ISLAMABAD : The Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan’s (TTP) founder and former leader, Mullah Mansour, has asked the military to give him $50 million to fight the government. Mansour, the leader of the TTP, has asked for $50-million from the military to fund the militant group to carry out its operations for two years and to rebuild its ranks in the North-West Frontier province. According to senior TTP officials, the money would be transferred to the militant group through a fund controlled by the intelligence agency in the North-West Frontier.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama “Beautiful Boy” – not the slasher-flick “Halloween” – is the most terrifying movie opening at the multiplex this weekend. Starring Steve Carell (“Foxcatcher”) and Timothee Chalamet (“Call Me by Your Name”), the movie is a chilling and unsettling look at a young man’s plunge into meth addiction (and heroin, pills, pot, etc.) and a devoted father’s efforts to save him. It’s a true and horrifying story so powerful that an uninspired director and clichéd script can’t dilute its impact.

You have to admire Lego Cuusoo : The website does a great job at bringing a community of Lego fans together and supporting each others efforts in building amazing creations! It is a great model of how LEGO should be used as an open platform. I am in love with the concept and I wish Lego could make it available for mobile devices. I would love to see it expanded to the next level where you can build, design and upload to the internet all in real time with no limitations. This would be amazing for the gaming community.

Led Zeppelin stole from the ‘60s group Spirit? And did “The Voice” steal from “American Idol”? A recent court case has the estate of the composer of “Taurus” claiming “Stairway To Heaven” is in violation of copyright laws. Creatives have been borrowing from each other for centuries. But what constitutes actual harm -- business, artistic, or otherwise? How much of the original art moved to the new effort? This is always the blurry part. Lawsuits over music copyright have been going on for more than a century.

Ken Block makes amazing gymkhana videos. But NSW Police didn't want Ken Block to make this particular gymkhana video — the one you see right up there — in Sydney. So the Hoonigan team went to New York instead, leaving Australia in its dust. Here's the video they made — the video that could have featured the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and all our most famous city's iconic landmarks. Ken Block's Gymkhana Nine was filmed to coincide with the launch of Forza Horizon 3, set in Australia — so it made sense for Gymkhana Nine to be filmed in Australia.

Brazil is currently implementing the Brasil Sem Miséria programme — a continuation of the successful Fome Zero— which aims to do just that, Marques Porto says. Initiated in 2003 by former president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, Fome Zero is credited with having taken 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the core actions of the programme was providing poor children with free school lunches, which were purchased by the state from family farms. In this way, support to local small farmers was provided at the same time as offering quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

Up and down the East Coast voters braved very cold weather in the pre-dawn darkness as they queued up to bring an end to one of the hardest-fought and most expensive election campaigns ever. Facing them was a choice between two men with very different visions of how to get economically struggling America back firmly on its feet. More than 100 people were already patiently waiting in line at the Falls Church community centre for more than half an hour when the basement gymnasium turned polling station threw open its doors at precisely 6am. "The polls are open! Go on in!"

Bhubaneswar: Shashi Bhushan Behera, Minister Finance & Excise has hoped, IOCL to participate in the Special Purpose Vehicles created for development of PCPIR at Paradip and also the Plastic Park at Paradip through equity participation. Besides, an attractive pricing mechanism for feedstock needs to be worked out by IOCL to incentivize units to set up base at Paradip. State Government has also requested Ministry of chemicals & Petrochemicals, Government of India for providing budgetary support of at least Rs 3000 crore to take up necessary infrastructure development activities for the region, Sri Behera said.

A new logo to help identify how the community feels about the Seminole County school system soon will be developed, using at least one of the top four winning entries in the county's Logo Competition. School board members said they wanted a new logo because the system's current emblem -- that of a school crossing sign -- doesn't reflect the district's academic achievements. The competition was divided into four age groups, 10 and under as the elementary group, 11 to 14 in the juniors group, 15 to 18 in the seniors group and 19 and over in the adult group.

A popular chippy which closed in the summer is set to re-open under new management - with a trendy twist

There's a popular chippy which used to be popular until it closed in the summer for a long refurbishment, only to reappear with a new restaurant menu. Dylan's Chippy - which used to run on the corner of Hargate Road and Balsam Close in Dagenham - re-opened on Friday, May 4, with a new restaurant called Dylan's Chippy Diner, in the former site of the chippy's former owner, Ben Wilson.

Sarah Haire heard rumblings about a storm approaching the coastline, but she expected it all to blow over. So the Cleveland County native was caught off guard when a powerful hurricane developed in the Atlantic. By Monday, an evacuation order was issued for Jacksonville, North Carolina, where Haire lives now. Haire and her husband, Austin, packed their two cars and headed west toward Cleveland County on Tuesday. Austin Haire was able to take a seven-day leave from Camp Lejeune Marine Corps base where he is stationed. The couple will split time between Boiling Springs with Sarah�s family and Shelby with Austin�s family over the weekend.

Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif called on Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the PM House with both sides looking into each other’s eyes in an attempt to bring an end to the ongoing political crisis in the Islamic Republic of Pakistan. Speaking at a press conference that was attended by foreign affairs adviser Shah Mahmood Qureshi and foreign minister Aizaz Chaudhry, the foreign minister called for a meeting of parties in the Pakistan Peoples Party with an aim to “reach a mutually-acceptable consensus” by the next meeting, and called on PM Khan to meet him.

It ’ s a long walk from Billings , Mont. , to Lincoln , Neb . – anywhere between 850 and 900 miles. It starts on the plains of Montana and the prairies of eastern Nebraska and heads west through Wyoming and into western Nebraska, ending near Lincoln on the Missouri River. If you have the stamina for such a trip – you may not have time to drive from one end of it to the other. So why not save some time and avoid the traffic congestion of the big cities and fly?

BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications, allegedly by Chinese hackers, that revealed EU concern about U.S. Donald Trump, Russia and Iran, the bloc said on Wednesday. “The Council Secretariat is aware of allegations regarding a potential leak of sensitive information and is actively investigating the issue,” the body that represents EU governments in Brussels said in a statement. The Secretariat declined to comment further but said it “takes the security of its facilities, including its IT systems, extremely seriously”, referring to concerns about vulnerabilities in its data systems across 28 EU states.

Young African-Americans embrace computers as integral to their futures, but they may be missing out on key opportunities to learn to code, develop apps and software, and innovate with technology, concludes a new national survey. Clark, Arizona State University women and gender studies professor Kimberly A. Scott, and consultant Victoria J. Rideout are the authors behind "The Digital Lives of African American Tweens, Teens, and Parents: Innovating and Learning with Technology." The study, released this month, is based on a national survey of more than 1,000 pairs of African-American teenagers and their parents, as well as focus groups.

Everyone knows where and what they were doing when this nightmare called 9/11 happened . Chuck was getting ready for the big game and his mom was getting ready for an appointment. As for me, I didn’t sleep until 4am that day. The first thought that crossed my mind was that these people could come and destroy my family and friends and we’re going to be so helpless. The second thought was that at that very moment there are over 2,400,000 Muslims in the US. I remember going through my mother’s room and opening her closet to get her to bed.

GENEVA – The Head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict, Justice Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory as he presented the report of the Mission* to the Human Rights Council. Following its three-month investigation, the four-person Mission concluded that serious violations of international human rights and humanitarian law were committed by Israel in the context of its military operations in Gaza from December 27, 2008 to January 18, 2009, and that Israel committed actions amounting to war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.

The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country’s embassy in the Jordanian capital, Amman, amid growing fears of an assault on the mission similar to last week’s attack in Egypt. Fears of violent anti-Israel protests similar to those that erupted in Cairo were sparked following calls for a “million-man march” outside Israel’s embassy in Amman. The action, scheduled for Thursday, had been organized via Facebook. The motto, “No Zionist embassy on Jordanian territory” was published online earlier this week and has already attracted thousands of pledges to attend the demonstration.

DELRAY BEACH — Overdoses are on the decline in Delray Beach , continuing a trend that started last year . According to a recent report released last month by the Office of the Medical Examiner , there have been just three fatal drug-related deaths in the city since 2006. That's a 34 percent decrease from four years earlier, and is a sharp increase compared to other Florida cities of similar size and demographics, according to the report by the Florida Department of Health. Overdoses, however, are on the rise in Palm Beach and Broward Counties, the report showed.

Study suggests complex behaviors were handed down for tens of thousands of years. Despite intense scientific inquiry, there are still major gaps in our knowledge about early human life. One major question that remains unanswered: when humans were first capable of complex cognition? In other words, when did early humans develop sophisticated cognitive abilities, such as prioritization and cultural transmission, that we would recognize today? A new study in Nature addresses this; after six years of excavation, archaeologists have unearthed technologically-advanced stone tools that were created about 71,000 years ago.

If this was supposed to be a measuring stick game for the Flyers, they came up a bit short. Coming off a 12-1-1 dash since Jan. 12, the Flyers skated squarely into a wall named the Tampa Bay Lightning on Tuesday night and it was a reality check. The team with the best record (46-11-4) in the NHL easily skated past the Flyers on the way to a 5-2 win at the Wells Fargo Center, sweeping the season series. With Pittsburgh winning at New Jersey, the Flyers fell back to eight points out of a playoff spot again.

(CNN) - After 8 hours of deliberations Thursday, a St. Louis jury awarded $4.69 billion to 22 women who sued pharmaceutical giant Johnson & Johnson alleging their ovarian cancer was caused by using its powder as a part of their daily feminine hygiene routine. The jury award includes $550 million in compensatory damages and $4.14 billion in punitive damages. It's the largest verdict against the company that has sold Baby Powder and Shower to Shower brand talcum powder for decades. A jury ruled in Johnson & Johnson's favor in one lawsuit in California last November.

At NSE , shares of Nestle climbed 5.35 per cent to Rs 6,185.05 . At BSE the stocks surged by a fifth to Rs 1,534.60 after the Swiss food giant posted quarterly sales of ₹ 3,634 crore , better than expected, and ended at Rs 793.80, up 33 per cent from last year's level. Nestle shares in India climbed by 5.34% to Rs 6,185 after company reported its third quarterly sales of Rs 3,634.65 crore up 33.2 per cent as against ₹ 3,095.83 crore in the year-ago period. The company ended the day at Rs 793.40, up Rs 66.50 in the previous day's trading in Mumbai.

MBOMBELA - National Assembly speaker Baleka Mbete on Saturday appealed to parents in general to be `` polite '' so that children do not become angry at people who are different to them. Addressing the National Assembly on Saturday in Harare, Ms Mbete said, " We all live in a pluralistic society where people are different from each other. But we are living in Zimbabwe, where there are certain values. We have to respect people whose beliefs are different from us." She told the legislators that if they are going to respect people whose beliefs are different, then they should respect parents and teachers.

Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested by the joint terrorism task force in a plot to use a van filled with explosives on the Fourth of July. A man who pledged allegiance to Al Qaeda sought to kill members of the military and conducted reconnaissance in downtown Cleveland for a planned attack on July 4 -- but the Independence Day plot was foiled after a months-long investigation, federal officials said Monday. FBI Special Agent in Charge Stephen Anthony said Demetrius Pitts, also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq, was arrested at 10 a.m. Sunday by the joint terrorism task force.

TORONTO — Businesses are asking for major changes to the King St. pilot project or they ’ ll be considering their options as early as today ’ s meeting with city staff. City staff are reviewing a proposal to extend the King St. pilot until June 2015, following the completion of the Downtown East redevelopment. The proposal will be presented to aldermen as they meet for their March 20 meeting, the city says. The city also has begun considering options to continue the pilot project through the Downtown East redevelopment, and has asked that businesses be asked for their input prior to any major decisions.

If you have flexible working arrangements and do not work at a fixed location every day , and are looking for a flexible work arrangement that can be carried over to your next job, this is an opportunity for you to take advantage of, you can work part time during the week and still be eligible for full time hours at the weekend. This position has been advertised for 12 weeks from 6:00pm on Tuesday 20th March 2020. It is open to all permanent workers aged over 19 and who have been working for the company for longer than 6 months.

Central American referee Carlos Batres has fallen for the worst dive of the World Cup by the most theatrical Italian in the tournament, and has apologised on behalf of the Spanish federation and his own national side for his inappropriate behaviour on the touchline. Batres has been widely reported to be in hot water over the way his own side were dealt with as well as the manner of Italy’s defeat to Ecuador. But the Italian has also had his share of controversy himself. There have been reports Batres’ wife was involved in the incident after an altercation with a fan during the group stage win over Chile.

May 20 ( UPI ) -- One man was killed and another was hospitalized after they were attacked by a dog at a Los Angeles home late Tuesday, while another was seriously injured when the dog attacked and bit him near the home, police said. The dead man, whose name was not released by police Tuesday, died of blunt force trauma from a dog attack, said Los Angeles police Lt. Scott Risling. It was determined by the Los Angeles County Department of Coroner that the man died from a massive brain hemorrhage.

Where were you when you received your 40 Under 40 award ? It was 2009 and I was in my first year as a reporter for NPR. I had never heard anything like this from a public radio station before, and I remember thinking, well, that’s probably an honor that I never would have received, or I’m so far behind the curve, and it’s really too bad that I am not in some of the fields that they are celebrating. So, I wrote a letter of acceptance and had a nice little package that I was supposed to give to the producer.

Guernsey voters are set to elect politicians from an entire island constituency , rather than by the current district system , when the electorate changes from 11 to 12 members. It's likely that the new structure will produce new faces on the county council, which is currently composed of the mayors of five of the six district councils: Saint Peter's (St Peter's), St George's (St George), St Lawrence (St Looe), St Mary's (St Maure) and St Martin's (St Martins).

The entry below is by Katrine Øgaard Jensen , who is one of the founding editors of EuropeNow , a magazine that was launched in 2014 by the European Parliament that “seeks to promote Europe’s interests beyond Brussels and Strasbourg, bringing them to citizens and the media”. At a few smart legacy news companies, there’s digital advertising growth and smart strategy. But most newspaper companies are finding the important numbers are still headed in the wrong direction. By Ken Doctor @kdoctor April 24, 2014, 10:30 a.m.
As we approach the middle of the 2010s, where do newspapers fit in the battle for America’s largest ad sector — digital? And how well are all those paywalls doing? Two reports tumbled into the public sphere within a week of each other recently, and together, they help us answer both questions.

It’s a long walk from Billings, Mont., to Lincoln, Neb. – anywhere between 850 and 902 miles, depending on which road you take. Richard Randolph Lamb , a resident of Dunsmuir , passed away on September 17 , 2009 at Mercy Medical Center. Born on January 1 , 1930 , in Santa Cruz , he grew up on a family farm in the mountains west of Lodi . His mother and grandfather were migrant workers in Oregon and California . He earned his B. S. degree from Lodi High School in 1949 and attended San Francisco State College , where he earned a M. S. degree . He then served his country as a U. S. Naval officer in the Navy-Marine Corps Intelligence Service during the Korean and Vietnam Wars , retiring as a commander.

Progressive Networks' RealAudio and RealVideo streaming products got a shot in the arm today with the news that Microsoft plans to take a minority investment in the firm and license its key products, RealAudio and RealVideo 4.0. As part of the deal, Microsoft will incorporate Progressive technologies into Internet Explorer clients and the NetShow streaming server, and the firms will collaborate on making respective server and client products work together. In turn, Progressive will support Microsoft's Active Streaming Format (ASF) as well as its own file formats, and use Microsoft's DirectShow and DirectDraw APIs and other technologies in the next versions of its Windows clients.

DENVER -- During the summer of 2002, Colorado state officials were dealing with the 138,000-acre Hayman Fire while trying to let potential tourists know the state was still open for business. That comment all but short-circuited the state’s summer vacation season. This time around, the travel and tourism folks want potential visitors to know less than one-percent of public lands are impacted by wildland fires. When Owens uttered his comments, Colorado had 24 million visitors which spent about $7 billion annually. Denver had 10 million visitors who spent about $2.3 billion. In 2011, Colorado welcomed 58 million visitors who spent $10.7 billion.

DARTMOUTH — On June 14, Flag Day, the students of the James M. Quinn Elementary School in Dartmouth gathered outside to celebrate Flag Day. This in itself is not unusual, but this year it took on a more personal meaning. The reason being is that Dr. Carol Karafotis' cousin, Ted Cote from New Bedford is serving in Iraq. Earlier in the year around Veteran's Day, Dr. Karafotis asked her students to send cards to Staff Sergeant Cote in order to cheer him up. The students responded and made cards that were then sent to Iraq.

This clears the way for debt agencies to charge higher fees on overdue loans. According to a Tuesday analysis from the Consumer Federation of America (CFA), millions of Americans have fallen behind on their student loans. The data, obtained from the U.S. Department of Education, reveals 42.4 million people in the U.S. owed $1.3 trillion in federal student loans by the end of 2016. Since 2013, the average amount owed per borrower increased by 17 percent. Back in 2015, the Obama administration issued a memo that prevented debt collectors from charging high interest rates on overdue student loans.

WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning to the U.S. claiming he had been kidnapped, only to disappear again, is back in U.S. custody, officials said Sunday. Cpl. Wassef Ali Hassoun, 34, turned himself in and was being flown Sunday from an undisclosed location in the Middle East to Norfolk, Va. He is to be moved Monday to Camp Lejeune in North Carolina, according to a spokesman, Capt. Eric Flanagan. Maj. Gen. Raymond Fox, commander of the 2nd Marine Expeditionary Force at Lejeune, will determine whether to court martial Hassoun.

UNITED NATIONS , July 6 , updated -- With the mandate of the UN Mission in Sudan set to expire in November, the UN Security Council on Tuesday authorized an additional 90 days of peacekeepers to continue their mission. Security Council Resolution 1856 was passed by a vote of 13 in favor, six against and no abstentions. The resolution authorizes the UN mission in Sudan (UNMIS) to continue its work until Nov. 24, 2016, a date that would leave the mandate to expire on Jan. 31. The UNMIS expires on Dec. 31, 2016.

The Internet has changed beyond anything could have foreseen just five years ago . It is no longer a browsing site for news and entertainment but an information network where all kinds of things, from music to video to video games and software programs are made available at very affordable rates. Most people have access to the Internet as a way to get information about the current news, the weather forecast, and a lot of the day-to-day issues that affect their lives. With the explosion of Internet use, it is becoming ever more important that users stay safe.

How the internet has caught up with the ways of the world . The early web : UNIX command was once the way of the future . It was in the early days of what became the internet that computers became an extension of people. With a few simple instructions, people could create a simple webpage and put their names and phone numbers on the front. Pretty soon the pages were filled with their personal photos and personal information. In the end the personal web became much more, as the technology behind the web began to take hold in more and more areas of daily life.

HARRISBURG, Pa. -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's Office announced it is releasing more than $55 million in funding to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the money will be distributed based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. Excluding Philadelphia, all of the state's remaining 66 counties will receive money. That includes at least $57,000 to every county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. Volunteers at the Lake Silkworth Fire Department are dispatched at all hours of the day all over Luzerne County's Back Mountain.

Without much fuss or fanfare , but , happily , with plenty of shoppers , Salisbury quietly reopened its central branch of the town's historic market , on Saturday, March 12th. A lot of planning went into this project , and now that the building is back open , we wanted to reflect on what went into this project as a result of a long, drawn-out negotiation. For some people, opening up a market in a place like this would seem like a risky business . In truth, this wasn't a particularly risky venture, for a number of reasons .

KENTON , Del . - A Kenton cheese plant shut down by the Food and Drug Administration due to a lack of food safety tests is set to reopen Thursday under a new owner, who says it plans to take the cheese through the end of the year. The FDA announced Thursday the shutdown would not affect any products made in the cheese plant, located a few miles from the plant that makes Brie cheese, the same kind of cheese at the center of an uproar in recent months in which the agency said the company had failed to meet federal food safety tests.

The Frenchwoman who received the world's first partial face transplant showed off her new features to the public Monday, saying in a heavily slurred voice that she now looks "like everyone else" and hopes to resume a normal life. Isabelle Dinoire's speech was difficult to understand, but she explained how she was disfigured by a dog bite last year, and she thanked the family of the donor who gave her new lips, a chin and nose. A fine, circular scar was still visible where the face tissue was attached in the 15-hour operation in Amiens on Nov. 27.

JURGEN KLOPP has revealed his delight at ending Pep Guardiola 's 22-game unbeaten run with Manchester City , exclaiming live on Match of the Day: "It's difficult to take a moment of joy in this world. But at the end of this week, when we're in the Premier League we can say that we've gone 22 unbeaten. That's a phenomenal record. And I want to thank the fans, it's fantastic. Now we have a few days to prepare for our next game, it's very important for the squad."

It was a Saturday morning. August. I remember it vividly. I was online, sat up in bed, browsing, not looking for anything in particular. An article caught my eye: it was about the refugee crisis. Men, women and children were risking their lives to get to western Europe, and many were dying in the process. It was a story of endurance and terrible trauma. In response I expected compassion, a swell of fellow feeling. But my heart sank as I read the comments. There was so much cruelty.

( WXIA ) -- New Year 's Eve is one of the deadliest drinking holidays of the year . This is especially true in the United States, a country that celebrates its independence, freedom and diversity on the night of the new year. But it's one of the safest drinking holidays because it occurs in the month after Thanksgiving Day, a time where many Americans make the most of the opportunity to drink. The number of deaths related to drinking during the new year tends to be the lowest for any day of the year, according to the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute ( NEERI ) , Nagpur , and the Nagpur Urban Corporation (NUC) to prepare a detailed project report (DPR) by May 30 for a residential township project that is being considered for approval by the Supreme Court's Environment and Forests Bench. The DPR, which had earlier been prepared for the National Institute of Technology, Bhopal (NIT), was handed over to the bench on Friday, after which Justice Vibhuti Sharma posted it to the bench. The bench had already asked NEERI and NUC to file the DPR at a later date.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a substantial portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will check to see if your claims regarding the accounts receivable balance can be proved. These claims are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balance. Knowing which assertions can be proved by confirmation can help you understand why your auditor asks for multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations mainly serve to prove the existence assertion.

Demetrius Pitts , also known as Abdur Raheem Rahfeeq , was arrested by the joint terrorism task force in a raid on his home in San Diego in May, 2015. The raid followed a federal complaint against him and another man who was also arrested. The FBI said he had been recruited by Al Qaeda as a sleeper agent and a bomb-maker. He was arrested after a raid on a San Diego apartment that found explosives and chemical agents that the FBI said he used to build bombs, according to a complaint filed against him. Pitts was convicted on terrorism charges in December.

Trisha Pollard believes the Texas social services system relies too much on the courts to police Medicaid fraud and not enough on a more robust effort to police the lives of Medicaid recipients who make up a large portion of the state’s population. Photo: Eric Kayne/San Antonio Express-News/MCT

She is among the many Texas advocates who want a more aggressive enforcement approach toward Medicaid fraud, and is now calling on the state’s top court to do more. “The number-one way we could improve the Medicaid system in Texas is by taking the court system out of the Medicaid system.

LATROBE - Ainsley Battles is back in a Pittsburgh Steelers uniform . Battles , a safety , was brought in by the Pittsburgh Steelers to replace Antwon Blake in the Steelers secondary after Blake was injured last week against the Cleveland Browns . The Steelers needed to make a roster switch for Blake, who was placed on injured reserve Saturday with a knee injury. Battles returns from a two-year college career at Florida State University where he was an All-ACC first team choice as a junior. He also was a first round draft choice by the Jacksonville Jaguars in 2012.

There are plenty of products out there that make it possible to create narrated walk-throughs of content , but most require that you create the walk-through before the content. This is a problem for me as a writer and a content creator. That is, when you're creating a story, you want to get an idea of how the story will play out, then you will know what will happen at the beginning, but how do you make the walkthrough happen? Do you write it first, then make it as a walk through? Do you just tell the reader to go to the beginning and then walk through?

Stark County ’ s unemployment rate in August fell to 6.8 percent , the lowest it ’ s been since July of 2008 . The county’ s monthly unemployment rate in July, which was 7.9 percent, was below the state ’s average of 6.9 percent and down from July’s 8.2 percent in the prior year, according to the Kentucky Center for Economic Policy. “For a lot of people out there, the labor market is not very good. Unemployment is not very high. It’s been a tough period of time for workers, particularly those out of work because of the weak economy.

The first time I heard these verses was in a small storefront church in Kiev, Ukraine. I remember because it was the same Sunday morning that Princess Diana’s tragic death was reported. I had recently left my job on Wall Street and was living in Kiev with my mother after my father had passed away and I was there because I was not having much luck in finding my way forward. I recall the wood-paneled walls of the room where I sat in the back, slightly embarrassed by the evangelical enthusiasm of my fellow expats. But when I heard these verses my wandering mind was drawn back.

AURORA, Ill. – A suburban teen has died after a tragic accident in the parking lot of a high school. Police say 17-year-old Stephen Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, after he was injured Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. Police say the teen was riding on the passenger side running board of an SUV in the parking lot when he lost his grip, according to WGN. He fell backwards and struck the pavement. Police say Woodcock suffered head and other injuries. He was treated by paramedics at the scene then airlifted to the hospital.

JAIPRAKASH HOSPITAL is undergoing a face-lift these days with the wards being whitewashed, painting of walls, etc. Some new facilities are also being added in the hospital. The hospital’s OPD, paediatric ward, female ward and other areas have been revamped and bear a new look. Next on the agenda for a face-lift is the hospital’s upper floor. The amount sanctioned by the State Government for augmentation of facilities at the hospital is being utilised for refurbishment. An additional Rs 18 lakh has been sanctioned for carrying out further improvements at the hospital.

Does the ‘ perfect ’ bourbon exist ? In fact , for about 20 years , the distillery has undertaken a serious research to develop the perfect bottle of bourbon. Over the past 40 years , the craft bourbon industry has grown exponentially in the United States with more than 15,000 small family-owned distilleries across the nation. As a result, small distilleries are facing more competition and less time to research, develop and produce their product. This has created an imbalance in the bourbon industry, as the larger producers are now able to outcompete small producers for market share.

Magic — that ’ s the best way to describe the Lytton High School Rugby Academy ’ s Hurricanes Championship campaign. It wasn ’ s their first time in the tournament and it was a momentous one for the players. They played the most exciting game to start a high school rugby union season ever. And, like every game to this point in the season, they played it as a team. They knew they could win the match, and they believed their teammates could help them do that. “I think this has been a very positive thing for everyone,” head coach Nick Horswill said after the match.

MELBOURNE, Australia - Defending champion Victoria Azarenka struggled to hold off injured American Jamie Hampton 6-4, 4-6, 6-2 on Saturday before advancing to the fourth round of the Australian Open. Hampton, who needed a medical timeout for a lower back problem before she served out the second set and winced in pain, frequently on the verge of tears, throughout the third, still managed to hit 41 winners to keep the top-ranked Azarenka under pressure. Azarenka appeared frustrated at times, but overcame an early break and fended off triple break point in the seventh game of the deciding set before clinching the match in 2 hours, 9 minutes.

COUNTY and district councillor for Axminster , Cllr Ian Hall , has spoken out on his support for the recently-introduced National Planning Policy Framework . The policy is designed to improve the performance of local authorities in implementing new or existing legislation and ensures that their policies are in line with national planning law. Cllr Hall said he is pleased the policy is the first step in giving local authorities the tools they need to deliver a sustainable and prosperous economy. “It is particularly important now, given the uncertainty around the economic outlook, to ensure that there is a coherent approach to development,” he said.

The life of the mind puzzles poets and neuroscientists who go about mapping it and labeling it, and, in my case, trying to find it. Thought itself is something to ponder in the Irish tradition and so, there are lots of concepts in the Irish language involving the mind, dreaming, and imagination. I'm only a student myself, so many of the nuances will be lost on me, but language is about conversation. I would love to hear native speakers offer more sophisticated thoughts on the vocabulary of Irish thought.

The best element of M. Night Shyamalan's 2017 horror film, Split - and one of the few things it did right - happened at the very end. The brief, surprising reveal of Bruce Willis reprising his David Dunn character from Unbreakable created a shared universe that Shyamalan was all-too-eager to exploit. Unfortunately, there's a wide gulf between teasing fans with a momentary appearance and building a story around it. Glass, the third film in what has become a trilogy, comes across as a mix of half-formed ideas baked into an uneven casserole.

The Israeli ambassador and almost all staff have been evacuated from the country ’ s embassy in the Jordanian capital, Amman, according to the foreign ministry. Israel and Jordan are negotiating a peace deal, which would allow for the return of the Israeli embassy there. On Thursday morning, Israeli Foreign Minister Avigdor Liberman telephoned the Jordanian foreign ministry. The ambassador to Israel, Yitzhak Ben-Zaken, said in an interview with The Associated Press that Israel’s ambassador was ordered to leave, but that the situation could change. He wouldn’t say why he was told to leave, or how he responded.

Malawi Parliament has started soliciting views on interest rate capping bill which an opposition legislator moved in the 193 strong house, but the move was rejected by the majority. The opposition has accused the government of delaying the interest rate capping bill for last two years. According to reports, in his statement on the bill, Mumbi Mahazela said that members should be paid their due as their services should be valued and the salaries should not be paid late. This statement came in the last week of the parliament session that was held between the second and eighth day.

April 24 , 2014 , 10:30 a.m. At a few smart legacy news companies , there ’ s digital advertising. They don ’ t have much digital advertising at the moment , but they are beginning to figure it out. You might think that these big media companies have done this kind of work since the dawn of the Internet Age. But they actually haven ’ t been doing it all along. The first big digital advertising company was born in 1997, when AOL purchased an ad agency, which then created ads for AOL and its online service.

Sen. Martha McSally urged secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault. Sen. Martha McSally continued to speak about her experiences with sexual assault Thursday during a keynote address to service secretaries and university leaders about combating sexual assault during a conference at the U.S. Naval Academy in Annapolis, Maryland. During her 30-minute address, McSally, R-Ariz., urged service secretaries of the Army, Navy, and Air Force and universities to take a fresh look at the environments that can lead to sexual assault — such as putting 21-year-old service members in charge of 18-year-olds.

In Lean Times , Creative Bakers Turn To Desperation Pies : The Salt Vinegar pie and green tomato pie do so well with this crust because of their simplicity and freshness, but they do require a little more work on your part. The crust doesn't have to be thick like a traditional short crust pie, or flaky. Here is a crust recipe that can be made in less than an hour, with the crust easily rolling out into a 9" pie. As with most piecrusts, the key is not making the pie dough too dry or wet, or adding too much butter.

Google is trying to save presentation audiences from having to sit through long rambling questions with a new feature it’s quietly rolling out to Google Duo video chat apps. Users can now answer a question in one second by pressing the space bar, rather than the buttons on the Duo app itself. “We’ve noticed some people would like a single press of space bar, rather than multiple presses of buttons on the screen. This will give you an extra second,” a Google engineer wrote in a support note to the Duo blog.

There are a range of useful commands which can be accessed through the game console, or entered into the .con files. To open the console, press the tilde (~) key. To close the console, press ~ again. You can bring up a full list of commands for each category (Console, Game, Chat, Renderer, Sound, Admin, Debug and Profiler) in the console by typing the group name (e.g. Game.) and then pressing the TAB key repeatedly to first see the group list, then the correct usage of the commands.

What exactly separates people from machines? Two things, actually: creativity and empathy. No matter what gets developed in AI, these are the two elements that can keep the agency services business alive, and keep marketers busy for years to come. AI is a complement to what you do. It is intended to augment your abilities. AI can create a layer of efficiency that companies are otherwise lacking and free them up to be doing the kind of work with incremental impact. Agencies have succeeded in the past because they are creative.

Rep. Francis D. Gibson speaks on the Utah Inland Port Authority Bill that he sponsored as Utah Legislators gather at the capitol to discuss legislation during a news conference, Tuesday, Dec. 3, 2013, in Logan. Gibson has introduced bills in the past to help address the problem and is hopeful his latest bill will bring much needed relief for some of the 600-plus commercial businesses that have failed to get permits to use the inland port. Gibson says his latest bill, HB26, will do just that, although it's unlikely that a bill that has been introduced by him would pass without changes.

LL Cool J has become the first rapper to receive the prestigious Kennedy Centre Honour at the weekend , in a star-studded event in Toronto. The rapper was given the award by Toronto Mayor John Tory to honour his contributions to the city and his commitment to community service in Toronto. It was an honour to accept this prestigious award and I want to thank Mayor John Tory and the members of Council, the Toronto Raptors, the City of Toronto and my colleagues from all across the city for making this evening possible for me.

DALLAS - Like many Americans, Martin Jacobson was overjoyed that Navy SEALs had captured and killed Osama bin Laden. But the Dallas resident felt a deeper connection to the men who hunted down the mastermind of the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks. Decades ago, he was one of them. During World War II, Jacobson was part of elite groups that were predecessors to the SEALs. The secretive force is used to staying out of the spotlight, but it's back in the headlines following the bin Laden killing. "I'm just proud of the SEALs," said Jacobson, 89.

Pharmaceutical giant Pfizer wiped the floor with Wall Street's third-quarter estimates, but one comment made by CEO Ian Read during the earnings call suggests weakness on the horizon. Pharmaceutical juggernaut Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) dazzled Wall Street once again by reporting better-than-expected third-quarter earnings results before the opening bell on Wednesday. For the quarter, Pfizer delivered $12.09 billion in revenue, a 2% year-over-year decline, while its reported net income dropped 20% to $2.13 billion from $2.67 billion. Pfizer's EPS dropped a similar 19% to $0.34 from $0.42.

[Written by Jonathan Starling] It is not unusual to read and hear complaints about the amount of trash talk that the two main parties indulge, a phenomenon which seems to be magnified during election campaigns. And yet, seldom do these two parties actively seek to engage in real trash talk. And by that, I mean talking about trash in the literal sense! And yet the issue of trash and waste in general is one that affects us all, touching on matters of public health, social cohesion and tourism, amongst others!

A Delhi court today granted bail to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal 's relative Vinay Bansal in a case related to alleged irregularities in land deals and power distribution. New Delhi:

In a setback for the Delhi government and chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, the High Court of Delhi today granted bail to the Chief Minister's relative Vinay Bansal, arrested by CBI on charges of land deals, in connection with land allocation to him in 2011. The case involves alleged irregularities in land allotment of land for construction and development in various areas in North Delhi. Kejriwal's mother has filed a complaint accusing Bansal of favouring his brother-in-law.

The traditionally conservative Michelin guide , celebrating its 100th year and a new , leaner look for its mascot , has given its green light to all the new cars and trucks of this decade, saying they have achieved the highest standards for their class of car. Even if they are not the fastest, prettiest, most sporty or best looking, they say they are the best for the roads. One of the biggest changes this year is in the diesel category, which is where most of BMW’s sales are coming from.

Cemetery Road is cleared of the June 27th lava flow and has been repaved. PĀHOA, December 16, 2015 – The County of Hawai‘i Department of Public Works is pleased to announce that the Cemetery Road Restoration project has been completed and the functionality of the original 12 foot one lane roadway has been restored. The reconstruction work of removing the lava associated with the October 25, 2014 Pu‘u O‘o Volcanic Eruption that crossed onto Cemetery Road and paving the 500-foot stretch of roadway was completed within the forty working day time frame.

ALBANY — Gov. Andrew Cuomo — who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers — called the popular social media site an “elitist bulletin board” Tuesday and said he doesn’t look at it. “We created an echo chamber for the elitists to talk to themselves and, this little bubble of an unreal universe that banned political intelligence, believes is representative of the world,” he said in a WAMC radio interview. Cuomo has two Twitter accounts, one with 853,000 followers and the other with 10,400. He said during his re-election campaign last year, he was told by reporters to watch Twitter goings-on.

It 's important first to take a few moments to work out how you want to use Facebook . Your first step should be to see if you already have a Facebook application on your phone or tablet. It might not be the kind of app you need, but that could be the first step in making it. The next step is to find out where your profile picture is stored. If you don’t remember where it is, then the image will not appear in your news feeds and you can’t share it.

Less than two years ago, I was seated at a South Atlantic League baseball game (low A ball) between the Hagerstown Suns and the visiting Greensboro Grasshoppers. Behind me were two Greensboro pitchers — Trevor Richards and Ben Meyer. They were charting the game. As I discussed in this post, neither pitcher seemed destined to make the major leagues. Richards had been undrafted in 2015 coming out of a small college, and thus had to start his career with the Gateway Grizzlies of the Frontier League, an independent league. The Miami Marlins signed him in 2016 and he was pitching well for Greensboro.

The main task of North Korea's junior minister for re-information is to refute everything ever said by French intellectuals. One year he did a special on Jean-Paul Sartre and began with Sartre's assertion that "Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do". As it was a drowsy Friday afternoon, the junior minister simply made a quick call and renamed his local football team 4.25 Sports Club. This made Sartre look very silly indeed, because the club play all their matches at 4.25pm. In fact every time they play, their fans chant "Are you watching, Jean-Paul Sartre?"

Britain 's double Olympic triathlon champion Alistair Brownlee claimed a dominant win at the Ironman 70.3 in Dubai in his final professional race. Brownlee will now focus on preparing for next season, which will likely take place in Europe, where he will race the full ironman distance in May. Brownlee had a great day at Dubai, but his time was not as fast as his last two times at the Ironman 70.3 at Kona in Hawaii in 2012 and last year in Kona in Maui. Brownlee raced hard all day at the Dubai course on Saturday morning.

A woman was threatened when she was approached by a stranger in a street in Lindfield yesterday afternoon. Police say that the woman was walking along Barncroft Drive, Lindfield, between 4.45pm and 5.30pm yesterday when she was grabbed by a white bearded man in his late 40s or early 50s. The man made verbal threats to her but ran off after a group of about 15 teenagers walked into Barncroft Drive. Police say the woman was not physically injured. A spokesman said: “The investigation into this incident is at an early stage and the exact motive has not been established.

WASHINGTON -- A Marine who was declared a deserter nearly 10 years ago after disappearing in Iraq and then returning home to California was awarded the Purple Heart last week, the first ever to receive the medal for an Iraq combat veteran. Marine Corps Recruiting Command released the news of the award on Twitter Thursday. “On behalf of all active duty Marines and Sailors, the award of the Purple Heart is a great day,” Marine Cmdr. David R. Brown, commanding officer of Marine Combat Development Command headquartered in San Diego, said in a statement.

It happens: You hit the snooze button once, twice, then three times, so when you're finally showered, dressed and ready to tackle the day, you're already behind schedule. Oftentimes that causes you to skip breakfast completely. Turns out, your breakfast habit is one time-saving step that should not be skipped. First off, eating a nutritious, high-protein, balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to kick-start your brain, improving concentration and performance. Plus breakfast is linked to better weight control, as it provides your body energy and may reduce hunger later in the day.

Seton Catholic ’ s Jenna Barker set a sectional record by winning the 1,600-meter run in 5 minutes , 13.04 seconds at the Class 5A/4A state championship meet Friday, March 31. That was also the fastest time ever by a Class 5A runner in the history of the sectional meet, which was held in LaRue Stadium in Tampa. Seton Catholic won in a time of 13:04.06. It was a season-best 1:06.05 by Barker, who now holds the sectional record for the 800 meters in the Class 5A/4A ranks. She ran a 1:19.83 in 2011 to win the title in 3:59.96.

A rumored-to-be pregnant Kylie Jenner was finally caught in public. The Kardashian-Jenner family has yet to confirm Kylie's pregnancy, but multiple outlets, including TMZ, said she was about five months pregnant and expecting a girl with boyfriend Travis Scott back in September. LAS VEGAS—Bitdefender has updated its network security gadget, now known as New Bitdefender Box or Box Version 2, which is designed to protect home networks and Internet of Things devices from outside attack. The original Bitdefender Box extended security protection to devices that could not run antivirus software themselves, specifically IoT devices. By moving security protection to the network level, Box products protect all the devices on the network, including fridges, game consoles, and security cameras.

In the third quarter of 2018 , luxury home prices increased 3.2 % year over year to an average of $9,890 per month in the Vancouver area. For the same period in 2017 , home prices increased 3.5 percent to average of $9,090 per month. In other cities, the price increase was more modest at 0.3% and 2.4 percent for the same quarter, respectively. This trend continued in the second quarter of 2018 , when home prices increased 0.9% and 1.4 percent year over year to $8,600 and $8,250 per month, respectively; the price increases were lower than in the previous quarter.

Bob Cannard shovels compost which orignally came from San Francisco food scraps at Green String Farms outside Petaluma , Calif.

Food scraps

The idea of the compost pile began with an idea to put food scraps into the ground to make a living soil where all life can survive. That’s how compost piles work, where organic waste decomposes into humus which is rich in organic nutrients, minerals and micro-organisms. But it takes time for them to do their job. For most food scraps to go into compost, they must come from organic material which has not been sprayed, doused, treated with pesticides or genetically altered.

`` Of all the German surface warships , the British feared Bismarck the most . Her size , speed , and range were formidable . She was also the most heavily armed German naval vessel ever built. In fact, her four main guns were more powerful than the main armament of many British warships , and she had an armor belt that stretched more than 1,000 feet across the hull . Her firepower and firepower alone made her the premier German surface warship of World War I . But when the battleship's boilers stopped working , her engine room became a death trap .

( CNN ) - After 8 hours of deliberations Thursday , a St. Louis jury awarded $ 4.69 billion to the family of a woman who died of heatstroke after visiting a Texas hospital in 2005. The jury also ordered the hospital, University of St. Thomas, to pay the family $ 1 billion, $ 100 million of which would be refunded to the family if the hospital is successful in its appeals. The jury heard testimony about what happened on the evening of May 12, 2005. The St. Louis Post-Dispatch reports the testimony of the woman's husband and son.

Google is updating its Google Drive Android app with a new Material Design look, as well as a few new features. First is a small improvement to its search tool – it now updates the results while you’re typing to save you some time while looking for a document. Next up, you can now add messages when you share a file to give details about why you’re sharing, as well as change privacy sharing for files. Finally, the PDF viewer is getting an update to let you search for and copy text from a PDF without needing to enter a separate app.

ZAMBOANGA CITY—Terror is stalking residents of the island town of Pata in Sulu and it’s not coming from extremists, but politicians. Residents appealed for government help to prevent another attack on their island community which one of them said was triggered by the residents’ refusal to commit support to the incumbent mayor, Anton Burahan. “We are powerless,” said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangon, one of the villages on Pata island. Jubail recalled an attack on the island town allegedly by followers of Burahan on Jan. 2 who were armed with M203 grenade launcher, and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

VOLGOGRAD/GELENDZHIK , Russia ( Reuters ) - Iceland will try not to melt in the fierce heat of Volgograd when temperatures in the city hit a record-breaking 46 degrees C (115.6 F), the nation’s prime minister said on Monday. Iceland’s Met Office said on Monday evening it expected the heat to rise as high as 48 degrees C (118.8 F) on Wednesday and Thursday. Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdottir said the record heat wave, which would be the second-worst on record for the world’s northernmost territory, had been predicted before it began last week.

Casey Brumbeloe , a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School , has been selected to serve on the Alabama Statewide Honor Roll for his exceptional academic achievement at the high school. The senior was nominated by his teachers, friends and peers as one of the most promising young men of his year. His nomination was accepted by school administrators. Brumbeloe will be presented with an award of recognition at a later date. The honor roll is an all-state award which is presented yearly to an outstanding senior in all Alabama public and private high schools. The selection was announced at the annual Alabama Statewide Honors Assembly held Tuesday evening, Nov. 19.

Scout Gil Brandt of the Dallas Cowboys, the last member of the original group that built the Cowboys from scratch, was dismissed by new owner Jerry Jones on Tuesday. "(Jones) told me finances was the reason, that he's losing $29,000 a day," Brandt said. "He'll probably fire four or five scouts, including Bob Griffin. "I told him I know I did as good a job as possible. I feel good about the 29 years I had with the Cowboys. But it's a bad way for it to end.

DALLAS - Like many Americans , Martin Jacobson was overjoyed that Navy SEALs had captured and killed Osama bin Laden. Now he wants President Obama to take action to help the nearly 100 SEALs who are still missing, like him, and wounded. The father-of-three was part of the mission that killed bin Laden in 2011 and, with the help of several other SEALs on his boat, made it to the Pakistani coast. "We wanted him dead, but there was nothing more we could do," said Jacobson. But he and his fellow SEALs have never been seen again.

Summary : Southeast Toyota Distributors , LLC ( SET ) is recalling certain model year 2016 Toyota Yaris , Rav4 , and Tundra trucks and SUVs to repair front passenger airbags and driver's side airbags. In an accident, the passenger seatbelt can become entangled with the passenger airbag during a frontal collision. This could potentially cause serious injury or death. Owners may be eligible for free repairs or a reduction of their repair costs. Dealers may be eligible for discounts or credits to the purchase price for vehicles they repair as a condition of selling their vehicles.

Rawalpindi : The secondary students of Sadeeqa’s Learning System (SLS) Montessori & High School celebrated Autism Awareness Day, says a press release. The Harley Street Senior Branch held a special assembly in this regard creating awareness among the students about the Autism Spectrum Disorder by highlighting its causes, symptoms and ways to cope up with it. The special assembly started off with an introduction about the day outlined in the form of a dialogue between a doctor and a student discussing various features of the disorder. The students were informed about the severity of the disorder depending upon the age, its causes and treatment.

A family travels to a remote island in southern Chile . In the trip they try to convince the grandparents to sell the house they live in. Their plan fails but they find the house has a new owner and a new owner wants to renovate. The house has been empty and dilapidated for more than a year. The family had tried to keep the house occupied by bringing furniture in to sell or give to friends. The owner wants to make changes and they want to renovate the house. Brandon Raub, the former Marine taken into custody after federal agents questioned him about Facebook posts critical of the government, has been transferred to a Veterans Administration (VA) psychiatric ward on the other side of the Virginia. Austria , Spain and South Korea have been approved as founding members of the Asia Infrastructure and Investment Bank (AIIB). South Korea and Germany were approved as founding members , the other two are Japan and India. The bank is to focus on areas including infrastructure development, financial services, and real estate, among other sectors. The bank was announced as one of the most important financial organisations in Asia on Friday during the World Economic Forum, held in the Russian city of Vladivostok. The bank was launched at a press conference by Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong at the Forum on Friday .

THE Lifetime TV channel says it will air a movie about Whitney Houston and Bobby Brown’s relationship. Shiv Sena executive president Uddhav Thackeray has urged Union agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar to resign from the Union cabinet and come to Maharashtra to protect the interest of farmers reeling under drought. Uddhav met the family members of the deceased and though he did not offer any instant financial assistance, he promised to bear the expenses of his kids' education.

The ride-hailer returns to Taiwan with a redesigned business model that it claims will meet local regulations this time. Uber halted its services in Taiwan two months ago, but it's set to return this Thursday. You just can't stop Uber, as Taiwan has just discovered. The global ride-hailing service will relaunch its operations in the nation this Thursday after exiting two months ago, reports the Central News Agency. Uber ceased operations in Taiwan in February after it was dealt with penalties amounting to nearly $36 million under a new law barring unlicensed taxi services.

Delicious , the original king of shared online bookmarking , is now in the hands of YouTube 's founders , and you don't want to miss out on what they're doing to it! As YouTube becomes the new home to Delicious , Delicious and Delicious Pro will remain free to download, but the videos you've saved there will all be linked to a single YouTube page where you won't be able to view them all anymore, unless you visit each page separately. Here's where things get interesting, because there's more to Delicious , than just what you see in YouTube .

LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will have surgery Wednesday to repair torn ligaments in his severely sprained right ankle. An MRI exam on Monday confirmed the Kings' leading scorer will need corrective surgery that will keep him out indefinitely. Kopitar injured his ankle when he fell awkwardly during the Kings' victory over Colorado last Saturday. Coach Terry Murray initially said the Slovenian All-Star broke his ankle and would be out for at least six weeks, but the Kings eventually determined the injury was a high ankle sprain. Kopitar leads the Kings with 25 goals and 43 assists.

BRUSSELS ( Reuters ) - The European Union is investigating a cyber hack of its diplomatic communications , allegedly by Iran and the National Iranian oil Co , the agency said on Tuesday. A spokeswoman at the EU’s external relations department said a preliminary report from the agency in Brussels, where it is based, suggested that information on official communications with other EU member countries could have been obtained. “The cyber attack was conducted in June 2018 and involved the use of a computer program that was not previously known to be used in Iran’s internal communications systems,” the spokeswoman added.

Will UBS Tap Bob McCann Or Sallie Krawcheck For Top Wealth Management Job? Former Merill Lynch brokerage head Bob McCann and former Citigroup wealth management bosslady Sallie Krawcheck are both under consideration to take over the top job at UBS's wealth management unit. Investment News reported that two industry recruiters say both names are "already circulating." Earlier, the Financial Times had reported the UBS new chief executive, Oswald Grubel, had decided not to sell the company's US wealth management business yet, despite speculation in recent months that he might offload this business following tax-evasion accusations and the ensuing scandal.

Northern Ireland was today branded the race hate capital of Europe , in a report on racist violence in the country. A new report has revealed that hate crime has risen by more than 40 per cent on the previous year, with police reporting more than 400 anti-Muslim and anti-Irish assaults in just one year. The latest figures were released by the Ulster Unionists yesterday as the party sought to highlight the problem of bigotry in the region. Ulster Unionist Assembly member, Jim Wells, described the increase in hate crime as "outrageous."

DARTMOUTH — On June 14 , Flag Day , the students of the James M. Quinn Elementary School in Dartmouth gathered under a giant American flag for the school’s annual field trip to the Museum of New Hampshire History. And after the tour, they marched in a rally to protest what had happened that morning. The students had learned that a woman had been beaten by two men who had come to the museum to look at items on display that they were planning on stealing. According to the police account, one man struck the woman in the face and kicked the other.

A CANCER expert has hit on a way to kill tumours in two hours — using light. The technique involves a single jab with a chemical then a flash of ultraviolet. Cancer cells in lab mice were found to self-destruct, with up to 95 per cent dead in two hours. Professor Matthew Gdovin revealed the cells — which he injected with the chemical compound nitrobenzaldehyde — turned too acidic to survive. He said after patenting his “photodynamic” therapy: “There are many different types of cancers. “The one thing they have in common is their susceptibility to this induced cell suicide.

It's hard to underestimate the success and increasing power of Amazon. Their market cap hovers just under $1 trillion. Their growth rates have been astounding. By most estimates Amazon now accounts for nearly 50% of all US e-commerce revenues, roughly 5% of all retail and is significantly bigger than their next 10 competitors combined. One study has some 55% of all online product searches starting at Amazon. This week a report that Amazon is considering opening up to 3,000 of their Amazon Go cashierless convenience stores by 2021 grabbed a lot of attention, despite their only having opened up a fourth location a few days ago.

Warning : There are graphic images in the video above . SODUS , N.Y. ( WHEC ) -- A new study shows a strong correlation between an increased risk of Alzheimer's disease and a daily intake of sugar, which researchers say could be a major health risk. The report was published online in the Annals of Internal Medicine. For years, researchers have known that dietary sugar can increase your risk of developing the most common form of dementia. The risk is linked to a number of factors such as high blood pressure, obesity and diabetes.

According to analyses by Net experts, the mass-mailing MyDoom worm, which began propagating yesterday, is the fastest-spreading software virus to date with an effect that could linger for years. MyDoom, which is also know as Novarg and Mimail.R, began spreading over the Internet yesterday. It now accounts for one of every 12 e-mails traveling through cyberspace worldwide, CNet News reported. The virus travels as an e-mail attachment that infects PCs whose users open the malicious file. Once open, the virus installs a stealth program that opens up a “back door” hackers then can use to take over infected computers.

Upbeat on their maiden housing project in Cavite, property developer Century Properties Group Inc. (CPG) and Mitsubishi Corp. signed on Wednesday a deal to create a new joint venture corporation that will bring to the property market around P57 billion worth of affordable homes in the next five years. Seeking to cover part of the country’s huge backlog of 6.6 million housing units, the new venture plans to launch about 15 new housing projects equivalent to around 33,000 housing units within the next five years. Each unit will be priced between the P1 million and P6 million range, targeting middle-income first time homebuyers.

The General Accounting Office reported last month that the Small Business Administration needs to improve its planning for a new small-business disaster program. It would allow businesses to borrow money from the federal government in case of unexpected natural or man-made disasters to help businesses with cash flow. The report was based on a study of 1,100 small and micro businesses in the U.S. The SBA was concerned about a small percentage of the SBA-supported companies being eligible to borrow in the event of a natural disaster because the businesses don’t meet certain criteria, such as having at least $250,000 in assets.

THOMAS Duffy is a sculptor who is preparing a commemorative bronze to celebrate the life of a father he never knew. But his own life is far removed from this work. It is the summer before he leaves for a year of art studies at the University of Texas in Austin and Thomas is about to start a four-year course at a prestigious art school, Yale University, in New Haven, Connecticut, where he has been accepted. “I just finished my art studies here in Austin and have been in New Haven for almost two months now,” said the 33-year-old.

According to analysts, the market is entering a consolidation phase after the recent run-up. NEW DELHI: A below-normal monsoon forecast by private weather agency Skymet proved to be a big dampener for stock benchmarks on Wednesday, which surrendered the day's gains after scaling all-time highs. According to Skymet, monsoon in 2019 is likely to be ‘below normal’ to the tune of 93 per cent of the long period average (LPA) of 887 mm for four months starting from June to September. This sent the bulls hurtling downwards, wiping off the earlier gains, as the market ended in negative territory.

Hearst Magazines will be busy in 2018, finalizing the acquisition of Rodale, snapping up some magazines in the Netherlands and upping the frequency of two of its newest titles. The Pioneer Woman Magazine, a joint venture with blogger and Food Network star Ree Drummond, published two sellout issues in 2017 and will double the frequency to four issues in 2018, Hearst Magazines president David Carey told staffers in his annual year-in-review letter. That’s a nice change for Airbnb, which tried on its own in 2014 to launch a magazine called Pineapple, which lasted only one issue.

Without a doubt , the addiction drama “ Beautiful Boy ” – not the slasher-flick “ Halloween ” – is the most interesting one of 2013. The movie – written and directed by Rian Johnson – depicts the rise and fall of a man (Ryan Gosling) and his love affair with a beautiful woman (Julia Roberts). As the plot unfolds, we learn more about the world of internet pornography – and, in the end, the world – than we thought was possible in a Hollywood feature. But as the film progresses, one question remains: can you really escape from a porn addiction?

I have just been reminded of why I quit financial journalism after 11 years in the saddle , including a four year period at the London Evening Standard and a nine year spell at the Financial Times, and then at the New York Times. I didn’t quit because of financial journalism, because I loved it as an excuse to go out with friends. But because I could not bear the smugness, the self-righteousness, the intellectual dishonesty of the journalism I saw around me. At first, I had to go against the grain. I had to write things that I believed in.

US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. US Consul General in Jeddah Ryan Gliha last week inaugurated the 2018 Gulfwest Food Expo at the Park Hyatt hotel in Jeddah. A communications professor at Texas A&M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the newspaper industry on our nation’s politics, so she did some research, which has been published in the Journal of Communication. If you have noticed what seems like a sharp increase in political polarization in the past few years, you are not imagining things. And, as Johanna Dunaway, and some colleagues at Colorado State and Louisiana State universities, found out, that polarization happened during a period of steady decrease in the number of local newspapers and journalists across the country.

A search for ‘toxic mold’ will result in hundreds of scary warnings and ‘studies,’ but few are based in science—and many are motivated by profit. Recently a patient of mine was hospitalized for liver failure due to alcohol. His history of liver disease was well documented, but he adamantly denied that anyone had warned him to avoid alcohol. An initial confession of “a few drinks” turned into much more with a little probing by different medical providers. Despite his liver being in a significant amount of shock, he was stable and lucky enough to still have most liver function intact.

The state Board of Corrections at a special called meeting this morning voted without dissent to name interim chief Kevin Murphy as acting director. The vote came after a series of events that led to the resignation of outgoing director Mark Cady, a move that angered and embarrassed Governor Scott Walker. Shortly after the decision to name Murphy the acting director, the Legislative Fiscal Agency (LFA) told the Board of Corrections that Cady’s firing was illegal under the state law and that it would be forced to reimburse the Department of Administration for the cost of Cady’s unused accrued compensation.

The sad demise of late veteran actor Kader Khan has left a void in the Hindi film industry that cannot be filled. Condolences have been pouring in for the late actor and his bereaved family ever since the news came out. The actor, who passed away at a hospital in Canada, was remembered on his funeral held recently in Canada. On Wednesdays, family members and fans of the actor gathered in Toronto to pay their last respects. At Kader Khan’s funeral in Toronto, Canada, actor’s son Sarfaraz thanked everyone for coming and being through this tough journey.

THE pound has surged against the euro and dollar as Theresa May announced plans to launch a snap election later this year. The Prime Minister plans to hold a General Election on June 8, she said outside Downing Street this morning. The pound is now at its highest level against the US dollar since last December. Sterling ended up 1.6 cents at 1.2762 against the US dollar - a four month high. It has also hit an eight-week high against the euro, ending at 1.1926. The pound had hit a three-week high against the dollar but dropped to 1.25, ahead of May's announcement.

SANTA MARIA, Brazil – Penny-pinching by a band known for its onstage pyrotechnic displays may have cost more than 230 people their lives at a nightclub in southern Brazil, according to a state police inspector leading the investigation into this weekend's deadly blaze. Inspector Marcelo Arigony told reporters at a news conference Tuesday that members of the band knowingly purchased flares meant for outdoor use because they cost a mere $1.25 a piece, compared with the $35 price tag for an indoor flare. "The flare lit was for outdoor use only, and the people who lit them know that," said Arigony.
