It 's hard to underestimate the success and increasing power of Amazon . Their market cap hovers just under $100 billion, and has a current market cap of $89.4 billion. The company was founded in 1994 , but didn't have any sales until 2002. According to analyses by Net experts , the mass-mailing MyDoom worm , which began in late 2001 , infects around 1.7 billion PCs each month , and is widely thought to have infected between 150 and 300 million PCs at the time of writing. In the past week alone it has infected a number of websites (such as Microsoft's web page and AOL's homepage) , and it seems to be spreading fast. It is currently spreading through the Internet by infecting users with malicious files and sending the infected files to a wide range of sites.

Dublin : Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland 's first bill on abortion , legalising the practice in cases where a woman's life is at risk. The bill aims to establish a new category of "competent and responsible" consent - something which is not legally recognised by Ireland's current laws but which would be legalised here. The Bill will be voted on by the Irish Parliament on Monday when it is likely to pass with a margin of around 90 votes. Ireland will become the second country in the world, after Iceland in 2014, to legalise abortion.

It happens : You hit the snooze button once , twice , then three times , so when you 're up to speed you find you 've hit the same button three times in the morning and the same one twice at noon, and so on and so on. This is not a problem with the alarm clock per se, but rather it indicates that you are suffering from some kind of sleep-deprivation syndrome. If this happens to you, it's a sign that you should give your mind a rest. The next time you hit your snooze button you 'll wake up feeling refreshed , refreshed, refreshed.

A communications professor at Texas A & M University wanted to find out about the effects of changes to the way that science was done when he went to college. In particular, he wondered what the effects of changes to the quality of science instruction would be. A group of his colleagues decided to find out what science was, and how it is done. So they created an experimental assignment involving a group of students in science class. They assigned half of them to complete a study about evolution, while the other half to do something completely different: they were to create and write a science paper.

THE Australian men 's water polo team have come agonisingly close to upsetting three-time defending champions Hungary in their classification final at the World League Championships, but have fallen short of an unprecedented fourth-place finish and a medal at the competition. After leading 3-0 in the final round of the tournament, the Australians lost 2-1 to Germany in the semi-final before falling 2-1 to Germany in their final group stage match, meaning they will now play the winner of that match to determine fifth. It is Australia's worst finish at the World League Championships since losing the gold-medal play-offs for the 2002 and 2006 world championship squads.

Dublin: Lawmakers overwhelmingly voted on Friday to back Ireland's first bill on abortion, legalising the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem the woman's life at risk from her pregnancy, as the predominantly Catholic country took its first legislative step away from an outright ban. Exhausted legislators applauded Friday's 127-31 vote, while outside the parliament gates abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their smartphones. It capped a grueling debate that locked lawmakers in argument from Wednesday morning to 5am Thursday and, after a pause for sleep, through midnight Friday.

Want to end the war on whistleblowers? Revise the Espionage Act. Over the past 100 years, the act has metastasized into a tool for government secrecy. The evolution of the Espionage Act has done much to shape the freedom of political debate in the modern U.S. What began as a vague statute that gave President Woodrow Wilson power to jail critics and censor the news media during World War I has transformed into a powerful law that regulates political discourse by policing secrets, not speech. Censorship did not end when the war did. It evolved. Despite its name, the Espionage Act has always been a broad statute.

An American Civil Liberties Union lawyer asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco today to block a California law legalizing same-sex marriage because it violates the Constitution by denying equal protection and equal rights to gays and lesbians in the military. Lawyers on the case, which challenges the constitutionality of the Military Readiness Act (MRA), were arguing for a preliminary injunction against California’s Proposition 8 last week when they learned they had lost on a motion to dismiss. The two-year-old case will now move to the merits, where it is likely to go to the Supreme Court.

VIDEO : On March 30 , 2017 , Atlanta drivers on I-85 north found themselves in a stunning situation when the left lane suddenly became part of the right lane of traffic without any warning. As the left lane is the leftmost lane, the driver in the right lane took the left lane into the traffic without any warning. The video shows that the right lane began to merge with traffic after the vehicle came over the line. The left lane continued to merge as the vehicle came into the lane. The vehicle then slowed to a crawl as the vehicle merged into the right lane of traffic.

New research suggests mice with induced Alzheimer’s-like symptoms had improved cognitive function when given a synthetic estrogen-like hormone. “This synthetic hormone improved behavior much the way that estrogen does,” said study leader Dr. Christian Pike, associate professor at the University of Southern California’s School of Gerontology. But unlike estrogen, which enlarges the uterus and is a known risk factor for endometrial and breast cancer, PPT caused no obvious changes to the animals’ reproductive tract. “This may be a promising strategy to maximize hormone therapy benefits and minimize its risk,” said Pike.

Albion striker Simon Cox has emerged as a a transfer target for Championship club Derby County. Rams boss Nigel Clough is keeping close tabs on the 23-year-old and will consider a loan swoop if there is any encouragement from the Hawthorns. Sources in the East Midlands confirmed today that the former Reading and Swindon man is on a list of forwards being watched by Clough, who is looking to strengthen his strikeforce. The Pride Park chief is also keen on Scunthorpe's highly-rated Gary Hooper, Sheffield United's Billy Sharp and Everton's James Vaughan, who he signed on loan last season.

New York bachelor Bobby (Matthew Scott) takes stock of his romantic life in “Company,” at Signature Theatre through June 30. Arlington  For Bobby, the word marriage is actually a sentence — a jail sentence. A perpetual bachelor, he is turning 35 and surrounded by five married couples who all have an opinion about his lifestyle in the Stephen Sondheim musical “Company,” now playing at Signature Theatre. Whether with envy or mild disapproval, “Company” features Bobby’s friends battling him and one another in a series of comic scenarios as he struggles to commit to commitment.
